job_title: Life Sciences Sales Leader - North Region - Research & Bioprocess
job_summary: High profile sales management role covering QLD, NSW and NZ. Report directly to the business leader and manage the activities of our sales team.
job_ad_details:
About us

GE Healthcare provides transformational medical technologies and services that are shaping a new age of patient care. Our broad expertise in medical imaging and information technologies, medical diagnostics, patient monitoring systems, drug discovery, bio-pharmaceutical manufacturing technologies, performance improvement and performance solutions services help our customers to deliver better care to more people around the world at a lower cost. In addition, we partner with healthcare leaders, striving to leverage the global policy change necessary to implement a successful shift to sustainable healthcare systems.

About the role

The Life Sciences Sales Leader  will be responsible for the Northern region (QLD, NSW & NZ) and managing the activities of Account Managers and Product Specialists for the full life science and service portfolio reporting directly to the ANZ Life Science General Manager.

This position is responsible for attaining sales objectives for each territory and product modality for the Northern Region as a whole.

Your key duties will include:

  • Directly manage, coach and motivate the sales team across Australia to achieve the financial targets of the business
  • Develop and implement sales strategies to drive short, medium and long term growth in the assigned sales market
  • Proactively use available resources to create new sales opportunities and assist in managing existing opportunities through to closure
  • Development of long-term customer relationships through the ability to identify and capitalise on opportunities that immediately satisfy customer needs
  • Ensure seamless teamwork with the Product Specialist, Bioprocess and Service teams, along with other channels to provide total customer satisfaction
  • Deploying resources to meet financial / operating objectives including orders, revenue, sales margin and base cost control
  • Support the accurate compilation of reporting data and disseminated across the team as required

About you

To be successful in this role you will have:

  • Successfully lead a sales team in a similar role for a significant period of time

  • Strong management credentials from a life sciences background

  • Demonstrable experience liaising with internal and external customers

  • Degree qualifications and interest in the life sciences sector

  • Post graduate qualification in a business related discipline e.g. MBA or similar

  • The ability to effectively communicate to external customers, global counterparts and to team members in other functional organisations

  • Strong presentation skills (public speaking and lecture experience desired)

  • Teaching or training experience including design and delivery or basic and advanced concepts to technical and / or non-technical individuals

  • Proven ability to contribute in a multi-disciplinary team environment

  • Demonstrated ability to understand and present complex material in understandable terms

  • Must be willing to travel (estimated 30+%)

This opportunity will suit someone with exceptional communication skills; someone who can deliver clear and concise messages, both verbally and in writing. You will be a clear thinker with attention to detail, and have the ability to manage your time and prioritise in a fast paced environment. You will be passionate about the customer, and have the ability to make quick decisions.

What do we offer?

In return, GE offers you:

  • Competitive salary, fully maintained company vehicle (or a car allowance), and bonuses

  • Global exposure with opportunities to apply for interesting and challenging roles around the world

  • The opportunity to participate in GE's globally recognized people development programs

  • Access to a wide range of benefits including flexible working arrangements and great discounts from leading retailers

  • "Take 5" leave program which gives employees access to an extra five days paid annual leave every year.

  • GE also offers a further 3 weeks of unpaid leave; we recognise work life balance may be an important consideration in your next career move

How to apply

This is truly an exceptional opportunity for the right individual to further develop their career & make their mark with a global employer of choice. If you are passionate about making a difference, we would love to hear from you. Please click the Apply button below to be directed to the GE Careers website.
 

GE is an amazing brand that opens doors like no other Our business is commmitted to improving the quality of human life Big earning potential and unlimited career opportunities Base + super + car/allowance + bonus scheme

job_summary: Employment Type:  Permanent Full TimePosition Classification:  Health Manager Level 3Remuneration: $108,255 - $123,411Hours Per Week: ...
job_ad_details:
Employment Type:  Permanent Full Time
Position Classification:  Health Manager Level 3
Remuneration: $108,255 - $123,411
Hours Per Week:  38
Requisition ID:  REQ35278

  • Be a part of an organisation that makes a difference in cancer control in NSW
  • Use your project management experience to support improved integrated cancer systems.
  • Join a dynamic and committed team to change the face of cancers in NSW

Where you'll be working

The Cancer Institute NSW is Australia’s first state wide-cancer control agency, established in 2003 to lessen the impact of cancer across the state.


Working at the Cancer Institute NSW means joining a team of committed and dedicated staff who are proud to be part of the Institute’s purpose of facilitating a co-ordinated, collaborative approach to change the face of cancers in NSW.


The Cancer Institute is a collaborative working environment that encourages diversity and inclusion in how we work and the way we work together.  Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples are encouraged to apply

What you'll be doing
As the System Improvement Project Manager you will be responsible for developing, leading and co-ordinating projects focused on supporting an integrated cancer system.  Such projects will include:

  • Supporting appropriate patient referral to specialists who are active members of a multi-disciplinary team;
  • Improving assessment and care pathways by supporting the localisation of optimal cancer care pathways (OCPs);
  • Patient reported measures; and
  • Providing easy access to reliable, evidenced based cancer information for people affected by cancer via online platform to support patient reported measures.

You will have excellent communication skills and ability to influence and negotiate with key internal and external stakeholders.  You will have demonstrated ability in leading and managing complex projects.


For your application to be considered
Your application must include a covering letter outlining how you meet each of the essential requirements outlined in the role description, your resume and a response to the pre-screening questions below:
  1. Please outline your experience and/or understanding of multidisciplinary teams (MDTs).  Please explain why multidisciplinary teams are important? (1 A4 page limit).

  2. Please outline how you would approach developing and delivering on a project outcome that was not your area of expertise.  Highlight five critical success factors (1 A4 page limit).


Need more information?


  1) Click here for the Position Description
  2) Find out more about applying for this position


For more information about the Cancer Institute NSW please visit www.cancerinstitute.org.au


For role related queries or questions contact Julie Callaghan on julie.callaghan@cancerinstitute.org.au

Applications Close:  Sunday, 22 April at 11.59 pm



The Ministry of Health will be relocating the Cancer Institute to St Leonards in mid 2020.


The Cancer Institute NSW is unable to offer salary packaging benefits.


The Cancer Institute NSW welcomes applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people from diverse cultural backgrounds and people with disabilities.  Please indicate if you have any accessibility requirements in your application or speak with the contact person should you be called for an interview.  We provide reasonable adjustment for people with a disability during the recruitment process and during their employment.

job_summary: Long term career role to join multi award winning National Building Contractor initially working as a Finishes Foreman (m/f) on a complex landmark job
job_ad_details:
This multi award winning National Building Contractor builds some of the most interesting, complex and challenging construction projects in Australia across a diverse range of project including commercial, industrial, education, hospitality, retail and other specialist projects. As a Company they have a very low turnover of staff and are firmly at the forefront of innovation.

Initially you will be working on an interesting landmark commercial project that encompasses a large technical space. The role will be include working on a complex façade and completing finishes as part of team. Although you may lean towards working on Finishes you have to be prepared to work on set out and structure in the future but where possible they will promote your expertise on complex finishes.

The team that you will be joining is first rate. Secondly the Company are in an enviable position where they can hand pick projects and most of the work that they do is negotiated. They have a loyal group of subcontractors; the jobs are organised, and everyone gets paid on time! As projects are very technically challenging you will always be engaged, always learning and developing your skill set. This organisation embraces cutting edge construction techniques. The environment is fast paced, but the team still have their feet firmly on the ground. Despite all their successes the culture is down to earth.

You need to have a lot of energy and enthusiasm, be passionate about construction, have a sharp eye for detail and be motivated to focus on meeting deadlines. 

Strange as it may seem to others you love working in a fast paced environment – you like to be challenged and you enjoy accomplishing things and seeing things through to the end. You have never been one to say “that will do” you want to make sure that projects are completed to a very high standard.  

You are a team player and you are aware of what is happening around you and you work with the subcontractors adopting a partnership approach to achieve great results. The subcontractors enjoy working with you because they can ask your advice and you are always willing to help them to keep the project moving along. 

Ideally you are a Carpenter by trade. You might be an all-rounder who is a good Foreman or General Foreman, but you just have a passion for the finishing trades. Maybe you are working for a Fit out and Refurbishment Contractor and have been looking for an opportunity to cross over to a main contractor to work on new build jobs. This could be a win / win; you can shine when it comes to the finishing trades and at the same time build your working knowledge of structure and gain a more rounded knowledge base. 

As this is a long-term role you could move into a General Foreman’s role in the future. The retention of staff with this builder is exceptional and there are many examples of individuals who have grown and developed with this organisation, fulfilling long term ambitions. 

For more information please call

Louise Clinton 

T: (02) 9664 8653

M: 0412 322 424

E: louise@clintonrecruitment.com.au

W: www.clintonrecruitment.com.au

Clinton Recruitment is the preferred recruitment agency of the Master Builders Association of New South Wales.

job_title: Invest In a Career Today - Courier/ Owner Driver
job_summary: Kings Transport are known Australia wide for the 1T industrial package that we now have back in stock and is available for purchase.
job_ad_details:
Kings industrial drivers tend to earn between 20-30 % more than all other 1T drivers in the industry. This is due to the fact that we have designed our vehicles to maximise their performance and carry capacity. We are currently looking for enthusiastic new people to join our industrial fleet. Experience is preferred however we will provide all necessary training prior to start up.

The 1 Tonne Industrial Package includes all of the below:

  • Triple Rack System able to carry up to 350kgs and lengths to 6.5 metres long
  • High Sides for Dangerous Goods Compliance
  • Rear Mounted Tailgate on the Tray Body (carrying up to 300kgs)

Included in the package is all your equipment and goods to complete even the hardest of jobs:

Our Industrial drivers are more than capable of averaging incomes upwards of $1,600 per week plus GST. In our peak periods, our best Industrial Drivers have been known to earn as high as $2,000 per week.

Driver Requirements:

  • Sound knowledge of Sydney Metropolitan area

Join our fleet today! Apply now or for more information contact Matthew Healey on 02 8199 8255. Please note that all interested drivers, need to be available to attend a 30 minute presentation.

job_summary: Fraser Dingo 4wd Adventure’s is a 4wd hire, hike and tagalong tour operator based in Hervey Bay, specialising in 4wd Adventures to Fraser Island.
job_ad_details:
Our 4wd Adventure Tour Company’s booking team is looking for an awesome new team member in our sales/booking office, ready to start in 1 week! Fraser Dingo 4wd Adventure’s is a 4wd hire, hike and tagalong tour operator based in Hervey Bay, specialising in 4wd Adventures to Fraser Island. We’re all about Eco adventuring and love sharing our passion with our large variety of customers! We are looking for someone who shares our passion of the outdoors, has the right experience, is switch-on and professional, yet outgoing and full of energy. Minimum commitment is 6-12 months so please don’t bother replying if you’re traveling around and are looking for a few weeks of work.

Who we are looking for:

    •    Experience in customer service, tourism, social media/marketing, computer and booking software savvy.

    •    Excellent level of English while simultaneously able to communicate with tourists from all around the world.

    •    Great multitasker, quick learner, being able to deal with processing large groups of people quickly and efficiently, answering the phone, taking bookings, communicating effectively but assertively!

    •    Able to sell products and tours through your enthusiasm and professionalism.

    •    Able to handle busy stressful moments but also able to keep yourself useful and busy during quiet moments! Ability to work independently and to think outside the box and confident in making your own decisions.

Skills you will need…..

    •    Making and maintaining tour bookings and sales involving use of computer software.

    •    Be confident with social media platforms and marketing strategies / ideas.

    •    Providing information and advice using company’s service and products.

    •    Communicating courteously with customers, sales representatives and business owners by telephone, email and face to face.

    •    Investigating and solving customers problems and complaints

    •    Administrative work such as handling sensitive customer information and documents.

    •    Precise attention to detail with no room for error when creating bookings and tour manifests.

    •    Processing vouchers and making weekly booking claims.

    •    General cleaning of the office / cleaning and processing tour equipment and laundry.

    •    Cash handling and cashing up.

    •    Opening and closing.

If you fit the above criteria then read on…

    •    Casual employment

    •    week days approx 5 hours a day (8am - 1pm)

    •    For the right candidate - there are opportunities of advancement and more hours.

    •    Get to work autonomously in a personal but also evolving and expanding company, we are open to your suggestions!!

    •    WHV/457 Visa’s welcome but ONLY with excellent English and committing to stay for 6 months

    •    Live in the beautiful Hervey Bay and get to travel to Fraser Island occasionally. Meet travelers from all around the world!

    •    Expressions of interest are to be emailed, with your cover letter & resume in PDF format please!

Please include a cover letter and current CV/Resume that states relevant experience Only serious candidates need apply! University Graduates & VET welcome with some relevant experience or interest!

job_title: In-Home Child Care | Child Protection | OOSH
job_summary: Are you an early years superstar? Is your passion for early childhood education and child Protection? Are you child focussed and outcome driven?
job_ad_details:
About the role

This is a unique role for individuals who share our philosophy for delivering quality outcomes for children often under challenging circumstances; Children with disabilities or additional needs, disadvantaged families, or families struggling with illness or mental health.

We are keen to engage Educators, Carers & Support Workers who can implement routines and structure over a period of weeks to achieve specific goals and outcomes within their family home.


Locations including but not limited to:

  • Narrabeen
  • Dee Why
  • Mona Vale
  • Curl Curl
  • Queenscliff
  • Frenchs Forest


Ideally you will have:

  • Qualification:
    • Early Childhood Education or Education Support (or working towards) - Certificate III | Diploma | Degree
  • 12 months experience working with children in one of the following:
    • Child Care Centre | Pre-School
    • Family Day Care
    • OSHC | Vacation Care
    • Nanny | Au pair
    • Child Related Social Work | Support
    • Teachers Aid | Disability Support
  • Proven ability to programme individualised activities to achieve specific goals and outcomes.
  • Reliable, proactive & child focused attitude
  • Awareness of issues pertaining to child protection & children "at risk"
  • Understand the requirements of mandatory reporting

Current or willing to obtain:

  • CPR, First Aid and Asthma & Anaphylaxis Certificates.
  • Working With Children Check (WWCC)
  • Police Check issued within 6 months



About Zest Care


Zest Care have been providing quality children's services into the homes of families for the past 16 years, providing education, care, early intervention & child protection services.


Zest Care works across NSW with families where a child’s well-being is at risk. Every family is unique and the risk may stem from a child, a parent (or guardian) or a combination of physical, mental and social factors.


What we offer

  • Flexible working hours - Full time and Part time hours available
  • Ongoing and casual placements available to suit you
  • Great rates of pay (Above SCHADS Award)
  • Ranging from $27.15 to 42.96 PH
  • Penalty Rates


So, if you put children's education and well-being first and you want to truly contribute positively to a family's future then apply now!

job_summary: Coach & mentor as a subject matter expert. Create designs, drawings & plans for a variety of civil construction works across the Central Coast.
job_ad_details:
The Location and Company

Central Coast Council is one of Australia's largest Regional Councils with over 2400 employees, spanning a significant  geographical area on the northern fringe of Sydney and just an hours drive south of Newcastle. The Central Coast offers one of the best places in Australia to live and work.

Overview of the Role

The Lead Civil Designer is responsible for providing a comprehensive civil engineering survey, design and drafting service needed to deliver Central Coast Council’s Roads, Transport, Drainage and Waste Department’s Four Year Delivery Program and Annual Operational Plan. This role will manage concept design and detailed design processes for roads and stormwater drainage projects, water main and sewer infrastructure relocation designs and prepare design plans and drawings for civil construction works.

Key activities of this role include:

  • Manage investigations into various types of road and drainage infrastructure upgrades to provide the most effective solutions;
  • Mentor and coach less experienced Civil Designers;
  • Manage concept and detailed design and drafting processes for various road and drainage upgrade projects;
  • Develop three-dimensional computer models for comprehensive and cost-effective design solutions.

About You:

  • You are a qualified Civil Engineer with extensive experience  in using AutoCAD and 12d Model software to produce plans and drawings;
  • You are an expert problem solver with the ability to conceptualise and visualise design proposals, then bring them to life for internal and external stakeholders;
  • You are ready to take your career to the next level and utilise your experience to coach and mentor staff on design standards;
  • You enjoy working on diverse and challenging projects;
  • You have great attention to detail;
  • Having a work/life balance is important to you.

About Us:

  • We are a large and progressive organisation delivering a wide variety of services to our local community;
  • You’ll be joining a team of engineering specialists who excel at what they do;
  • You will get to work with established and well designed processes and tools that are efficient, productive and effective;
  • Continuous improvement is at the forefront.

Click on "Apply for this job" and follow the link to our website to apply and obtain the Position Description for detailed information on the position and required skills and experience.

The Salary

This role provides an attractive salary package up to $108.3k per annum (inclusive of market forces payment and 3.5% Civil Liability allowance) + superannuation.

A 9 day fortnight work-cycle currently applies to this role. This arrangement may be subject to change.

The Culture

Central Coast Council is an equal opportunity employer and promotes a healthy and safe work environment. Central Coast Council is committed to diversity in our community and workforce. We encourage Indigenous Australians, people with a disability and people from diverse backgrounds to apply to be part of our inclusive team.

If you are deaf, hearing or speech impaired, you can contact us through the National Relay Service TTY call 133 677 or Speak & Listen 1300 555 727.

Enquiries: Michael Bamber, Section Manager Planning and Design on ph: (02) 4350 5319 or 0400 371 445.

Closing Date:  Applications close at Midnight on Tuesday, 28 January 2020.

job_summary: A great opportunity to become a part of this Leading Australian Retailer in a Flagship Manager role
job_ad_details:
A great opportunity to become a part of this Leading Australian Retailer in a Flagship Manager role

Your new company
A rare and exciting opportunity has arisen for an experienced Retail Professional to become a part of an Australian Retailer who are highly recognised for their unique and quirky arts and crafts products. A role is available within their business as a Store Manager of their CBD Store.

Your new role
Reporting to the Area Manager, the successful candidate will be responsible for leading and managing their store and their team, through extensive coaching and development and providing appropriate training opportunities and managing the recruitment process. Key accountabilities also include consistent monitoring of all financials and K.P.I’s, full P&L and wage accountability and also taking appropriate measures to uphold and go beyond all expectations with store performance and evaluations. You will also be responsible for upholding a constant understanding and knowledge of the local market, and providing strategic feedback and decisions on product and store levels and direction. Consistent communication and feedback on your stores performance with the Area Manager is also a key element to the role and creating and maintaining brand awareness across the market and amongst clients.

What you'll need to succeed
To be considered for this position you must have proven extensive experience in a Retail Management role. You must have key skills in implementing and executing sales and profit growth strategies at a high volume level and a background in managing and exceeding budgets and sales targets; strong financial literacy and analytical skills are a must. The successful candidate will also have exceptional time management, communication and motivational skills. A strong understanding of P&L, wage and all that is required to run your business with financial success is a must.

What you'll get in return
A very competitive salary package is on offer which also includes all of the tools needed to for role. Extensive training and development will also be provided to the successful candidate to assist in their growth and knowledge of the company.

What you need to do now
If you are ready to take the next step in your career, apply now or contact Nadia Tribuzio at Hays Retail at nadia.tribuzio@hays.com.au or 9604-9660.

job_title: Associate Director Strategic and Statutory Planning
job_summary: Take our design and planning team to the next level whilst working with some of the best technical experts in the industry.
job_ad_details:
• Positive and collaborative work environment
  • AECOM offers flexible working arrangements (e.g. part time, working from home)
  • Genuine career progression

The Role

AECOM's Planning and Design Team brings together the creative energy and expertise of professional and technical services from across Australia, New Zealand and around the world – all with a shared purpose to enhance and sustain the world's built, natural and social environments.

AECOM's Sydney Planning and Design Team (Design + Planning) has an immediate requirement for an Associate Director – Strategic and Statutory Planning with particular skills in precinct planning, urban renewal and infrastructure. We are looking for a recognised industry leader with strong communication capabilities to manage our planning team whilst growing the planning pipeline. Focus areas for the role are:

  • Develops a strong client base in Strategic and Statutory Planning.
  • Provides leadership and direction for the team, is a mentor and coach.
  • Furthers the teams technical skills and knowledge.
  • A natural collaborator with the ability to work closely with the urban design team and all parts of the AECOM business.
  • Takes overall responsibility for project delivery, client engagement and the financial performance of the planning team.
  • Is accountable for interfacing with the Performance & Rewards (review) process
  • A clear and open communicator who communicates early and often with the team and within the business.
  • You will work with our design team, engineers, architects and planners, driving the growth of the Planning sector across Australia, including market analysis, strategy development, business planning and business development.
  • You will work with other senior professionals to build AECOM's business and brand, ensuring the business is responsive and sensitive to market conditions and client expectations.

AECOM provides a great a place to work where we place a high priority on a fun and engaging work environment offering career development and mentoring as well as social and wellbeing opportunities. 

About You

  • Min. Bachelor's Degree in Planning or related
  • 15+ years of experience in planning at a wide range of scales and densities
  • Strong portfolio of work that demonstrates excellent technical capabilities
  • Strong business development skills; ability to find, pursue and win business opportunities
  • Previous experience in successfully managing teams or operating group
  • Ability to lead and build a team and work as part of a multidisciplinary team

Benefits at AECOM

The Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) recognises AECOM as taking a sophisticated, holistic approach to supporting women and men's equal participation throughout our workplace.

We provide a diverse and inclusive work environment and offer many benefits to ensure your professional development & wellbeing.

  • Flexible start and finish times, working from home, part time and job share options
  • State of the art, modern and contemporary offices
  • Paid Parental and Partner Leave
  • Purchased additional annual leave +  salary packaging
  • Corporate Employee discounts from up to 400 retailers
  • Wellbeing benefits e.g. vaccinations,  health insurance discounts
  • Employee stock purchase plans
  • Professional memberships
  • Study assistance
  • Professional and technical development opportunities

In return you will be rewarded with a role that enables you to work autonomously with a supportive senior management group that proactively promotes and supports its employees.

job_summary: support the development and implementation of a communications approach with a focus on a specific high-profile program delivery area
job_ad_details:
Job Title: Communications Manager
Job Grade / Classification: Clerk Grade 11/12
Employment Type: Ongoing role
Location: Sydney CBD (relocating to Parramatta by the end of 2019)

About the Role:
As the Communications Manager, you will undertake activities to support the development and implementation of a communications approach with a focus on a specific high-profile program delivery area, as well as strategic activities to support a best practice community and stakeholder engagement approach across relevant industry and sector groups.

You will provide expert advice and cohesive specialist support to senior executive and business units to ensure the community and stakeholders have opportunities to inform specific program and other agency service delivery.

Essential requirements
• Tertiary qualifications in communications, public relations, policy or related discipline and/or relevant equivalent experience
• Willingness and capacity to travel to outer suburban and regional locations, and to work outside of core business hours in the evening and on weekends

Agency overview
The Planning, Industry and Environment Cluster brings together the functions from the former Planning & Environment and Industry Clusters.

The new Cluster will drive for greater levels of integration and efficiency across key areas such as long-term planning, precincts, housing, property, infrastructure priorities, open space, the environment, our natural resources – land, water, mining – energy, and growing our industries. In particular, there will be a redoubling of emphasis on regional NSW.

Please read the following documents prior to preparing your application:
• Role description
• Application Guide
• Applying for a role in the NSW public Sector

Our commitment to diversity and flexibility:
The Planning, Industry and Environment Cluster strives to be an inclusive workplace for all people. We recognise that we operate in a diverse community and welcome and encourage applications from all ages and genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, culturally and linguistically diverse groups, the LGBTIQ+ community, veterans, refugees and those with disability.

We understand that flexibility means different things to different people and are committed to offering flexible work arrangements where and when possible.

How to Apply:
Please submit your up-to-date resume and complete the online application.

The information provided in your application needs to show how you meet the focus capabilities and other essential requirements of the role. (Refer to the role description for details about the capabilities and the associated behavioural indicators. The role description also lists the essential role requirements.)

Applications Close: Sunday 4 July 2019 (11:59pm AEST)

Should you require further information about the role please contact; Andrew Parkinson at Andrew.Parkinson@planning.nsw.gov.au If you have any enquiries regarding the recruitment process, please contact Emmen Saeed at Emmen.Saeed@planning.nsw.gov.au

job_summary: The Mark Agency is an integrated digital & marketing communications agency located in Canberra and Sydney.
job_ad_details:
Who we are

The Mark Agency is an integrated digital & marketing communications agency located in Canberra and Sydney. We combine creative, strategy and technology to deliver solutions that grow businesses.

We are looking for an Account Manager to join the rapidly expanding team. The role requires a creative & innovative individual to think out -side of the box to help manage and deliver projects . The role as a planner sets the communication strategy for marketing & advertising campaigns, establish the goals and objectives, target audience, message and tone in which the campaign should be delivered.

You’ll define how strategy can help a client add value to their business and inspire creative teams to create powerful campaigns.  You will use research, trends and data on markets, consumers and culture to help clients achieve this.

As an Account Manager will be involved with a number of clients and brands at the same time. You will to develop a good understanding and identify specific business needs for each one. 

Who you are

  • Digital savvy
  • Commercially minded
  • Client centric
  • Marketing guru
  • Creatively led

Responsibilities:

  • Working with clients to establish their aims and objectives 
  • Analysing existing data, market reports and trends 
  • Developing, managing and analysing research projects 
  • Working with colleagues to develop ideas for a campaigns 
  • Briefing the creative an digital teams allowing them to create an effective and well-targeted propositions for clients

job_title: Head of Department - Digital Media & Visual Arts
job_summary: We are seeking a qualified and experienced leader to manage and develop a team of academic staff to deliver a portfolio of Digital Media programs.
job_ad_details:
Primary Purpose of position

The primary objectives of this position are to:

  • Coordinate operational and academic management, and supervise the promotion and delivery of the Higher Education programs in the Department of Digital Media and Visual Arts.
  • Lead the strategic planning for growth and development of the School of Digital Media and Visual Arts degree portfolio through developing innovative industry and professional partnerships.
  • Provide a leadership role in:
    • The creation, approval, delivery and ongoing review of relevant programs in the Department;
    • Ongoing collaboration with other departments within RCDC and with external stakeholders;
    • Creating and maintaining a relevant support network with other academics and with practitioners in the creative industries;
    • Creating and delivering Professional Development programs for all staff within the Department in line with the RCDC Policy on Professional Development

POSITION SPECIFICATIONS

Key Responsibilities:

  • Take full academic responsibility for all degree programs in the Department related to Design.
  • Coordinate operational matters and manage the promotion and delivery of the approved, existing Higher Education programs in the Department of Digital Media and Visual Arts.
  • Provide a leadership role in the review and the development of the relevant academic programs and the staff within the Department of Digital Media and Visual Arts in collaboration with other departments and with the Executive Dean.
  • Lead the growth and development of the Department of Digital Media and Visual Arts degree portfolio through developing innovative academic, industry and professional partnerships.
  • Ensure that the activities of the Department are undertaken in accordance with the governance, policy and regulatory and quality assurance framework of the College and in accordance with the Threshold Standards.
  • Take responsibility for the performance management of the academic staff within the Department of Digital Media and Visual Arts through effective appraisals and professional development in collaboration with the Executive Dean.
  • Maintain professional competency in the appointee's own area of academic expertise and demonstrate a commitment to excellence in academic endeavour.
  • Pursue, undertake and support relevant research and/or scholarly activities in keeping with the strategic direction of RCDC and in line with the Research/Scholarship and Research Training Plan 2015 - 2020
  • Promote excellence in pedagogy and professional development in keeping with the strategic direction of RCDC and in line with the Learning and Teaching Plan 2015 – 2020.
  • Contribute to the overall management of Higher Education programs at RCDC through participation on committees, academic administration, participation in promotional activities and representing, as required, RCDC in professional groups and the wider community.
  • Demonstrate leadership in the development of activities across all programs within the Department to promote awareness of the creative industries and the link with higher education.
  • Develop effective strategies for course promotional activities and student recruitment in collaboration with the Marketing Department.

SELECTION CRITERIA

Essential:

  • A doctoral qualification in Digital Media and/or Visual Arts or any closely related discipline; or postgraduate qualification and substantial equivalent professional experience in Digital Media and/or Visual Arts related field.
  • Demonstrated record of commitment to excellence in academic endeavour.
  • Evidence of exceptional leadership in a Higher Education setting, preferably a University.
  • Evidence of success in innovative program development and educational quality improvement.
  • Substantial evidence of teaching innovation and effectiveness and demonstrated ability to lead, develop and mentor teaching teams.
  • Highly developed interpersonal and relationship building skills to liaise effectively with relevant industry and professional stakeholder groups.
  • Established record of research and/or scholarship in the Digital Media and Visual Arts disciplines relevant to the College.
  • Demonstrated record of successful collaborative projects with industry and/or professions.
  • Ability to transfer knowledge, concepts, understanding and skill to colleagues, clients, groups and individuals.
  • Understanding of working with TEQSA regulations and with working at a high level with the Threshold Standards and within Quality Assurance frameworks.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of and commitment to Occupational Health and Safety, Anti-Discrimination, Quality Assurance and continuous improvement.

This position reports to the Executive Dean.

This is a full time position. The applicant must satisfy Child Protection legislation and will be subject to the Working with Children Check. The successful applicant must have the right to work in Australia.

An attractive salary commensurate with qualifications and experience will be negotiated with the successful applicant.

job_summary: BOQ Specialist are currently seeking an experienced Product Manager to join their team in the Sydney CBD focused on a varied Transaction Portfolio
job_ad_details:
• Join ASX 100 Finance Leader – Australia's Most Loved Bank!
  • Opportunity for an experienced Product Manager to work across a varied Transaction Portfolio including Cards and Deposits  – Sydney Based
  • Awarded Best Relationship Business Bank 2017 at the industry's premier Business Banking Awards hosted by RFi Group Our Business

 

About us

BOQ Specialist delivers distinctive banking solutions to niche market segments. Our focus, experience and dedication to our clients have enabled us to become experts in a number of professional niches. We aim to add value to and build partnerships with our clients and we have been providing specialist banking in Australia for over 20 years.

Our broad range of personal and business banking options include transactional and savings accounts, credit cards, residential mortgages, practice purchase and fit-out loans, car loans, SMSF loans and property investment loans. Our approach is characterised by responsive personal service, unconventional thinking, and an ability to be nimble, flexible and innovative.

BOQ Specialist is enjoying record growth and with exciting plans to expand our business there are a number of newly created opportunities. If you’re an experienced banking professional with experience in relationship management & business development and you’re looking for a dynamic, fast paced environment in a rapidly growing business this could be a fantastic opportunity for you. We’re offering you the chance to partner with a truly unique community of clients in a business which prides itself on delivering only exceptional client outcomes.

 

About the role:

We are looking for an experienced Product Manager to join our high performing Product team

This varied role will take accountability for the performance of the Cards and Transactional Treasury Deposit portfolios for BOQ Specialist including; Credit Cards, Scheme Debit Cards and Proprietary Debit Cards. You will also enjoy driving the business strategy and execution, including growth and revenue.

Some of your key duties and responsibilities will include the following:

  • Integrate the strategic, tactical and operational delivery of customer needs led product propositions
  • Provide management information on performance and history across the product
  • Compliance with internal policies and external regulations
  • Manage key vendor relationships covering commercial terms, product development, compliance, marketing, portfolio growth and acquisition initiatives
  • Manage relationships with Schemes and strategic vendors
  • Assist in the execution of the Deposits Strategy and the end to end management of the deposit account suite.
  • Lead and influence a variety of small to medium initiatives to ensure project outcomes, customer and business benefits are realised
  • Work with MIS team to build relevant reporting and analytics around portfolio performance.
  • Assist with managing the risk of the product set including regular monitoring of adherence to policies and providing input to annual product reviews

 

About you:

 With relevant tertiary qualifications, you will have proven experience in Product Management, coupled with specialised knowledge of Electronic Banking infrastructure, payment network and interchange arrangements. Naturally, you will demonstrate:

  • Highly developed analytical skills, with strong problem solving abilities
  • Experience with working with sales channels
  • Involvement in card related industries (e.g. transactions witching, credit card schemes.)
  • Detailed understanding of card scheme authorisation and interchange requirements / regulations
  • Highly developed analytical skills, with strong problem solving abilities
  • High level attention to detail and the ability to prioritise.
  • Understanding of deposit pricing functions.

 

Why BOQ?

BOQ culture and benefits

Work for one of Australia's top 100 listed companies where our vision is to create Australia’s Most Loved Bank! BOQ are passionate about providing opportunities for you to develop your career as we continuously adapt and deliver in a transformational and competitive environment.

We support a flexible workplace and our office in Chifley Tower in the Sydney CBD provides a great work environment with collaborative open space. Benefits include;

  • Discounted financial products
  • Salary packaging options
  • Purchase annual leave
  • BUPA Corporate Plan

 

How to apply:

 

To apply for this role please follow the links, alternatively you can view the role on our Careers Page, https://boq-openhire.silkroad.com/epostings/index.cfm.

The Bank of Queensland is committed to diversity and an inclusive workforce. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

Whilst all applicants will be carefully considered, we will only be able to personally contact you if short-listed for an interview.

BOQ is a member of the Australian Bankers’ Association and has subscribed to the Conduct Background Check Protocol (Protocol). Under the Protocol, from 1 October 2017, BOQ will contact any previous employer/s who are also part of this association to provide a Conduct Check of any potential employee. 

If you are successful for a role with the Bank of Queensland, it is a condition of employment that background screening is completed to ensure that the Bank complies with its obligations under the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter Terrorism Financing Act. These checks may include, but are not limited to: identity, verification, reference checks, criminal background checks, immigration checks, verification of academic qualifications, and bankruptcy checks

job_summary: Permanent part-time opportunities for our Short Stay Ward and Bureau Service - primarily Wednesday to Friday shifts
job_ad_details:
Are you looking for a unique opportunity where you can secure permanent part-time employment that provides the variety that you have been looking for?

As MercyAscot continues to grow, we have permanent part-time opportunities for Registered Nurses to join our new Short Stay Ward, designed to support our existing Inpatient teams as we increase our capacity - this is an exciting time to join a dynamic and growing private organisation.

Under the leadership of a dedicated Nurse Team Leader, this service will be key in continuing to provide a positive experience and outcome for our patients. The variety of patients we care for and the opportunity to interact with some of Auckland's leading Specialists, providing direct input into patient care across a range of specialties, makes the nature of these roles unique and challenging.

Predominately your shifts will be based in our Short Stay ward at Ascot Hospital, however this team will also support our existing casual Nursing Bureau in responding to requests for support or additional staff across all of our Inpatient Wards at both Mercy and Ascot Hospitals.

We have 0.4 or 0.6 FTE opportunities available (16 - 24 hours per week), working rostered shifts (morning, afternoons and nights) primarily Wednesday - Friday. While some flexibility may be required, these roles may suit you if you have a preference for set days to work around your other commitments.

To be successful in this role, you will:

  • Hold NZ Nursing Council Registration and a current APC
  • Have a minimum of 2 years postgraduate nursing experience in a specialised orthopaedic or general surgical environment in a comparable health system
  • Have exceptional interpersonal skills with the ability to think on your feet

About MercyAscot

MercyAscot is New Zealand's largest private surgical facility with 22 theatres across three sites including ICU and cardiac intervention facilities. We provide our staff with a supportive working environment, autonomy of practice, competitive remuneration rates, free on-site car park, smart easy-care uniforms, and a Christmas close-down that allows you to enjoy the festive season with your friends and family.

At MercyAscot we value being adaptable, having effective communication skills, being accountable for our actions and we want to provide excellent customer service to both our internal and external customers.

job_summary: Business Analyst, Project Implementation Office
job_ad_details:
• Ultimo, Sydney
  • Contract Position for Approximately 6 Months (with possible extension)
  • $85,807 - $106,158 p.a. + Generous Super

The PIO Analyst plays an important role in the coordination and statistical analysis of project delivery across the program of Operations Group initiatives. The PIO Analyst is responsible for the appropriate data capture, logging, analysis and interpretation of project metrics. This includes the preparation of presentations, charts and detailed Excel statistics under the guidance of PIO Lead, ensuring project metrics are readily available.

Key Accountabilities:

Management of Project Data

  • analyse all data and project deliverables to help ensure adherence to timeframe and budget requirements;
  • perform financial analysis on project budgets prepare various reports for forecasts;
  • evaluate all financials and assist to identify all key performance indicators; and
  • use existing data to assist in determining outcomes for future scenarios.

Relationship & Stakeholder management

  • liaise with key project contacts and business representatives to follow up or interrogate information;
  • collaborate with Finance to prepare appropriate summaries within required timeframes; and
  • assist in maintaining a record of all project-related decisions and follow up on action items.

Reporting

  • draft reports and presentations with an awareness of their audience, making sense of data being analysed;
  • prepare forecasts;
  • maintain all performance dashboards;
  • assist with the preparation of various reports to help identify risks and assist coordination of all follow up action; and
  • analysis on other key ABC projects (as required).

Selection Criteria:

  1. Relevant tertiary qualification (e.g. Accounting/ Finance/ Economics/ Commerce/ Business). Professional (CA / CPA membership preferred)and 2-4 years postgraduate experience in a similar position is desirable;
  2. Demonstrated experience in providing financial and data analysis and research, including experience in MS Excel with the ability to apply financial modelling techniques (e.g. NPV modelling) and interpreting metrics and performance dashboards;
  3. Excellent interpersonal and written communication skills, including experience at drafting and editing reports, the ability to liaise and negotiate with management at different levels and demonstrated ability to influence others positively;
  4. Demonstrated problem solving and planning skills including the ability to complete projects, meeting deadlines and objectives;
  5. Knowledge of the media and communications environment is desirable;
  6. An understanding of and commitment to the ABC's aims, values and workplace policies.

Applicants must address the selection criteria. For more information on working at the ABC and how to apply, visit abc.net.au/careers

job_title: Senior Production Engineer and Alternate Manager
job_summary: Excellent career opportunity for an experienced Mining Engineer holding a first class ticket.
job_ad_details:
Forrestania Nickel Operation

FIFO out of Perth – Western Australia

We have an opportunity for an experienced hard rock Underground Mining Engineer to join Western Areas in a senior role. Reporting directly to the Underground Manager, there will be instances where you will be required to hold the statutory position of Alternate Underground Manager.  This role represents a fantastic opportunity for career development within Western Areas.

The Opportunity:

Overseeing the engineering department and coordinating the technical services departments, you will primarily be responsible for ensuring production targets are met while not compromising Western Areas core value of safety. Being accountable for the performance of the Planning, Scheduling and Production activities on a daily basis, you will need strong technical knowledge. Strategic thinking will allow you to plan ahead and ensure we meet quarterly targets, this will be backed up with the ability to make strong decisions and communicate priorities to all stakeholders, including our major contracting partner Barminco.

You Will Need:

  • A minimum of 5yrs recent experience in underground mining (with a focus on production and operations) and a WA First Class Mine Managers Certificate of Competency
  • A solid understanding of the Mines Safety and Inspection Regulations & Act
  • To be proficient in mine design software (experience in Mine 24D/EPS Scheduler and Surpac would be advantageous but not essential)
  • To be based in, or willing to relocate to Perth, WA

This is an 8/6 roster FIFO from Perth, ensuring continuity of the mine plan across swings is paramount, to that end you will need to demonstrate clear, direct communication skills. Showing good organisational skills, you will be a high motivated person who can work with minimal supervision to establish the mine priorities. Through leadership, direction, mentoring and training of the engineering department you will help the mine to meet company goals and promote the safe and positive culture that exists at Forrestania.

Forrestania is a diverse and exciting operation with a great future, offering opportunities in underground and exploration activities.  With talented and committed professionals; professional and technical development opportunities are assured.

You will be rewarded with a very competitive salary package including attractive superannuation, an exciting and dynamic role, as well as a great place to work and the opportunity to be part of one of the world's leading nickel producers.

Apply Now:

Do you have the qualifications, qualities and experience for this opportunity to join a fast growing mining company?  We are looking forward to hearing from you.

This is quite a long job description outlining the position in detail , thank you for taking the time to read it carefully to ensure your skills and experience are a close match.

This is a varied and interesting role that requires aperson with quite diverse skillsas you will be working with White Cyprus Pine timber, steel, plastic, fiberglass & rope, and includes the manufacture of parts from raw materials, and the preparation of items and generally making ready of jobs for the installation teams.

Primarily you will be working with timber; duties are predominantly factory based, but may on occasions include assistance on job sites or doing deliveries or service calls. An HR truck licence is desirable but not essential. A Forklift Licence is essential but may be obtained after commencement.

Hours:7.00am to 4.00pm Monday to Friday (No weekend work!) A standard week is 38 hours per week with all time worked beyond this paid at time/half.

This is a permanent full time long termposition.

Incentives:Attendance Bonus is paid for unused Personal Leave
Pay rate:$30 per hour + Super(depending on skills and experience) plus full entitlements (e.g. holiday pay, Personal/sick leave).

Required skills:
  • Experienced and skilled in the use of all hand tools
  • Able to safely use woodworking machinery including, but not limited to cutting, drilling, rip saws, trenching machines, docking saws, sanding machines, routering of WCP timber
  • Able to read plans and technical drawings
  • Experienced and accurate in measuring, marking and assembling components
  • Checking and quality control
  • Experienced in forklift driving (preferred but not essential) and all aspects of materials handling
  • Attention to detail and experienced in quality control
  • Evidence of Trade Certification
  • Forklift Licence (can be obtained after commencement)
  • Manual Car Driver"s Licence
  • HR Truck Licence (preferred but not essential)
  • Evidence of Trade experience and Qualifications e.g. Cabinet Making Apprenticeship
The Job:
  • Timber:Re-sawing, cutting, drilling, sanding, routering.
    Reading & interpreting plans & drawings. Measuring, marking & assembling components. Checking, smoothing & coating of finished parts. Housekeeping duties.
  • Component Preparation: Cutting, drilling, finishing of steel, plastic & fibreglass components.
  • Reading & interpreting plans & drawings.
  • Measuring, marking & assembling components.
  • Checking and quality control. Housekeeping duties.
  • Occasional Warehouse duties: Inwards and Outwards goods e.g. receiving stock, despatch playground equipment ready for installation including loading trucks etc
  • Other duties as required: Delivery of items using company vehicles,attendance to service calls for repair and replacements of items.
The Person:
  • Neat and tidy presentation is essential
  • Physically fit, strong, energetic with stamina
  • Ability to lift/ maneouver heavy lengths of timber
  • Mature attitude with the readiness to accept responsibility and work unsupervised once the training period is completed
  • Maintain a high standard of workmanship without supervision
  • Fluent English
  • Attention to detail is imperative
  • Ability to use initiative and work autonomously
In your cover letter, please state why you are the person for this role and clearly outline your relevant hands-on experience.

Our purpose is to provide quality, independent insurance and risk management advice to corporate clients to assist them to optimise costs and utilise the most appropriate risk sharing mechanisms to protect them against their material risks.

This is predominantly hands-on product development role and may involve some system analysis and documentation.

Our client’s SharePoint development projects consist of i) Bespoke development projects meeting internal business requirements; ii) App development projects migrating legacy applications.

Recent experience in the deployment and configuration of SharePoint online, Office 365 Groups, OneDrive, OneNote and Microsoft Teams highly preferred.

·  Experience in SharePoint Framework (SPFX) developing SharePoint solutions in on-premises and Online environments

·    Experience with SharePoint Designer, InfoPath, Web Parts, and related workflow creation.

·   Experience with SharePoint’s application services framework – implementation of Search functionality using design templates, Managing Metadata, data / content migration and User Profile Services.

·   Experience in coding, testing and in the development & review of technical documentation.

·   Demonstrated ability in delivering Enterprise Search: Search Architecture & Sources and rights management.

·    Demonstrated experience in Microsoft Team Foundation Server.

·    Attention to detail and commitment to high quality/error free deliverables

·   Ability to operate within Agile (scrum) environment

job_summary: Josh Wulf 0431 929 675 | See you at NDC Sydney if you're there. In Brisbane, Azure is a thing. $100k - $120k depending on experience and awesomeness.
job_ad_details:
Hidden advantages of working in the CBD include the ability to attend meetups at night. There are tons of them around, including the .NET Meetup at Microsoft, the Brisbane Functional Programming Group near Little Tokyo Two, and all the goodness that happens at River City Labs.

So if you're a .NET developer and you're not in the CBD, this is an opportunity for you to get there.

If you're already in the city, why might you be interested in this role?

Well, it's very heavily Azure-focused. The cloud is now. All the WPF and Winforms stuff in the mining industry has a rapidly expiring shelf life. HTML 5 and JavaScript frameworks like Angular 2 and React are the new client platform. And moving applications to run in containers and virtualised environments in Azure is the next wave of that. 

This is a US company that does their software engineering in Australia, with a decade of experience in their domain, looking to take their current on-premise software solution (written in .NET) to the cloud as a multi-tenanted SaaS offering.

That requires experience with Azure. Experience that you could bring, if you are one of the ten people in Brisbane with that kind of commercial experience, and one of the two of those people who are looking for a new role right now.

I've been using Azure at night for a couple of weeks, now that I'm in the Microsoft Bizspark program. It's too early for me to draw a comparison - I've been developing on AWS since 2008, so a couple of weeks is not enough data to draw any conclusions.

Anyway, hit me up at NDC Sydney for a chat if you're there. That's where a lot of the developers that I work with are this week. I only work with professional software developers and companies that value professional software development. I'm down at NDC doing a workshop and giving a guest talk at the Sydney Angular and JavaScript meetup. Give me a shout-out if you're coming.

If you're not coming, I'm still contactable by all the usual means so get in touch and I'll share the highlights of the conference with you.
 
Joshua Wulf
Just Digital People
ph/txt: 0431 929 675
w: www.justdigitalpeople.com.au
e: josh@justdigitalpeople.com.au
 
I only work with organisations that value professional software development and professional software developers.
 
Follow me on Twitter @sitapati. Contact me any time for a 100% confidential chat about this role, your career, your organisation, software, technology, the industry, or Queensland's Silicon Economy. 
 
Please: no more unsolicited calls from companies seeking top talent right now - I am fully booked already for this quarter. Contact me in October. $100k - $120k + super

job_summary: Exciting opportunity for a PM Planning & Development who will provide statutory & strategic planning advice, undertake environmental assessments.
job_ad_details:
• Exceptional career development opportunity to make your mark!
• Senior level role, an attractive remuneration package to be negotiated
• Permanent Full-Time role
• Chatswood location, close to public transport

The Opportunity

We have an exciting opportunity for a Principal Manager Planning & Development to lead our Service Planning & Development team within Transport for NSW. This position plays a key role in advising project teams in the business case development phase and delivery of major projects and reports to Director Planning and Environment.

The Principal Manager Planning & Development will provide statutory and strategic planning advice on approvals pathways, preparing major EIS and other planning approvals for inclusion of specialist environmental advice and stakeholder agency consultation.

We are looking for qualified Planning, Environment, Natural Resource or Environmental Engineering professional with experience in the preparation of environmental assessments and planning approval processes relating to the delivery of a major transport infrastructure project.

For more information on this position, view the role description here.

About us

At Transport, our vision is for a truly integrated transport system that will meet the needs of our customers now and into the future. The Transport portfolio includes Transport for NSW as principal agency with Sydney Trains, NSW Trains, State Transit Authority and Roads and Maritime Services as our key operating agencies.

We are a values based organisation and employ the most talented people to work together to deliver services for our customers and make NSW a better place to live, do business and visit.

Benefits

At Transport we offer employees challenging and rewarding work with opportunities for career progression, learning and development and flexibility.

We provide comprehensive staff training through structured programs and provide study assistance to staff pursuing work related courses.

Our commitment to Diversity

TfNSW are committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture across the Transport cluster, planning for and promoting diversity. We welcome and encourage applications from diverse community groups and ages including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, LGBTI, people with disabilities, women and other diversity groups. TfNSW recognises the benefits that such an approach brings for our staff and customers in delivering the future of NSW.

Essential requirements

• Tertiary qualifications in a Planning, Environment, Natural Resource, Environmental Engineering or similar discipline, or equivalent experience.
• Demonstrated experience of the preparation of environmental assessments and planning approval processes relating to the delivery of a major transport infrastructure project.
• Comprehensive knowledge and understanding of the EP&A Act (1979), the NSW planning system and associated statutory processes of government protocols for procurement and contract management.

Please note: The successful candidate will need to undertake background checks and criminal record checks.

How to apply

To apply for this position, please submit a resume and brief covering letter (no longer than two pages) which addresses:
a) The reason for your interest in this position, and
b) How your skills and experience suit the role

For more information on how to apply for a role in the NSW Public Sector please click here or for more information on Transport for NSW please click on link provided.

For any enquiries, please contact Adam Turrell on 02 8574 3611 and quote 00004Q8U.

Applications close: 11:59pm, Sunday, 9 October 2016

Permanent Full Time Opportunity Located in Chatswood, close to public transport Exceptional career development opportunity to make your mark! Senior level role, offering an attractive package

job_summary: Exciting opportunity for an experienced nurse.
job_ad_details:
About BHP

At BHP we support our people to grow, learn, develop their skills and reach their potential.

With a global portfolio of operations, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with extraordinary career opportunities.  Our strategy is to focus on creating a safe work environment where our employees feel strongly connected to our values and objectives, and where the capability of our people is key to our success.

About Nickel West

Nickel West is a fully integrated mine-to-market business. Our culture is rich with technical know-how, highly efficient and focused on innovation. The business employs over 2500 people from five operations across Western Australia comprising of nickel underground and open-cut mines, concentrators, a smelter and a refinery. We also have plans to expand our operations with new mines in the northern Goldfields and a large nickel sulphate plant in Kwinana.

A member of the BHP Group, Nickel West is undergoing an exciting business transformation to become a globally significant supplier of battery materials to the electric vehicle market. Nickel West will soon become the world’s largest producer of Nickel Sulphate, a key ingredient in lithium-ion batteries. As the world’s largest producer of nickel briquettes and nickel powder, Nickel West is leading the new-energy revolution in Western Australia.

Nickel West has an exciting future ahead. We invite you to join us at Nickel West as we seek to energize our future.

About the Role

  • FIFO 7 days on 7 days off. (After hours call-outs also be required).
  • Competitive salary on offer plus 12% superannuation and a range of company benefits
  • Diverse exposure to injury treatment, injury management and return to work, medical and emergency services and workforce health surveillance

As a Registered Nurse at our Northern Operations, your primary role is to ensure the health and wellbeing of our workforce and members of our community, through the treatment of injuries and illnesses, injury management and return to work processes and execution of workforce health surveillance.

Located in the town of Leinster and reporting to the onsite Health Supervisor for Health, Safety and Environment Execution, your key responsibilities will include:

  • Providing necessary treatment for onsite injuries and illnesses, supported (where necessary) by onsite Emergency Services personnel and external health care providers;
  • Providing primary health care to the local community and surrounding regions;
  • Management and execution of injury management and return to work programs, including involvement in workers compensation processes;
  • Participating in Fitness for Work Programs (drug and alcohol testing);
  • Delivering and continuously improving the quality of reporting of health information;
  • Maintaining core medical centre processes relating to equipment calibrations, dispensing medications and general medical consumable stock management;
  • Ongoing engagement of site stakeholders regarding active injury management cases;

This role exists within a two person Health Specialist team, existing on a back-to-back 7/7 roster.

About you

We anticipate that you will be a suitably qualified health professional, possessing relevant experience in a similar role at a remote location within the resources industry or remote health environment.

To be successful in this role you will require:

  • Qualifications and experience as a Registered Nurse - current registration with AHPRA;
  • Practical experience in the dispensing and administration of medicines under the guidelines of a Poison Permit
  • Ability to work independently, as a sole-practitioner, for extended periods
  • Experience in emergency, paediatrics, ante-natal care, venepuncture and cannulation
  • You will also have excellent organisation skills and the ability to manage regular commitments and priorities as well as the ad hoc demands that occur in a fast paced environment;
  • Experience in conducting Fitness for Work Testing in accordance with AS/NZS 4308:2008; competent in undertaking audiometric and spirometry testing (WorkCover WA Approved Audiometric Officer  would be highly regarded).
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills

As part of the recruitment process for this position you may be required to undergo a pre-employment medical and participate in a background screen including a criminal history check, identity check and qualifications check.

Nickel West Leinster

Nickel West Leinster is located 375 kilometres north of Kalgoorlie in Western Australia.  The operation sources nickel ore from the Perseverance Underground Mine and Cliffs Underground Mine before crushing and processing to produce a concentrate.  The Leinster Village and Township offer a unique lifestyle with all the modern conveniences – an Olympic size swimming pool, health and fitness centre, race-course and even an 18 hole golf course.  As part of our commitment to health and safety Nickel West Leinster.

Supporting a Diverse Workforce

On offer is a range of employee benefits including development and career opportunities together with competitive remuneration package, including share options, generous superannuation contributions, 18 weeks of paid parental leave, performance based bonuses and a great working environment.

To Apply

Short listing for this position will commence on 8th of June 2018 however we do reserve the right to close this position earlier than stated.  To enable us to process your application as quickly as possible simply click on the ‘apply’ button below.

We are seeking candidates with experience in change management, process and/or engineering technology for supply-chain driven industries with a particular focus on Rail and Automation.   Seeking multiple roles for consulting engagements to deliver the required outcomes to the client’s high expectations. The successful candidates will be professional consultants with the relevant subject-matter expertise and stakeholder management skills to drive and deliver projects on a client by client engagement basis.

Seeking the following roles with subject matter expertise in Rail Technology Automation projects:

  • Engineering Project Managers
  • Engineering Project Analysts

Role Responsibilities

Leading Engagements (Manager Roles)

  • Provide quality assurance and delivery assurance across engagements to ensure a referenceable result for the client
  • Guide and shape Company's IP and marketing collateral so that it is fully aligned with market opportunities
  • Mentor consultants to develop and achieve the optimised results for the client

Thought Leadership

  • Experience in supply-chain driven industries in roles that relate to concept of operations/business process and/or technology
  • Work with our management team to enhance and develop our domain offerings and to demonstrate industry and technology thought leadership.  This would include industry research, presentations at industry forums, development of whitepapers and contribution to company marketing materials

Build Relationships

Emerging Business

  • Supporting our business development activities to identify and qualify leads through existing networks and marketing activities within our target industries
  • Develop effective presentations, proposals and RFP responses
  • Present opportunities to potential clients within our market driven domain offerings
  • Ensure company opinions on market movements in technologies and methodologies are cascaded through the consulting team and to wider communities

Key Criteria

  • Project based background in the rail industry, in areas valuable to our customers, in particular:
    • Delivery of Rail Technology projects including eTCS or CBTC project

  • Experience across the lifecycle of the project with a focus on delivering the required client outcomes
  • Experience operating in an advisory / consulting capacity

At ANZ, everything we do boils down to ‘why’ – our purpose – to shape a world where people and communities thrive. We're just as focused on seeing our people thrive as well as our customers. We'll give you every opportunity to develop your career.

 

We are responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter the most, energising our people, eliminating waste and reducing bureaucracy.

Employment Type: Permanent Full Time
Location: Site Negotiable
Position Classification: Nurse Mgr Gde 4
Remuneration: $124,832.01 - $127,018.29 pa
Hours Per Week: 38
Requisition ID: REQ20111
Applications Close: 15 February 2018

Where you'll be working

At Southern NSW Local Health District (site negotiable) we are working to help our communities lead healthy lives.  Our mission is that all people across our diverse societies are able to have timely access to the right healthcare in the right setting to maximise their health, wellbeing and independence.

 

There is an abundance of lifestyle benefits available to you in country NSW and you will be amazed at what you will have access to - and it all comes without the queues and crowds of a big city.    For more information visit our website. 

What you'll be doing
Provides expert strategic development, consultation liaison, clinical governance and leadership to the SNSWLHD Drug and Alcohol service. Provides support and advice to SNSWLHD mental health clinicians pertaining to co-morbid mental health and drug/alcohol concerns.  

Selection Criteria

  • Tertiary qualifications and current registration with AHPRA for Registered Nurses, Occupational Therapists, Psychologists, or eligibility for membership of the Australian Association of Social Workers for Social Workers.
  • Demonstrated high level skills and experience in the provision of drug and alcohol leadership, strategic development, evaluation, clinical governance and continuous quality improvement.
  • Demonstrated post registration experience as a senior clinician in drug and alcohol service delivery.
  • Demonstrated high level clinical consultancy and ability to implement evidence based practice treatments across drug and alcohol services.
  • Proven ability to think critically, problem solve and make timely, sound clinical decisions whilst working autonomously.
  • Demonstrated expertise in clinical leadership and clinical supervision to health clinicians from all disciplines, upholding standards of clinical practice, and critically analyse, review and participate in the development of relevant policies and procedures.
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively and the capacity to engage and collaborate with clients, their families and carers and/or other stakeholders, and a demonstrated high level proficiency in computer literacy.
  • Current unrestricted drivers’ licence and the ability to maintain. Ability and willingness to drive/travel as the role requires. This may involve driving long distances and overnight stays.

Please note that to apply for this position you must be an Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident of Australia, or be able to independently and legally live and work in Australia by way of your own Temporary Visa.  We do not offer sponsorship in this position for applicants requiring a temporary visa.  For more information, please see www.immi.gov.au

Previous experience in a medical environment is preferred but not essential. Full training will be provided.
  
The role includes:

•    Faxing/Scanning

Successful applicants will:
•    Have a professional appearance and a warm and compassionate nature
•    Punctuality
•    Display excellent interpersonal skills
•    Be a real team player in a busy environment
•    Produce high quality and accurate work
•    Be easily able to multi-task and prioritise
•    Demonstrate great attention to detail
•    Possess strong computer skills (word, excel, database)
•    Demonstrate strong written and verbal communication skills

For enquiries call Joy Doig Practice Manager 9639 3409 or email resume to info@collinsradiology.com.au
