job_summary: FinXL have recently won a number of excited projects in Canberra and are looking for an experienced IT Security Specialist to help us deliver this!
job_ad_details:
FinXL
FinXL IT Professional Services is an established innovative Australian company providing technology enabled business solutions and consulting services across a number of industries including Telecommunications, Commercial, Government and Finance. 
We currently have more than 600 consultants assisting our clients throughout Australia and are continuing to grow at a rapid pace. Through the delivery of services and implementation of new systems, processes and technology, we assist our clients to gain competitive advantage and reach new heights!

Engagement Details:
Senior IT Security Applications Specialist role is required to provide technical expertise network traffic and associated artefacts.

Essential Skills:

  • Demonstrated ability to perform analysis on complex incidents, utilising large data sets and provide sound conclusions with verbose analytical output;
  • Good understanding of security traffic analysis, detection and response techniques including communication/networking knowledge including TCP/IP;
  • Good understanding and experience with Security Information Management Systems;
  • Good understanding of applications and services that transit a modern gateway environment including mail and web applications;
  • Relevant work experience and/or Tertiary qualifications in Information Technology, Computer Science or related discipline;

Highly Desirable:

  • Strong working knowledge of Linux Operating Systems, specifically utilising command line and bash scripting automation for network and file analysis.
  • Demonstrated knowledge in malware analysis and/or reverse engineering.
  • Strong working knowledge of network traffic analysis as applicable to CND roles.
  • Experience with Security analysis tool sets.
  • Experience with technical documentation and maintenance of technical  documentation for security tools and SOPS;
  • Professional industry certifications covering one or more of the following:
    - Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems
    - Cyber Security Incident Handling
    - Intrusion Detection
    - Penetration Testing
    - Network, Memory and/or Disk Forensics
    - Reverse Engineering Malware

FinXL fosters a high-performing, inclusive workplace built on a foundation of excellence, respect and dignity. We take corporate social responsibility seriously through our ongoing activities with communities and staff involvement in these efforts.  We are committed to environmentally friendly practices in both our own operations and our work with clients.

To submit a confidential application please email it.act@finxl.com.au or contact Thomas Young at FinXL 02 6243 6488 to discuss further.

FinXL does not accept unsolicited resumes or appreciate unsolicited calls from recruitment agencies.

job_summary: You will be primarily responsible for managing and overseeing the provision of quality and project information on significant projects.
job_ad_details:
• Are you interested in proactively supporting the management of the 10-year Transport Investment Plan for all Public Transport investments in NSW and being responsive to changing priorities?
  • Work flexibly in a high-performing team that values quality over quantity
  • Temporary Full Time Opportunity, up to September 2020
  • Currently located in Chippendale, close to public transport

About us 


Transport for NSW’s (TfNSW) workforce of 28,000 is delivering the largest transport infrastructure program this nation has ever seen with over $50 billion of capital investment over the next four years with some of the most complex infrastructure and service delivery challenges.

 

We offer diverse and challenging career opportunities for professional and technical specialists, trades, and people interested in making a difference to transport operations and road safety in New South Wales.

 
The opportunity
 

We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Principal Analyst – Public Transport to be a part of our high-performing Strategic Investments team in the Corporate Services division of TfNSW.

 

As a trusted advisor, you will be primarily responsible for researching, providing, managing and overseeing the provision of quality and timely summarised financial and project information on significant projects for internal management and external stakeholders including NSW Treasury.

 

In addition, you will partner with key stakeholders across the Transport cluster and NSW Treasury, to understand, communicate and help formulate strategies to address investment needs, key risks and issues to support delivery of Public Transport projects in NSW.

 
About you
 

In addition to tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline, what’s really important to us is that you have experience in:

  • Providing quality and timely advice using your advanced analytical and communication skills
  • Providing management quality and reliable and updating and maintaining large data sets whilst retaining data integrity
  • Developing and maintain relationships with key stakeholders, to be a trusted adviser, demonstrate a strong work ethic and ability to maintain confidentiality.

Want to know more?
 

Please click here to view a copy of the position description.

 
Find out more about Transport for NSW at https://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/about-us.
 
Essential requirements

  • Tertiary qualification in a relevant discipline or equivalent experience
  • Extensive experience in developing and reviewing investment advice in a government environment

Our Commitment to Diversity


Great people come from all walks of life. At Transport for NSW, we are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible workforce which reflects the community and the customers we serve.


We welcome and encourage applications from all people regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, cultural background, or sexual orientation.


Salary and Benefits

  • Transport Service Grade 9 ($129,349 to $144,870), plus employer’s contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading

For more information on Employee Benefits at TfNSW please click here.


Need help?
 

For more information on how to apply for a role in the NSW Public Sector please click here.

 

For any enquiries, please contact Sylvia Koutsoubaris on 0466 022 754 and quote 00007A7H.

 

To apply for this position, please submit a resume and brief covering letter (no longer than two pages) which addresses:

 

a) how your skills and experience suit the role, and

b) the reason for your interest in this role.

 

For more information on how to apply for a role in the NSW Public Sector please click here.

job_title: PiR Coordinator - Part Time, Fixed Term
job_summary: Improve the system response to, and outcomes for, people with severe and persistent mental illness who have complex needs.
job_ad_details:
Open Minds is an expanding and innovative not-for-profit organisation providing community based psychosocial support services for people with a mental illness, disability or acquired brain injury. Our Practice commitment is to empower clients to embrace their own identity and encourage meaningful citizenship, connecting people to live a life of choice.

PiR (Partners in Recovery) aims to better assist people who live with severe and persistent mental illness and who have complex needs, as well as their families and carers.

As our new PiR Coordinator based at Caboolture, you'll be part of an established, high performance team where your role will be to improve the system response to and outcomes for people with severe and persistent mental illness who have complex needs.

Responsibilities include:

  • Assessment of client needs
  • Ability to pro-actively engage with PiR target group, families and carers
  • In collaboration with PiR participants develop, monitor and review PiR action plans
  • Promote a community based recovery model
  • Link and coordinate 'wrap-around' care that is individually tailored to client needs
  • Streamline access to both clinical and non clinical services
  • Strengthen partnerships and links between relevant stakeholders

Selection criteria includes:

  • Experience working in a mental health service setting
  • Highly effective communication and interpersonal skills
  • Proven ability to engage with people experiencing severe and persistent mental illness who have complex needs
  • Strong relationship building skills
  • Team worker – collaborative
  • Well developed organisational and record keeping skills
  • Proficiency with MS Office and computer systems
  • Current Drivers Licence
  • Current Blue Card / Yellow Card
  • Tertiary qualifications (minimum diploma Level)

Benefits:

  • ASAP Start
  • Above award rate pay
  • Use of pool car
  • Mobile phone
  • Salary packaging
  • Professional development

APPLY NOW! Please submit your CV along with a cover letter to address the selection criteria.

Part time Monday - Friday, negotiable hours until June 2017 Based at Caboolture, North Brisbane Experience in the Mental Health sector

job_title: Ophthalmic Nurse/Registered Nurse/Ophthalmic Technician - Part Time
job_summary: Private specialist ophthalmology practice with a strong culture of excellence. Join our happy team supporting two well-regarded specialists.
job_ad_details:
TOWNSVILLE EYE CARE

We are a specialist ophthalmology practice looking for a part-time nurse to join our happy and dynamic team.  Applicants must be Australian citizens or permanent residents. 

Hours are negotiable but will be approximately 25-30 per week.  

We are a two-doctor practice comprising a comprehensive ophthalmologist and a medical/surgical retina subspecialist.  Our current staffing is two receptionists, a senior administrator, and three nurses.

Our practice is equipped with the latest diagnostic equipment: Heidelberg Spectralis OCT and HRA (with ultra-widefield FA/ICG angiography, as well as OCT-A), IOL Master (including Zeiss Callisto integration), latest Zeiss /Cirrus OCT, Zeiss HFA3, Zeiss Visucam fundus camera, Haag-Streit anterior segment cameras, YAG and diode lasers. Children comprise a small but interesting part of our practice, and one of our surgeons is the only retinal subspecialist in the region.  

Salary is very negotiable in order to attract the right person.  

Previous experience in an ophthalmology practice would be very well regarded, but is not essential, as we will provide full training in our specialty and in using the equipment.  More important to us is finding someone who will be a good fit with the rest of our team. 

Check us out at www.townsvilleeyecare.com.au

job_summary: Cathara Consulting is seeking a Technical Business Analyst in Darwin. Must be willing to commit to the assignment for a minimum of 12-months.
job_ad_details:
Technical Business Analyst - Darwin

Cathara Consulting is an IT Consulting firm with a national presence. We are seeking a Technical Business Analyst for an opportunity in Darwin. Candidates must be willing to commit to the assignment for a minimum of 12-months.

The Technical Business Analyst will:

  • Gather and document business and technical requirements
  • Develop standard documentation such as solution design and implementation plans
  • Be hands-on in undertaking data migration activities
  • Be the conduit between multiple project stakeholders (technical and non-technical)
  • Analyse complex legacy data business processes, systems and applications, and create solutions within a large enterprise application development environment
  • Help the businesses implement technology solutions in a cost-effective way
  • Define business rules for legacy data convergence, cleansing and ongoing synchronisation activities
  • Installation and configuration of networked desktop and laptop, wireless tablets, high speed network printers and specialised devices such as barcode printers and barcode readers
  • Use requirements to drive the design or review of test cases, process change requests, acceptance, installation and deployment
  • Lead workshops and engagements, and assist with eliciting requirements, data mapping and data profiling, process improvements, translating and simplifying requirements

Skills and Experience

Skills and experience required must include: 

  • A minimum of 5 years of experience as a Technical Business Analyst
  • Previous experience within the Health sector is essential
  • Certified or demonstrable experience in the use of recognised standards for the practice of Business Analysis such as BABOK or Business Process Modelling and Notation (BPMN)
  • Demonstrable experience with complex data conversion or data migration projects
  • Critical thinking skills and proven ability to distil business requirements and re-engineer processes
  • Experience writing complex SQL queries and Report writing
  • Experienced in working with complex IT systems, including a sound understanding of system interoperability, database structures and data flows between systems
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills including the ability to liaise and negotiate with business and technical personnel

Desirable criteria

  • Knowledge of central device management such as Airwatch and Printer Logic
  • Experience and general familiarity with clinical terminology, data and systems
  • Experience conducting data quality assessments to improve data quality

Candidates only with full working rights in Australia please apply

Must hold a valid National Police Clearance certificate

Please direct all queries and CV's to:

recruitment@catharaconsulting.com

job_summary: Digital Delivery Manager
job_ad_details:
Deliver digital strategy at leading hospitality group, lead end to end project focused on customer engagement.

Your new company
Global hospitality group focused on delivering exceptional customer experiences by continuously supporting digital engagement. A culture of success coupled with an enjoyment of professional life, this business boasts strong retention on the basis of the collaborative, open and transparent environment it fosters for its employees.

Your new role

  • Deliver digital strategy of the business, focusing on CRM and online engagement platform project.
  • Lead end to end project life cycle, defining scope, commissioning and delivery.
  • Identify key stakeholders and engage to deliver objectives.
  • Work with National IT team and Marketing to help define digital strategy.
  • Engagement with multiple vendors and third-parties.


What you'll need to succeed
The nature of the role requires experience in digital environments without a support team of developers/analysts. An ability to engage with the relevant internal stakeholders and execute strategy from the ground up is essential. End to end project management is similarly crucial, with involvement in the scoping, operating and delivery stages of a project life cycle a prerequisite. Inter personally, the collaborative and fast paced element of this role requires strong communication skills, creative thinking and problem solving abilities. Experience driving digital strategy using CRM and online e-commerce platforms is desirable.


What you'll get in return
An opportunity to deliver tangible value to a global business by digitising its platforms and improving customer experience and engagement. Become part of a culture of collaboration, dedication and celebration. Socially, an opportunity to work with creative individuals who enjoy professional life. An impressive package of $120,000-$140,000.

What you need to do now
If you are interested in this opportunity and would like further clarity, don't hesitate to contact me on Oliver.Montique@hays.com.au or my direct line, 03 9604 9579. If you are confident in your suitability, please apply directly to the position.

Influence digital strategy to drive customer engagement Manage end to end CRM and e-commerce projects Engage with senior IT and Marketing leadership to define strategy $120000.00 - $140000.00 p.a.

job_title: Are You The Best Colourist Around? Do You Want To Be?
job_summary: Excited by colour and styling? We are seeking capable stylists, colourists and salon assistants for full and part-time positions.
job_ad_details:
About the business

 

Does colour excite you?  Do you want your clients to leave the salon having been transformed by your skill?  If flexibility and growth sounds like you, sing out!  At Hue, we understand that modern lifestyles need modern ways of working, so we're happy to be flexible in meeting your needs around hours and days of work.  We also want to be the best in NZ, so we put a lot of effort into training our staff to be the best stylists and  colourists around.  

We used to be a colour only salon, but we're branching out into cuts and styling too!  Hue is NZ's only specialist hair colouring chain, and we've recently decided to offer cuts to our clients as well.  We currently own five salons in Auckland and one in Christchurch, and we're interested in growing this number.

We have openings in our Botany, Mt Eden, Albany, Ponsonby and Balmoral salons for either stylists or salon assistants.

 

About the role

 

As a stylist, you'll be confident in both cutting and colouring. Colour remains our specialism, so this will need to be a strength for you - or one you want to make a strength.

As a colourist you will passionate about colour and customer service. You will have salon experience and be confident when it comes to colour.

As an assistant you will be keen to learn from the best and carve out a path in hairdressing. You will have great people skills and be a team player. 

This is an exciting opportunity for ambitious individuals to prove you have what it takes to succeed and set your career on a strong growth path. We are looking for people keen to take on fully-funded expert training and education whilst earning an uncapped weekly wage and bonus. If you are seeking an assistant role or a colourist role, we have a spot for you.

With a mix of salon locations and job opportunities, we're bound to have something that suits you!

 

Benefits and perks

 

We offer a friendly and supportive work environment, a competitive hourly rate, and a generous bonus scheme - paid weekly, plus the opportunity to grow with experience.

 

Skills and experience

 

We are hiring for full time and part time positions, and have some flexibility as to which salon you'll work in.  We prefer previous in-salon experience but this is not essential. Please apply by forwarding your CV and covering letter to andrew@hue.co.nz.  

Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.

job_title:
Sales and Membership Manager - Next Gen Clubs
Full Time - Kings Park - WA
job_summary: Great Sales & Membership Manager role! Opportunity for an experienced Manager with proven Sales success. Lead, support & develop the sales team.
job_ad_details:
• Benefit From Generous Base Salary + Achievable Commission
  • Enjoy Club Membership + Flexible Hours
  • Career Development Opportunities
  • Iconic Brand + International Operations

Next Gen Health & Lifestyle Clubs is a growing Health, Racquets and Lifestyle business with operations in Adelaide, Sydney, Perth, Canberra and Auckland.

About the Role:

An excellent opportunity exists for a hands on, motivated and passionate Sales & Membership Manager. You must have proven success as a Sales Manager in the same or a similar industry. A rigorous understanding of the psychology of sales, the ability to implement & monitor sales strategies and motivate a sales team will all be key attributes of the successful candidate.

The objective of this role is to lead, support and develop the membership sales team and to achieve the overall sales targets of Next Generation, Kings Park. You should be passionate about working with people and have exceptional leadership qualities.

Experience/Knowledge and Qualifications:

  • Proven success as a Sales manager;
  • Tertiary qualification in marketing desirable; and
  • Demonstrated history or leading successful sales teams.

The Successful Applicant:

As the successful candidate you will be able to provide evidence of the following:

  • A comprehensive understanding of the psychology of sales;
  • Implementing and monitoring sales strategies;
  • Established understanding of marketing concepts and methods;
  • Drive new Club memberships including Corporate memberships; and
  • Develop strategies to drive ancillary revenue for the Club, through internal member secondary spend.

What's on offer:

  • State-of the-art club environment;
  • Work for an organisation with a team orientated culture;
  • Fantastic growth and development opportunities;
  • Club Membership included in the package; and
  • Generous base salary with an attractive incentive scheme.

Next Gen Clubs as an employer:

Next Gen Clubs is a great place to grow your career and our culture is central in making Next Gen Clubs a fantastic place to work. Our facilities are beautiful and We believe that our employees are our greatest asset and are the key to our success. We reward and recognise initiative and performance while investing in our employees to keep them challenged and genuinely passionate about our brand.

We are internationally established with opportunities open to all our employees both in Australia and New Zealand. We want you to use and experience the club first hand, so we also offer complimentary club membership to our full time employees.

About Next Gen Clubs:

Step into any Next Gen Club and instead of finding a regular health club; you'll escape to an inner-city country club. Extensive fitness facilities are complimented by racquet facilities, aqua, social and relaxation areas to provide a welcoming and uniquely different environment to traditional health clubs that appeal to both individuals and families alike.

From its original base in Adelaide, Australia, the Group now includes one club in Sydney, two clubs in Perth, one club in Canberra and one in Auckland New Zealand.

Our family orientated clubs offer unrivalled facilities and service levels for our members with state-of-the-art exercise machines, indoor and outdoor pools and hundreds of exercise classes per week. Our racquet facilities include tennis and squash courts. Additional facilities include licensed cafés and lounges with free internet access, crèches, children's play rooms and programs.

www.nextgenclubs.com.au

Please note:

  • Flexible hours and days are required for this role
  • Proof of right to work in Australia documentation will be required to be presented at the first interview
  • We are inviting direct applicants only

No Recruitment Agencies please

Benefit From Generous Base Salary + Achievable Commission Enjoy Club Membership + Flexible Hours - Career Development Opportunities Iconic Brand + International Operations

job_summary: Make a change and live the summer lifestyle all year round - become our Rural Presenter in Perth.
job_ad_details:
• $75K - $89K p.a. (pro rata) + choice of 15.4% super
  • Contract Vacancy for Approximately 6 Months
  • Perth Location

About ABC Regional

ABC Regional provides a national voice for the one third of Australians who live outside our capital cities. At a time when the regional presence of commercial media is shrinking, the ABC's role is more important than ever. ABC Regional's more than 400 staff prepare and present almost 1,000 hours of live local programming every week, while linking the stories, people and conversations of regional communities to local, national and international audiences through broadcast, online and mobile services.

About the Role

Make a change and live the summer lifestyle all year round - become our Rural Presenter in Perth and create engaging broadcast, social media and online content suitable for both urban and regional audiences.

Reporting to the Executive Producer and working collaboratively together within our friendly Country Hour team, you'll:

  • Initiate, research and conduct interviews under tight deadlines and provide significant input into shaping programs to build and maintain audiences.
  • Produce and present the Country Hour each day, with locally sourced material.
  • Regularly break news and provide analysis relevant to the agriculture, horticulture, fishing and mining sectors.
  • Contribute to program planning and participate in operational, administrative activities and reports as required.

About You

Do you have a real passion and a talent to generate and develop strong original journalism? We are looking for a self-starter and an enthusiastic team player who can bring a perspective of culturally diverse communities and contribute to stories and conversations that reflect the broader Australian landscape.

This position would be ideal for someone with advanced presentation and reporting skills.

  • Proven experience in radio with advanced editorial skills and judgement with a creative approach to program construction and delivery.
  • Detailed primary industry knowledge and high level ability to maintain and develop contacts within rural communities.
  • Deep knowledge of the latest broadcast technology including digital editing and online publishing with capacity to develop online content.

For an overview of the role, please refer to the position description: Rural Presenter, Country Hour WA.pdf

Audition material must be submitted with your application online (include examples, links to websites or attach audio/video files up to 5MB).

For further information contact Renee Du Preez on (02) 6627 2046

Applications Close: 22 January 2017

Recruitment Agency applications will not be accepted.

The ABC strives for equity and diversity in the workplace, and to promote a culture of opportunity. Through its services the ABC seeks to represent, connect and engage with all of the Australian community. In line with our focus on diversity, applications are strongly encouraged from Indigenous Australians, people from a range of cultural and linguistic backgrounds and people with disabilities and a gender-balanced workforce.

job_title: Outbound Sales / Business Development – Part Time or Full Time - Brookvale
job_summary: Cold calling companies primarily within the Events industry to introduce our market leading and highly successful products. Flexible Hours. PT or FT
job_ad_details:
CrowdComms & GalaBid have been operating within the event tech space for close to a decade serving events small and large. We develop and operate two major software projects, one for event organisers and the other for silent auction organisers and we are currently seeking a telephone based Business Development Manager to join our Brookvale based team on either a Part Time or Full Time basis.

This is a full time, permanent position and is available for an immediate start (will wait for notice periods as required). To learn more about our organisations visit our websites (www.crowdcomms.com.au & www.galabid.com)

Position Overview:-

We are seeking an applicant with strong customer service and/or sales skills to work in the promotion of the services offered by both CrowdComms & GalaBid. We feel that the position is likely to suit a return to work parent that is seeking an enjoyable position within a professional and fun company.

You will be primarily cold calling companies primarily within the Events industry to introduce our market leading and highly successful products. Dependent on skill level your position may involve ongoing contact and development of clients.  

We offer Flexible Hours and this position is suited to both Full Time or Part Time applicants

Ongoing career opportunities are available for the right applicant.

Your main responsibilities and duties will include:-

  • You will be required to promote/sell our event software to event planners.
  • Outbound calls (cold calling)
  • Preparing / emailing company proposal
  • General administration
  • Working closely with Sales Manager

Your experience, skill set and qualifications will include:-

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Good computing skills (MS Office Basic)
  • Dependable and reliable
  • Experienced relationship builder
  • Confident prospector
  • Hard worker
  • Willing to make cold calls on an ongoing basis

On offer:-

On offer is an attractive salary package commensurate with your level of experience, as well as the opportunity to develop your long term career within an established and professional organisation.

We will be contacting applicants on the same or next day as your application with a view to short listing your details directly to our client.

Salary Range:- Hourly Rate, dependent on experience level
Location:- Brookvale
Position Type:- Either Part Time or Full Time, Permanent Residency required

Verve Process:- Please check your Email SPAM folder as we will forward an email questionnaire

Our client has requested that all applications are handled through Verve Recruitment for an initial short listing process, and that applicants do not make direct contact with the client.

Application process:-

Our process is very straight forward but does require your co-operation & input. Upon receiving your application we will forward an email questionnaire (please check your junk / spam email folder). We will review all replies to the email questionnaire and will invite suitable applicants to have a professional and formal telephone interview. Successful applicants will be short listed directly to our client.

All Verve adverts are real and active

Privacy Statement:- We reserve the right to and may choose to forward applicants collected information to the employer in relation to this position.

job_ad_details:
Air New Zealand continues to lead the field in Air Transport, carrying not only passengers, but a wide range of Cargo across the globe.  It demonstrates the tenets of the Go Beyond strategy to take the business to the highest levels of customer experience, our execution in the marketplace, our safety, operational excellence and commercial intensity, and importantly our leadership and our culture.

job_summary: We are looking for a qualified Vehicle Maintenance Officer to join our team in Cairns.
job_ad_details:
About the role

Your duties will include the repairs and maintenance of all functional elements in our campervans and motorhomes and concentrate around the living area of the vehicle and not so much the mechanical side of the vehicle.

As a Vehicle Maintenance Officer you will also provide technical advice and assistance to the manager and your team to ensure that we meet and exceed customer service standards and guest expectations.

Key responsibilities

  • Undertake repairs, preventive maintenance and refurbishment of our fleet,
  • Provide reliable and accurate maintenance knowledge, expertise and practical application to minimise downtime of vehicles.

Being in the tourism industry, we are operating seven days a week and this position requires your availability five days per week from 8 am to 5 pm, which will also include rotating weekend rosters.

Skills and Experience

We are looking for a team player with good work ethics. A relevant trade qualification (e.g. RV manufacturing, cabinetmaking, carpentry, shop fitting) will be highly regarded. In addition you should have:

  • a minimum of two years practical experience in a maintenance role (e.g. hotels/motel/vehicles/caravans or related),
  • an open driver's license and good driving record,
  • good attention to detail,
  • the ability to work unsupervised within a team environment,
  • a positive can-do attitude,
  • reliability and good time management skills,
  • effective communication skills,
  • Sound understanding of technical use of specific tools,
  • High standards of housekeeping throughout the workshop.

Culture and Benefits
We offer an attractive salary package and you will be able to take advantage of our generous staff rental policy. We love what we do so we also offer you paid camping leave in addition to your annual leave entitlements so you can enjoy our product with your friends and family on free staff famil trips.

About the company

Apollo Motorhome Holidays is an Australian success story. A privately owned company headquartered in Brisbane, it has grown to become a global player in the Recreational Vehicle products and services market, with operations in Australia, New Zealand, USA and Canada. Our business portfolio includes vehicle rental, manufacturing and sales activities.

job_summary: Have you led mid sized projects in the mining industry? Make the move to our Hail Creek site in Queensland!
job_ad_details:
• Opportunity to work with a leading open cut mine with modern fleet of haulage trucks
  • Great development opportunity with a family-friendly 9-day fortnight, drive in drive out roster
  • Residentially based in Mackay with a coastal lifestyle - Hail Creek, Queensland - Hail Creek

 

About the role

We are looking for a Mine Projects Engineer to design, communicate and monitor capital and operational projects required to support Hail Creek Mine operations. This includes developing the designs, scopes of work, budgets, schedules and monitoring systems of major earthwork projects needed to run Hail Creek mine such as drainages, flood levees, rehabilitation projects, topsoil management tasks and dams.

This role is a great opportunity to take a leading role in design and delivery of capital and operational projects up to approx $10m in value. Reporting to the Short Term Planning Superintendent, you will be:

  • Developing the engineering scope of work and work packages.
  • Managing design consultants for technical approvals
  • Liaising with internal stakeholders and clients to ensure business needs are catered for during the scoping, planning, execution and close-out of projects
  • Maintaining close contact with site based project activities including periodic site visits and temporary site secondments.
  • Providing mudmaps and machine guidance files as required to implement earthworks designs.
  • Ensuring accurate drawings and other as-constructed information for new installations are internally registered and available

 

About you

To be successfully considered for this role, you should have:

  • A Bachelor Degree in Mining or Civil Engineering from an accredited University
  • Several years of experience in a similar role, ideally in an open pit mine
  • Ability to carry out and interpret earthwork engineering designs
  • Capacity to manage projects from inception through to close-out within defined standards
  • Ability to interpret and disseminate technical information between internal and external stakeholders
  • Reasonable level of proficiency in basic business software (Excel, Word and PowerPoint or similar)
  • Basic proficiency in business management software (SAP or similar)
  • High level of proficiency in CAD software, preferably MineScape, Deswik and / or similar
  • Basic proficiency in 3D modelling software, preferably 3D-Dig
  • Excellent numerical analysis and data validation skills
  • Financial models
  • Knowledge of relevant mining legislation and industry practices

It will also be beneficial if you have:

  • Membership of the Australian Professional Body working towards Chartered Professional (CP) Status and / or Queensland Board of Professional Engineers RPEQ status.
  • Experience in other heavy industry, aside from mining, will also be highly regarded.

 

Where you will be working

Located 90km south-west of Mackay in central Queensland, Hail Creek Mine is a modern open cut coal operation. Winner of the Australian Coal Mine of the Year in 2008, it offers attractive commute rosters out of Mackay, with accommodation in the on-site village boasting modern and comfortable facilities.

 

About us 

As pioneers in mining and metals, we produce materials essential to human progress.

Our long history is filled with firsts. We’ve developed some of the world’s largest and best quality mines and operations, and our people work in around 35 countries across six continents. Aluminium and copper, diamonds, gold and industrial minerals, iron ore, coal and uranium: our materials make up the world around us. You’ll find then in smartphones, planes, cars, hospitals and throughout your home.

 

Creating an inclusive and diverse workforce

We are a diverse team of talented, enthusiastic individuals who foster a culture of inclusion. No matter how they may differ, our people share one thing in common. It’s a belief that work is more rewarding when we are accepted and valued for our differences, not judged by them. We all have something to contribute, and it’s this contribution that makes for a great organization and fulfilling career.

Apply today if you want to work with the latest technology and innovation, in an environment where we challenge you to drive positive change.

Please note, in order to be successfully considered for a role you must complete all pre-screening questions.

job_title: Chief Executive Officer, NSW Institute of Sport
job_summary: * Sydney Olympic Park Location* Ongoing Opportunity * Salary Package $278,263 - $310,374 per annum  Working with us  The NSW Institute of Sport...
job_ad_details:
* Sydney Olympic Park Location
* Ongoing Opportunity
* Salary Package $278,263 - $310,374 per annum
 
Working with us
 
The NSW Institute of Sport (NSWIS) is a National High Performance Centre and Olympic Training facility based at Sydney Olympic Park.
 
NSWIS is an entity within the NSW Office of Sport which includes, the Sydney Olympic Park Authority, Venues NSW, and the Sport Infrastructure, Sport Development, Sport and Recreation Services and Business Services Groups.
 
NSWIS provides coaching, high performance services and training programs in partnership with National and State sporting organisations to elite athletes in NSW to assist them to achieve excellence and success at the international level. It was established as a Statutory Authority under the Institute of Sport Act (1995) to:
 
- Provide coaching, resources, services and access to facilities to enable New South Wales elite athletes to pursue and achieve excellence in sport while also furthering their educational, vocational and personal development
- Foster the development and co-ordination of high performance and talent development programs for New South Wales elite athletes
- Assist the development of Australian sporting performance at international levels through co-operatively developed, and complementary, national programs
 
NSWIS is a core component of a national high performance sport network comprising the Australian Institute of Sport and other State and Territory Institutes and Academies of Sport. It receives the majority of its funding from the NSW Government, with the balance being from sponsors and other partners including national and state sporting organisations and the Australian Government.
 
NSWIS is governed by a Board which determines the policies and strategic plans of the Institute including annual budgets and performance criteria.
 
About the role
 
The Chief Executive Officer leads and manages a multi-disciplinary team responsible for the operation of the Institute including the overall planning, development, operations, marketing, fund raising and corporate services that support the Institutes operations in accordance with the Institute of Sport Act 1995.
 
The Chief Executive Officer is responsible for the day to day management of the Institute in line with the plans, policies and directions of the Board and Minister.
 
Essential requirements
 
* Proven record of operating at a senior executive level in program delivery for a diverse, complex organisation, and managing a multi-disciplinary team in the achievement of business goals and key performance indicators
* Substantial experience, knowledge and demonstrated understanding of the international sporting environment, Australian sport, and elite athlete and high performance sport program development
* Proven record at a senior level of building and enhancing stakeholder relations and strategic partnerships in the context of competing needs and priorities across government and non-government sectors
* Superior communication, negotiation and networking skills to work in a global sporting environment
* Tertiary qualifications or extensive equivalent experience in an appropriate business, or public administration
 
For further information about the role, refer to the Role Description or alternatively contact Matt Miller, Chief Executive, Office of Sport on (02) 8233 1331.
 
How to apply
 
To apply for this role, you need to submit an application through the NSW Government job site http://iworkfor.nsw.gov.au, Job Reference No. 00004S8Q.
 
When applying you need to:
 
* Answer the two pre-screening questions (listed below) – we are looking for you to demonstrate your competency in the focus capabilities in your answer, so please develop your response with this in mind (each answer can be up to 300 words).
 
* Provide a covering letter and resume (maximum of 5 pages) that details your experience and how you meet the capabilities of the role.
 
The attached “Applying for a role in the NSW Public Service” guide from the Public Service Commission explains the selection and assessment process and may assist you in applying for the role.
 
Applying for a role in the NSW Public Service
 
Pre-screening Questions
 
1. Describe a situation where you have managed a complex service delivery program in a highly regulated environment.   How did you identify and measure the required results and prioritise the activities of the program? Did you experience any budget management challenges? How did you deal with any regulatory issues? How did you ensure key performance indicators and program quality objectives were met?
 
2. Describe a situation where you have had to balance the interests of a number of internal and external stakeholders over a sensitive and potentially ethical issue in order to influence negotiations or consultation toward a positive and mutually accepted outcome.  What were the key elements?  Who were the key stakeholders?  What measures did you put in place to find a mutually acceptable and practical solution and to ensure the reputation of the agency was upheld?
 
Job Notes
 
* The successful applicant will be subject to a National Criminal Records Check
* No offer of employment will be made until all relevant clearances are finalised
 
Applications Close: Sunday, 30th October 2016
 
The Office of Sport is committed to building a workplace culture that values diversity and inclusion. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, people with a disability, women, LGBTI, and people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds. If you have any accessibility requirements, please liaise with the contact officer.  We provide reasonable adjustments for people with a disability during the recruitment process and on employment.

job_summary: Fixed Term - 6 Months
job_ad_details:
We are currently seeking a Maintenance & Inventory Planner to join our team for a 6-month fixed-term period. This role will be responsible for satisfying internal and external customer demand for parts through the major machine componentry tracking and maintenance forecasting system (CTS).

This role is for a 6-month period, with the possibility of extension dependent on business requirements

Reporting to the Supply Manager, Surface Products/Encore, duties will include, but are not limited to:

  • Manage/administrate SAP Component Tracking System (CTS) for Joy Global Surface equipment fleet in Australasia. Including all CTS data processing and machine maintenance planning information.
  • Liaise through multiple levels of the business to question, validate, and control accurate equipment and planning data that ensures inventory levels are readily proportioned to business plan and market strategies
  • Provide regular reports detailing status of stocked Inventory, Inventory performance and at-Risk items.  Expedite stock outs on inventory with stocking parameters
  • Act as the primary contact and change agent for Australasian Machine Planning & Component Forecasting, for internal and external customers.
  • Action additional tasks and requests as and when requested to support the business

To be successful in this position, the following skills and experience is required:

  • High school certificate preferred with passes in Mathematics and English; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Tertiary education in supply chain systems preferred.
  • Experienced and Competent with the use of SAP or similar MRP/ERP based inventory systems.
  • Previous experience in inventory control and/or inventory management is essential.
  • Previous experience in the large mining equipment and off shore/on shore drilling industry would be an advantage but not essential.
  • Medium to high level of mechanical aptitude.
  • Ability to read and comprehend instructions, short correspondence, parts manuals, and memos.
  • Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees at all levels of employees.
  • Proficiency in MS Office products, such as MS Word, Excel, and Outlook (Intermediate Level).
  • Ability to add, subtracts, multiply, and divides in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to calculate pricing and percentages

 

 

Komatsu offers a zero harm culture in the work place, competitive remuneration package, interesting and diverse experience with opportunities to grow professionally in a progressive learning environment.

All applications must be supported by an up-to-date resume and cover letter. Candidates should address each of the selection criteria listed above when submitting an application for this role. 

We are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status

job_summary: Cognizant is seeking experienced Hardware Engineer Specialists to help drive one of our key client engagements in Perth
job_ad_details:
About Cognizant

Cognizant(NASDAQ: CTSH) is a leading provider of information technology, consulting, and business process outsourcing services, dedicated to helping the world's leading companies build stronger businesses. Headquartered in Teaneck, New Jersey (U.S.), Cognizant combines a passion for client satisfaction, technology innovation, deep industry and business process expertise, and a global, collaborative workforce that embodies the future of work. Cognizant is a member of the NASDAQ-100, the S&P 500, the Forbes Global 2000, and the Fortune 500 and is ranked among the top performing and fastest growing companies in the world.


Our Culture

Your passion, integrity and experience are integral to Cognizant's success. You will be welcomed into a dynamic and expanding global leader in IT and Business consultancy where you will be valued for who you are. We take pride in our partnership with our clients, so your ability to add value and provide exceptional service to our clients are fundamental to your success. In return, you will be empowered with opportunities to develop your career and collaborate with talented colleagues in a supportive, diverse environment.
 

At Cognizant we recognize that companies that are open and welcoming to a multi-cultural diverse workforce will thrive with fresh perspectives and collaborative knowledge. Cognizant is focused on promoting & increasing gender diversity and providing a workplace which encourages great participation and an equal playing field, where merit and accomplishment are the only criteria for success.


The Role and Key Responsibilities:

Cognizant is seeking experienced Hardware Engineer Specialists to help drive one of key client engagements in Perth. Your key responsibilities will include but not be limited to:-

  • Define technical requirements and specifications for IoT platforms (communication devices, embedded software, edge computing, cloud computing)
  • Implement IoT technology platforms/solutions
  • Develop business centric designs based on IIoT platform requirements
  • Conceive, design, develop, implement, test and deploy advanced system security solutions and platforms
  • Perform scientific experiments and lead proof-of-concept efforts while partnering closely with business unit leaders to determine value propositions
  • Lead the hands-on design, development and validation of a variety of IoT proof-of-concept projects
  • Participate in design reviews
  • Drive the requirements engineering process for translating business level use cases to clear technical requirements
  • Document design decisions.
  • Proactively identify problem areas and refactor existing designs.
  • Contributes in all phases of the hardware development lifecycle.
  • Provide input ensure a sustainable and cost effective solution is developed.
  • Partner with Data Services team members to ensure sufficient data flow of hardware devices.

 

Skills and Qualifications

The ideal candidate will have:

  • 6-9 years' overall experience in similar roles and industries
  • Tertiary or Trade qualification in Hardware Engineering or Electrical related discipline
  • Hardware design experience a definite advantage
  • Previous employment and job-related duties in a mining industry, heavy equipment, mobile machinery a plus
  • Previous hands-on knowledge of engineering, including: software, integration, embedded systems, trouble shooting, and problem-solving capabilities a plus
  • Previous experience deploying hardware solutions to equipment in the Mining, Construction, Agriculture or logistics industries.
  • Previous experience with Geo location systems and Machine Vision desirable.
  • Experience with design, development and deployment of fixed or mobile plant control systems Desirable.
  • Experience, understanding and deployment of basic RF theory, Wireless and wired networking.
  • Experience with Linux CLI, Bash, Python or similar Scripting Languages an advantage.
  • Knowledge of Hydraulic control and actuation systems desirable.
  • Knowledge of Feildbus Communication Physical layers and Protocols (Canbus, RS232/422/485, Modbus, CanOpen, Devicenet, J1939, J1708, OBDII) desirable.
  • Experience with Sensing and Actuation Technologies and Design Principals desirable.
  • Experience with Design, support or installation of Fleet

Next Steps

If you would like to express interest in role, please click on the APPLY button now. Due to a high number of applicants, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a further discussion. We thank you for taking interest in this opportunity with us. For a complete list of opportunities with Cognizant visit http://www.cognizant.com/careers

Cognizant is committed to providing Equal Employment Opportunities. Successful candidate will be required to undergo a background check.

job_summary: With the recent acquisition of Ignia, Insight is in huge expansion mode and you could be part of this exciting journey...
job_ad_details:
Why work for Ignia?

It's been an exciting time for Ignia over the past few years with a wide range of awards at MAPA, WAiTTA, CRNFast 50, iAwards and Deloitte Technology awards. We have had unprecedented growth - tripling in size across Perth, Melbourne and Sydney! We have been recognised in the BRW Best place to work awards for the past 3 years, currently holding the 8th spot in Asia Pacific for 2016.

Following acquisition by Insight Enterprises last year, we have even more exciting opportunities on the horizon with further growth expected both east coast and west.

We have a passionate and innovative team of consultants with authors, international presenters MVPs and P-Sellers to knowledge share with.

If you want to be at the forefront of what our industry does and build a business you are proud of then talk to us directly for more info.

We also enjoy...

  • Large offices with space to collaborate!
  • Flexible work arrangements
  • Regular company sponsored social events
  • Paid training
  • A culture of innovation
  • Dedicated career pathways and development planning
  • Awards and incentives
  • Supportive and approachable management
  • Competitive salaries and benefits
  • Option to purchase annual leave
  • Fun, friendship and family
     

About the role...

Insight Digital Solutions is passionate about leveraging Microsoft technologies to help customers achieve their goals. Due to our growth, we are seeking an experienced and passionate Practice Manager, to be based in Sydney, to drive our Cloud & Infrastructure Practice on the East Coast. This team is responsible for championing solutions on the Microsoft Cloud platform, primarily deploying Azure services. Your role will be a mix of Pre-Sales, Business Management, Quality Management, Go-to-market Offerings Development, Capability Management and Team Leadership.

In this newly created role, the Practice Manager is responsible for driving revenue growth, profitability, capabilities, and client satisfaction through the following key activities:

  • Go-to-Market Development
  • Delivery Management
  • Pre/Post-Sales Account Support
  • Proposal Creation and Approvals
  • Client Satisfaction
  • Resource Management
  • P&L and Financial Management
  • Ongoing strategic growth
  • Leadership
     

Your background

  • Prior experience in a Practice Management or Consulting role within a similar environment - managing all aspects of a services business including P&L
  • Demonstrated experience driving services in Cloud and Infrastructure environments
  • Ability to drive sales, presales and new business development activities
  • Demonstrated experience in managing partners and high level stakeholders
  • Strong understanding and broad exposure across the Cloud and Infrastructure landscape
  • Extensive team leadership and people management experience
  • Experience in mapping business needs to technology solutions
  • An understanding of consulting methodologies
  • Strong business and commercial acumen
     

We can offer you

  • Newly created role driving significant business growth in a Fortune 500
  • Opportunity to work with multi-industry, enterprise customers on large projects
  • Paid training and time off for study
  • Social, fun culture
  • Dedicated career pathway with promotion opportunities
  • Option to purchase additional annual leave
  • Scroll down below to learn more about us and why we are rated BRW #8 best place to work in Australia!


What now?

If you want to be part of a growing company where you can continue learning, add value and be appreciated for what you do then either apply via Seek or contact me at caitlin.o'connor-veth@ignia.com.au. 

Check out our website for more info and case studies www.ignia.com.au and www.au.insight.com

Due to the amount of applications received we may not be able to respond to all applicants. 

No agencies please. We do not accept unsolicited resumes.

job_title: Customer Service Officer, fixed-term, South/ East Auckland
job_summary: Be the vital front-line link between our customers and our extensive range of products and services in a Kiwibank/New Zealand Post branch.
job_ad_details:
Personality? Professionalism? Perfect!

  • Fixed-term to 30, November 2018
  • Work across a range of locations in East and South Auckland
  • Monday to Saturday - part-time or full-time
  • Enjoy customer service and sales with our great suite of postal and banking products and services

The PostShop has always gone hand-in-hand with great service. That's not the 'scripted' idea of customer service; rather its service with a smile, where you build genuine relationships with people you will see time and time again.

The way you mix personal and friendly service with professional insightful help, as well as your excellent cash handling and computer skills, will be what makes you a very successful Customer Services Officer. You will be the vital front-line link between our customers and our extensive range of products and services in a Kiwibank/New Zealand Post branch where you can feel the heartbeat of your community.

Kiwibank/New Zealand Post provides a comprehensive training programme, which takes place during the week. If you are applying for a part-time position, please note you will need to be available full-time for at least the first three to four weeks during the week to complete your training.

With your training, inquisitiveness, and natural desire to understand a customer's needs, you will know exactly which of our broad range of products and services is needed to give a truly superior experience every time.

We have always been and still are, proud to be Kiwi and Kiwi owned. This is an excellent opportunity for you to join one of New Zealand's most trusted names. In return, we promise you a supportive and helpful environment with a remuneration package that rewards you for your efforts, provides benefits and plenty of career opportunities.

The hours for these roles are part-time and full-time and working across various locations in East and South Auckland.

All applicants will be required to provide proof of their eligibility to work in New Zealand. Appointees will be subject to a security and credit check.

Applications close on Wednesday, 28 February 2018.

job_summary: * Work for an iconic industry leader with state of the art products * Dynamic role with the opportunity to make significant impact * Project role *
job_ad_details:
Are you looking for the opportunity to make your mark with an iconic industry leader? Located in Wacol (West Brisbane) we are currently recruiting for a Project Quality Leader to manage a number of projects on a full time, fixed term basis (contract term until late 2020).

Reporting to the Quality Director, the main purpose of the Project Quality Leader role is to drive the application of quality tools in product & process projects by: 

  • Identifying strengths/weaknesses of product & process;
  • Identifying product & process project risks;
  • Contributing to the creation of the quality assurance plan (QAP) and quality tool plan (QTP);
  • Applying the quality tools identified in the QAP and QTP;
  • Reporting the results of the application of the quality tools;
  • Taking corrective actions, if necessary;
  • Supporting PSM Committee on decisions.

This role works on product & process projects, as an integrant of the local site project team, by driving the application of the quality tools in the manufacturing plant.  Key to this role is the ability to influences different manufacturing departments (Industrial Engineering, Quality Engineering, Production, etc.) to create cross-functional groups to apply the quality tools.

To be successful in this role you will posses the following qualifications, skills and experience:

  • Degree in Engineering or related field;
  • Six Sigma Green Belt, Certified Quality Engineer or equivalent (preferred)
  • Extensive manufacturing experience with focus on Project, Engineering or Quality
  • Experience leading cross-functional groups on the application of quality tools;
  • Expert on training and applying quality tools (e.g. FMEA, Control Plan, Capability Studies, etc.);
  • Knowledge and experience in problem solving, including root cause analysis;
  • Product & process design experience (well regarded)
  • Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint and Word);
  • Statistical analysis skills
  • High oral and written communication skills

job_title: Perioperative Nurses - we've got contracts for you!
job_summary: Been thinking about heading out bush or to an island? Solid scrub/scout and/or anaesthetics experience?? We can show you the road less travelled!
job_ad_details:
Dreaming of rural Australia... ?

CQ Nurse specialises in Rural and Remote nursing. We send nurses all over Australia where their nursing skills are really needed - and certainly challenged!

So what about YOU? What's on your wish list? Always wanted to go bush??? To be successful you must be experienced, fearless, flexible and ready to hit the ground running.

Rural nursing is more than just your hours at work, it's being part of a community and making a real difference in the relatively short time you have.


What do you need?
  • Must have two years experience working in Australia or New Zealand
  • Periop skills (will consider all aspects of perioperative setting)
  • NSW Health require nurses to have the NSW Working with Children's Check - if you have this GREAT! If not, let's head to another state...

What do we offer?

  • A thrill a minute
  • Wonderful locations
  • A supportive, motivated (and not to mention, good looking!) team behind you
  • The opportunity to get paid to travel and cross those wishes off your bucket list!

CQ Nurse send nurses all around rural and remote Australia, with most hot spots in NSW, the Northern Territory, QLD and the Torres Strait. In fact, here are a random selection of destinations you might find a CQ Nurse....Broken Hill, Wide Bay, Tennant Creek, Central Australia, Charters Towers, Mt Isa, Swan Hill, Ingham, Tara, Tully, Cannonvale, Emerald, Griffith, Katherine, Thursday Island, Kubin Island, Darnley Island, Yam Island and the Torres in general, Dubbo, Tocumwal, Biloela, Hervey Bay, Nyngan....and the list goes on! If there isn't a job advertised, we do our best to find a space for you at the destination you wish to visit!

Contracts range from 2 weeks to 12 weeks, single accommodation is included and travel inclusions also apply.

SET your nursing skills on FIRE! Contact CQ Nurse today 07 4998 5550 or send your CV through to recruitmentteam@cqnurse.com.au

job_summary: Typically assistant principals will be responsible for the effective use of the teaching staff and program budget of a defined area of the school's...
job_ad_details:
Location Profile


Maryborough Education Centre is a school where the children and the youth of this community can learn and grow in a supportive, respectful and inclusive environment, where everyone is on a strong learning journey, and where positive and supportive relationships form the basis of all our work. We consistently empower students to strive for challenging aspirations. Students are supported in following their interests and passions through multiple pathways that will successfully lead to positive outcomes in further education, training or employment. The school has a key role in supporting, and working with the wider community in meeting the challenges faced by Maryborough and district. We have a commitment to Collective Impact and the empowerment of the community to re-define its destiny in a positive way.

Vision – to be an inclusive connected flourishing learning community.

Our school values have been developed in consultation with the whole community. They are:

  • Aspiration
  • Kindness
  • Respect

Social – community and demographics

  • On a single site the school comprises facilities for primary, secondary and special needs education
  • The school is highly integrated with a common set of values and behavioural and learning expectations for all
  • Overall enrolment numbers are reflecting the demographics of the Maryborough community
  • Strong and supportive School Council and parent involvement is encouraged.
  • Committed Student Representative Council and a strong student leadership structure
  • Enthusiastic, professional staff team consisting of 76 effective full-time teachers and 41.37 school support staff.
  • Productive partnerships with Central Goldfields Council through the Go Goldfields initiative, University of Melbourne Network of Schools, Central Goldfields Linking Learning Project, service clubs and community groups, Goldfields Schools Network, and Goldfields Business Group
  • The school has a School Family Orientation of .6856

Educational

  • Provision of a vibrant and productive education, Foundation to 12 and Specialist Education.
  • Implementation of Professional Learning Teams to enhance staff effectiveness in best meeting the learning needs of all students
  • VCE, VET and VCAL courses
  • Trade Training Centre
  • Excellent further education pathways established and successful tertiary placements for students.
  • Many enhancement and enrichment opportunities for students such as art, music, instrumental music, musical productions, competitions, after-school activities, and sporting activities.

Technological

  • Bring Your Own Device computer provision is being phased in from 2015
  • Provision of computer suites and notebook trolleys are established throughout the school.
  • Internet and intranet use is supported
  • Data projectors in all learning areas

Environmental – grounds and facilities

  • Classrooms modern and are traditional in their layout
  • Grounds improvements have included the construction of a new oval, primary playspace, Centre Heart development and extensive landscaping in recent years. Additional playground equipment, landscaping and outdoor enhancements are planned for

Selection Criteria


1. Educational leadership

Outstanding capacity for visionary and exemplary educational leadership of a school. Highly developed skills in leading and managing change including the leadership of others in the process of change.

2. Financial, managerial and administrative ability

      1. Outstanding financial, organisational and resource management skills.

3. Planning, policy and program development and review

Exemplary values appropriate to the development of student learning with a demonstrated capacity to achieve high quality student outcomes. Demonstrated ability to implement Department policies to a high level. An understanding of, and a commitment to, the use of learning technologies to improve teaching and learning.

4. Leadership of staff and students

A highly developed capacity to motivate staff, develop their talents and build an effective team. A clear capacity to foster a learning environment that takes account of the individual needs of students and helps students to develop their special abilities and talents.

5. Interpersonal and communication skills

Highly developed interpersonal and communication skills in individual, small group and community contexts. Exemplary values pertaining to personal qualities of objectivity, sensitivity and integrity An ability to work with parents and the community to develop a strong learning environment.

6. Maryborough Education Centre Criterion

Demonstrated ability to work with the local community with a view to increasing enrolments. Ability to liaise effectively with external agencies to meet the learning and social needs of children experiencing vulnerability.

Role


The assistant principal reports directly to the principal.

Assistant principals have a primary responsibility for the management of significant areas or functions within the school to ensure the effective development, provision and evaluation of the school's education program.  In exercising the responsibility, assistant principals will have the authority to make all significant decisions relating to the program, budget and staff relating to their area of designated responsibility within the framework of the school's strategic plan, policies and budget.  Assistant principals will contribute to the overall management of the school through involvement in policy formulation and decision making.

The management of significant school program or functional areas in schools involve assistant principals in the analysis of the needs of students and the translation of state educational policy and frameworks into appropriate education programs to meet the needs of all students.

Typically assistant principals will be responsible for the effective use of the teaching staff and program budget of a defined area of the school's operation and for the oversight and leadership of the educational programs provided utilising these resources.

Responsibilities


Typically, assistant principals perform one or more of the following functions:

   - supervision and coordination of the work of senior curriculum or level coordinators;

   - allocation of budgets, positions of responsibility and other resources within the area of responsibility;

   - supervision of the delivery of teaching programs;

   - management of programs to improve the knowledge and experience of staff;

   - responsibility for general discipline matters beyond the management of classroom teachers and year level coordinators;

   - contribute to the overall management of the school;

Who May Apply


Appropriately qualified individuals currently registered or eligible for registration with the Victorian Institute of Teaching.

EEO AND OHS Commitment


The Department values diversity and is committed to workforce diversity and equal opportunity in schools and all education workplaces. The Department recognises that the provision of family friendly, supportive, safe and harassment free workplaces is essential to high performance and promotes flexible work, diversity and safety across all schools and Department workplaces.

Child Safe Standards


Victorian government schools are child safe environments. Our schools actively promote the safety and wellbeing of all students, and all school staff are committed to protecting students from abuse or harm in the school environment, in accordance with their legal obligations including child safe standards. All schools have a Child Safety Code of Conduct consistent with the Department’s exemplar available at http://www.education.vic.gov.au/about/programs/health/protect/Pages/childsafestandards.aspx

DET Values


The Department’s employees commit to upholding DET’s Values: Responsiveness, Integrity, Impartiality, Accountability, Respect, Leadership and Human Rights. DET’s Values complement each school’s own values and underpin the behaviours the community expects of Victorian public sector employees, including those who work in Victorian Government Schools. Information on the DET values is available at http://www.education.vic.gov.au/hrweb/workm/Pages/Public-Sector-Values.aspx

Other Information


- All staff employed by the Department and schools have access to a broad range of employment conditions and working arrangements.

- Appointment of successful applicants will be made subject to a satisfactory pre-employment conditions check.

-  A probationary period may apply during the first year of employment and induction and support programs provided.

- Detailed information on all terms and conditions of employment is available on the Department's Human Resources website at http://www.education.vic.gov.au/hrweb/Pages/default.aspx

Please note that all applications must go through the application steps described on the original position description.

job_ad_details:
Based on the principle of 'builders training builders' Builders Academy Australia (BAA) is a Registered Training Organisation (RTO) that works with employers, industry and students to achieve exceptional training results at a number of locations around Victoria and up the Eastern seaboard of Australia. BAA delivers a number of qualifications relating to the building and construction sector and affiliated industries such as work health and safety, interior design, and small business management.

BAA draws on its deep connections with Simonds Homes (both part of Simonds Group Ltd) with this close industry link aiding BAA in providing the highest quality curriculum and training services to meet real industry needs. For over 65 years, Simonds Homes have developed an enviable reputation for building Australia's best homes. From humble beginnings, we're now one of Australia's leading homebuilders.

THE OPPORTUNITY

We are looking for a dynamic Course Advisor / Student Services Officer in our Student Services Team to be based at our St Kilda Road, Melbourne office.

Your key responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

  • Providing accurate enrolment advice to prospective students nationally
  • Providing eligibility advice and conducting eligibility assessments based on funded training opportunities
  • Answering / conducting inbound and outbound phone and web-based enquiries
  • Assisting with the preparation of key enrolment documentation
  • Ensuring the accurate management of the student database
  • Converting phone enquiries into student registrations
  • Explaining programs and eligibility requirements to potential clients

Please note: Our staff work varied shifts, availability between 8 am – 6:30 pm weekdays is desired.

WHO YOU ARE

You will be an exceptional communicator - with a clear and concise phone talent, who has a strong customer focus and are able to work well both autonomously and in a team environment. You have the capability to build rapport across all levels of the business, and your ability to prioritise whilst having a flexible and adaptable approach will set you on the pathway to success.

Essential to this role is your knowledge and experience using VETtrak; an understanding of the Skills First funding scheme and proficient use of Microsoft Office programs.

You will have experience in an RTO/administrative environment or similar, as well as a strong suite of organisational, problem solving, time management and planning skills.

WHY JOIN US?

With a 65 year history, Simonds Group has a strong on-going commitment to quality and service to our customers and a deep culture in building stable and rewarding futures for our people.

On offer at BAA is an attractive remuneration package, along with the relevant tools and equipment required to perform your job. Ongoing training and support and a flexible, diverse workplace are all part of the great benefits on offer.

If this sounds like the role for you, click on 'Apply for this job' to submit your application.

job_title: Credit Analyst - Corporate Banking, Industry Analytics and Insights...
job_summary: Excellent opportunity has arisen for a motivated self-starter to join the Corporate Banking, Industry Analytics & Insights team, based in Adelaide
job_ad_details:
• Associate/Senior Associate level

  • Adelaide based

The Business Unit



Industry Analytics & Insights (“IA&I”) is responsible for delivery of best-in-class customer and industry insights to differentiate our sales proposition, as well as portfolio risk management. The team provides robust analysis to support and deliver sustainable credit decisions, within a wholesale banking environment.



The Role



An excellent opportunity has arisen for a motivated self-starter to join the Corporate Banking, Industry Analytics & Insights team, based in Adelaide.



The successful candidate will have analytical responsibility for a portfolio of Corporate Banking customers, as well as involvement and input as part of a deal team for complex customer transactions.



The primary responsibility of this credit analyst role is to efficiently manage a portfolio of Corporate Banking customers, ensuring the ongoing monitoring and management of your customer portfolio are met, specifically risk profiling, financial analysis and preparation of credit submissions..  The successful candidate will also be involved with the origination of new complex transactions, and work closely with the team on private equity sponsored transactions.



You'll collaborate with your analyst peers, product experts, and Relationship Managers to help initiate and structure a range of banking transactions. You will also be required to develop an in-depth understanding of the industries your customers operate within. This includes providing value adding research that can be used by both our customers and internal stakeholders. 



Success in this role will rely on your ability to quickly review, digest and contribute to credit analysis and transaction structuring. In addition, you will need to have strong advocacy skills and be able to influence key decision makers through your demonstrated understanding of both deal specific and industry risks. 


 


Your main responsibilities as an Associate/Senior Associate in the team would include:


  • Build relationships and establish rapport with both clients and internal stakeholders;

  • Ensure that all aspects of the credit process, including the required due diligence, are properly executed;

  • Write credit submissions including detailed risk analysis and financial forecasting, and participate in WIB’s risk process;

  • Participate in a deal team that will evaluate proposals against approved business and credit strategies;

About You - to be successful you will have the following:


  • A relevant tertiary qualification with a major in Accounting, Commerce or Finance preferred;

  • 1-3 years’ experience in banking, finance, accounting or a corporate background;

  • Financial analysis and research skills; with ability to understand financial statements;

  • Financial modelling skills would be highly regarded.;

  • Experience applying a risk mindset and commercial acumen;

  • Strong attention to detail and operational expertise;

  • Client interaction / relationship management experience would be beneficial;

  • Strong communication and influencing skills required to manage relationships with stakeholders.

At The Westpac Group, we have a vision to be one of the world's great service companies – this means helping our people, customers and communities to prosper and grow. We aim to be leaders in diversity, flexibility and as an equal opportunity employer.


 


As part of our commitment to creating a flexible, diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking workplace flexibility. We invite Candidates of all ages, people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.

Attractive salary package
