job_summary: BizTalk Architect. This is a Green-field implementation of BizTalk over Microsoft Azure IaaS cloud VMs, excellent opportunity, read on...
job_ad_details:
With over 4,800 people, and revenues of over $1.1 billion, Datacom is one of Australasia's largest professional IT services companies. Datacom has extensive expertise in the operation of data centres, the provision of IT services, software engineering and management, as well as payroll and customer service design and operations. Founded in 1965 and operating across Australia and New Zealand, Asia, Europe and the US, Datacom has a successful trading history of consistent growth, profitability and a track record of delivering innovative, cost effective technology solutions. 
Our software team in Sydney is going from strength to strength with a focus on developing strategic   and leading edge solutions for our customers across many industries.
 
This permanent position offers the opportunity to demonstrate your skills and to realise your potential. There is a high level of customer contact therefore sound verbal communication and documentation skills are essential. This is a Green-field implementation of BizTalk over Microsoft Azure IaaS cloud VMs.


To be successful in the role ideally you'll have:   
 

  • 10+ years of experience in integration and implementing enterprise service bus and advising on best practice is essential
  • Experience in shaping the delivery of BizTalk as an integration platform in a complex environment
  • Substantial experience in leading the end-to-end design, development and delivery of an integration solution
  • Over 5 years of BizTalk specific experience and expertise in architectural environments and contemporary integration solutions. Exposure to Azure highly regarded but not essential.
  • Understanding of various application integration patterns and frameworks which include but are not limited to asynchronous publish-subscribe, synchronous request reply, guaranteed message delivery and error handling.
  • Knowledge of system capabilities, rules, and architecture
  • The ability to understand and solve client business problems by using integration solutions drawing upon the suitable methodologies and technologies
  • Well-developed interpersonal skills with demonstrated prior experience working in a client facing role
  • Tertiary qualifications in computer science or a related field and/or equivalent industry experience.
  • Experience working in an agile project/program delivery environment

 
Great opportunity to be a part of our emergent software practice in Sydney where we work hard, have fun while we're at it and deliver great innovative solutions for our customers.
 
We're able to provide you with the sheer variety of projects, tools, professional environment and collegial support. Couple that with the potential to grow and develop professionally and personally and you'll start to understand why people thrive in this environment! 
 
The successful candidate will have exceptional problem solving and customer service skills, be professional in appearance and manner and have excellent written and verbal communications skills. All applications are handled in strictest confidence 

Join our new and rapidly growing practice in Sydney Wide range of customers and verticals Expert support and collaboration from internal software teams across AUS/NZ

job_summary: Employment Type: Permanent Part-TimePosition Classification: Librarian Grade 1Remuneration: $64,590 - $84,390Hours Per Week: 30Requisition ID:...
job_ad_details:
Employment Type: Permanent Part-Time
Position Classification: Librarian Grade 1
Remuneration: $64,590 - $84,390
Hours Per Week: 30
Requisition ID: REQ125454
Applications Close: Sunday 22 September 2019

A rare and exciting opportunity exists to join the Library Services Department based at Wollongong Hospital.

What you'll be doing


The position of Librarian (Grade 1) is a facility based position providing services to staff and stakeholders across the district. As such, the position may be required to travel to other sites across the ISLHD. Under the leadership of the ISLHD Library Services Manager, this position will be responsible for: 
- providing a range of library services in research, information gathering and training, and for provision of service at a hospital library. 
- identifying and recommending relevant material for the library. 
- ensuring that the library services adhere to service level agreements. 
- may be required to assist in library projects as directed by ISLHD Library Services Manager. 
- ensuring that the library's team operates as a continuous quality improvement unit. This will include keeping process documentation current, as well as documentation on work and systems, and fostering a customer-focussed and quality based culture.

Where you’ll be working

 

Wollongong Hospital is the Illawarra and Shoalhaven’s major referral and teaching hospital and has bed base of more than 500. The campus, which incorporates the Illawarra Regional Cancer Care Centre, provides a comprehensive range of inpatient, outpatient and community-based services.

 

Wollongong is located an hours drive south of Sydney on a narrow coastal strip bordered by the Royal National Park to the north, Lake Illawarra to the south, the Tasman Sea to the east and the Illawarra Escarpment to the west.  Learn more about the lifestyle benefits of living and working in Wollongong.

 

Wollongong Hospital is committed to equal employment opportunity and embraces diversity and inclusion within its workforce. As such, people from diverse backgrounds are encouraged to apply. This includes but is not limited to Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People, People with Disability, Women and People from Culturally and Linguistically Diverse backgrounds.

 

The values of the Illawarra Shoalhaven Local Health District guide the behaviour and professional standards of our staff and underpin the ways in which we engage with our patients and consumers.  Our CORE Values are Collaboration, Openness, Respect and Empowerment.

 

Visit our ISLHD Youtube Channel to see our people and location in action and follow us on Twitter to stay up to date @IllaShoalHealth.

 

Successful applicants to the role must provide certified documentation of vaccination history and pathology as part of their recruitment documentation. The applicant must be certified as compliant with http://www1.health.nsw.gov.au/pds/Pages/doc.aspx?dn=PD2018_009 before employment can commence.

 

An eligibility list will be created for future Temporary and Permanent Full-Time and Part-Time positions.

 

Please note: Employment of a temporary visa holder may only occur if no suitable permanent resident or citizen of Australia has been identified for this position following suitable labour market testing.

Criminal record checks will be undertaken on successful applicants. 


  1. Relevant degree and eligibility for Associate (professional) membership of the Australian Library and Information Association.
  2. Demonstrated experience with general computer applications and Internet environments, including strong working knowledge and understanding of library management systems.
  3. Demonstrated experience in expert searching, training, and other library tasks to assist staff searching for information to make evidence-based decisions.
  4. Demonstrated ability to work independently and as a member of a professional team; showing initiative, setting priorities, and balancing the demands of a complex working environment.
  5. Demonstrated high level analytical and problem solving skills.
  6. Demonstrated excellent liaison, interpersonal, and communication skills, including the ability to build relationships across a range of professional and disciplinary areas.
  7. Demonstrated high level of professionalism and commitment to quality client service and the ability to work flexibly in a changing environment.
  8. Demonstrated understanding of the continuous quality improvement concepts, person centred care and Core Values of ISLHD.

Need more information? 


  1) Click here for the Position Description
  2) Find out more about applying for this position


For role related queries or questions contact Gnana Segar on (02) 4222 5398 or Gnana.Segar@health.nsw.gov.au

• Co-ordinate Systems Hand-overs to the company.

Essential Skills / Qualifications:
• Minimum of 7 years’ experience, in offshore and fabrication yard commissioning

• Proven track record as a Handover & Completion Engineer or Co-ordinator

job_summary: This is an outstanding opportunity to work with the most recognised leader in the chauffeur driven luxury vehicle business.
job_ad_details:
This is an outstanding opportunity to work with the most recognised leader in the chauffeur driven luxury vehicle business. Since 1904 Australians have relied upon ‘Hughes Chauffeured Cars-Limousines-Coaches’ for their personal transport needs.

Hughes’ fleet is Australia’s only true national, chauffeur-driven vehicle service provider of luxury sedans, luxury people movers, limousines and coaches and is serviced by a 24 hour a day, state-of-the-art reservations and electronic dispatch system with our clients receiving pickup alert via SMS message and can track their vehicle via GPS tracking and we have international connections around the globe and can support you with ongoing work.

Due to an increase in work we are seeking motivated people to operate as contractors running your own business, Hughes has the clients so you won’t be required to chase new business or accounts for payment, as you have the support of a national company with a large variety of clients ranging from Australia’s leading businesses, major hotels, visiting tourists, airlines and ongoing government contracts.

We are specifically looking in Brisbane for the following new late model vehicles being

  • one (1) Luxury Mercedes Benz Sprinter      11 to 14 seats
  • one (1) Luxury Mercedes Benz Viano          7 seats to add to our existing fleet.

We will consider a limited number of the following vehicle types Luxury SUV Audi Q7, Skoda Superb, Holden Caprice sedans or long wheel based European sedans BMW 7 Series, Mercedes S or E Class, Audi A8 sedan as long as the vehicles are in excellent condition and are not older than four years old to join our Brisbane fleet of contractors.

Note you must have your own vehicle and be able to operate as an individual contractor e.g. owner/driver.

You need a professional attitude, strong customer service and excellent people skills, and have a safe driving record and good knowledge of Brisbane and surrounding areas.

We are looking for people who live in South East Queensland, e.g. Brisbane, Ipswich, Gold Coast and potentially the Sunshine Coast.

The opportunity exists to work the vehicle as a team e.g. partners, friends,  father/son, mother/daughter etc, each individual driver needs to hold a ‘Drivers Authorisation’ from QLD Transport and has undergone our stringent training requirements.

Your business needs to be set up as an incorporated company e.g. Pty Ltd company (no sole traders); we can guide you through this.

See our website www.hugheslimousines.com.au

Email your expression of interest outlining your background and provide a contact phone number to jimberther@equitytransport.com.au

job_summary: Join International SOS and work at Randwick, providing clinical support to Defence members on base.
job_ad_details:
International SOS provides clinical staff to the Australian Defence Force (ADF) across NSW & ACT. Our employees play a vital role in ensuring our Airforce, Army and Naval personnel are both physically and mentally equipped to protect our country.

What's in it for you?

  • Full-time or Part-time roles available
  • Competitive Remuneration
  • Ongoing learning and development opportunities
  • Work in well-equipped facilities across ADF bases

 

What will you do?

•Provision of outpatient assessment, inpatient care and health promotion services, as required;

•Administer medications by approved routes, in accordance with legislative requirements under the direct and indirect supervision of a Registered Nurse;( Endorsed Enrolled Nurse)

•Liaison with the Registered Nurse on Duty in relation to patient treatment;

•Participating in Clinical Governance Program including clinical review and peer review;

•Assist with escort of members between health facilities this includes both on-base and off-base facilities; and

•Manage patients in accordance with approved protocols.

•Compilation of appropriate nursing care notes, in accordance with Defence policy and procedures;

•Participation in continuing education programs to further develop clinical competencies;

•Participating in continuing education programs to further develop clinical competencies and meet AHPRA CPD requirements;

•Checking and ensuring that all medical equipment is serviceable prior to use; and

•Assist in other duties as directed.

 

What do you need to apply?

Looking after the health of our Defence Force, and proactively managing health issues is paramount! In order to do so, we require our applicants to:

•Be an Australian Citizen (Baseline Security Clearances can only be granted to Australian Citizens)

•Enrolled Nurse Certificate or Certificate IV in Health (Enrolled Nursing) and current unconditional registration with AHPRA

•If enrolled nurse registration is prior to 2008, applicant must have a board approved qualification in Administration medication course

•Current basic life support qualification.

Demonstrate a minimum of two (2) full-time years (or part-time equivalent) post registration experience in Acute care

 

How to Apply

To apply, please click on the link and ensure you attach your resume (listing full-time/part-time hours worked against each position)

These roles provide an exciting and challenging opportunity, for clinicians who are interested in stepping out of their comfort zone. If you’re interested in discussing these opportunities further, don't hesitate to email: kylie.farrugia@internationalsos.com

About the Position

We have a great opportunity for a Third Party Logistics (3PL) Manager to drive customer service improvements and contract management across our New South Wales (NSW), internal and 3PL sites. This is a hands-on position focusing on facilitating customer service, increased cost reductions and continuous improvement initiatives across both the alcohol and non-alcohol businesses of the Asahi Beverages group.

Key Responsibilities

  • Drive Internal and external customer engagement

  • Align tactical plans for region to centre led strategies for 3PL providers
  • Identifying opportunities for and implementing continuous improvement initiatives through third party providers
  • Maintain and build on 3PL relationships across the region to ensure effective partnerships are sustained
  • Ensure key performance indicators are met through third party providers, across quality, cost, delivery, safety, environment, & motivation objectives
  • Change management

About You

  • Continuous Improvement techniques would be highly advantageous (e.g. lean, Six Sigma, Project Management skills)

The Benefits

It's an exciting time to join Asahi Beverages, one of the leading beverage companies in Australia and New Zealand.

job_summary: SCC require the services of a Nurse Call & Security Technician to oversee activities associated with our call bell, DECT phone, security systems.
job_ad_details:
Work Smart. Live well!

 


Based within Southern Cross Care's Central Maintenance team in Adelaide, SCC require the services of a Nurse Call & Security Technician to oversee activities associated with our call bell, DECT phone, security systems and building systems across multiple sites.

Reporting to the Facilities Manager, you'll support users and carry out all service scheduling of our various systems, advising on request statuses related to our systems as outlined above. You'll also provide helpful support to users with call-point and handset issues, and facilitate changes to settings, systems and programs once appropriate approval is obtained. At all times you'll observe our protocols and procedures for dealing with support requests, escalating to management when appropriate. You'll also play a role in the installation and configuration of call systems, including new installs and call point removals, as well as programming and the removal of DECT extensions. Where new systems require implementation, you'll participate in supporting roll-outs, and also provide one-on-one training to Residential Care and Maintenance staff on using systems and associated equipment. You'll also liaise with site managers, staff and authorities to coordinate scheduled outages as required, and resolve faults via remote assistance and/or contractor assistance as needed. At all times you'll be able to build strong working relationships and deal professionally and effectively with the representatives, residents, suppliers and contractors across our various sites.

Ideally you'll have demonstrated skills in customer service including within a person-centred care environment, be able to plan and meet business goals, display sound judgment and problem resolution abilities. You'll also be comfortable with managing change, developing teams on the ground and be an excellent manager of projects, time schedules and finances.

An Electrical or Restricted Electrical License (applicable to the tasks to be undertaken in the Job Description) and a current drivers license is essential for this role, and certificates of competency in nurse call, communications & data, IT and security systems would be highly regarded. Possession of a diploma or certificate in cabling would also be looked upon favourably. Experience in a trade or equivalent background, while not essential, would be highly advantageous.

All our employees require a current National Police Certificate for the purpose of Aged Care.

For more information on the position, please refer to the Job Description.

Enquiries: Scott ODonoghue on 1300 764 801

Applications close:  Thursday, 23 June 2016.

job_summary: Strong Leader wanted to ensuring management of engineering contracts in relation to rolling stock maintenance project in Canberra
job_ad_details:
Company: 

We are a multinational group with over 100 years of experience in the supply of comprehensive transit solutions positioned at the forefront of technology for high value added sustainable mobility. The company is a leader of the railway industry offering one of the most comprehensive and flexible arrays of products in railway related markets, such as rolling stock, components, infrastructure, signalling and services (maintenance, refurbishing and financial services).

CAF has been awarded the contract to supply and maintain the Light Rail Vechiles in Canberra. 

 

The Role:
As a Warranty Manager, you will be responsible for working with a variety of internal and external contacts and for ensuring thorough management of engineering contracts in relation to rolling stock maintenance project that is just starting in Canberra.

Your key responsibility in this role is to ensure that all agreed contract terms are adhered to. You will manage contracts ensuring these are correctly enforced to maximise company revenue and minimises potential loses. 

You will manage & enforce non-inventory warranty arrangements with suppliers. Where necessary you will manage the claims process for recapturing costs with suppliers and expedite these in a cost effective and timely manner.

You will also have general responsibilities in alerting the relevant engineering management or support management to any technical engineering, operational or commercial concerns. You will have full responsibility for Warranty Outcome Reports and Variable Cost Claims. This will run from negotiation to settlement. Manage financial risks in relation to engineering activity e.g. reducing costs of engineering contracts and ensuring off-chargeable costs are efficiently collected.

 

The Candidate:
You will be technically gifted with a strong knowledge of rolling stock and enjoy building great relationships not just in internally within your organsiation but also with external suppliers. Have experience in the rail industry or have worked in a maintenance environment together with  preference of knowledge ranging from traction, cause & effect and performance & reliability.


Requirements:

Ability to demonstrate strong working relationships and good rolling stock knowledge as well as being competent at administrations duties. 

We are looking to fill this role ASAP. If you're interested in this Warranty Manager position please APPLY immediately.

job_title: Enrolled Nurse - Amberley Health Centre - Part Time
job_summary: Join the ADF and contribute to positive health outcomes in a unique environment
job_ad_details:
Company description:

  • Must be available to work across a rotating roster
  • Work within a multi-disciplinary clinical team
  • Contribute to positive health outcomes in a unique environment


Job description:

 

About You

You are a passionate and dedicated Enrolled Nurse who is committed to providing the highest quality healthcare. With an ability to put patients at ease, your warmth and care is one of your greatest attributes. You are able to work autonomously, and you thrive in a busy environment where you can make a difference to those in need. You are a respectful and professional person who demonstrates exceptional moral values in everything you do. You are passionate about providing health services and working as part of a multi-disciplinary team to support delivery of the highest standard of care to patients.

 

About the Role

As a Registered Nurse you will be responsible for providing quality clinical care to patients. You will develop and maintain patient care plans, liaise with the multidisciplinary healthcare team to provide co-ordinated patient management, provide assessment of patients and co-ordinate outpatient and inpatient treatments.

 

To be successful in this role, you will have:

 

  • The highest levels of personal integrity and ethical behaviour.
  • Current unconditional and unrestricted registration as a Registered Nurse with the Australian Health Practitioner Regulation Agency (APHRA).
  • Full-Time Post Graduate experience in an Acute Health Care Setting (or part-time equivalent).
  • Full-Time  Post Graduate experience within the previous 5 years in an Acute Health Care Setting (or part-time equivalent).
  • Recent participation in Continuous Professional Development (CPD) activities in accordance with AHPRA.
  • Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (HLTAID001) certification.
  • Demonstrated experience and competency with or without a qualification in venepuncture and cannulation.
  • Current Advance Life Support training/ qualification or equivalent (desirable).
  • Ability to use DeHS and other relevant Commonwealth ICT Systems (desirable).
  • Demonstrated experience and competency with or without a qualification in immunisation and vaccination administration (desirable).
  • Knowledge and application of Australasian Triage Scale in a variety of circumstances in both acute clinical and mental health scenarios (desirable).
  • The ability to work independently as well as part of a team to support the delivery of safe, efficient and high quality care to patients.
  • Demonstrated strong oral and written communication skills and the ability to communicate at all levels of the organisation and externally with a range of personnel.

 

This is a position of trust and responsibility and to support this we will conduct a thorough probity assessment, which includes a national police check as an essential selection component for this role.

 

Please note that you must be an Australian Citizen in order to obtain the required Baseline Security Clearance for this role.

 

 

About Us

ADF Health Services Contract provides integrated healthcare services to Australian Defence Force (ADF) personnel across Australia.  As part of this newly-awarded contract, Serco, in partnership with Bupa, will provide defence-ready clinical and support staff across 50+ on-base locations nationally, ensuring that ADF personnel have access to quality on-site medical care.  Our staff take pride in delivering quality health services to achieve outstanding care and our new recruits for the ADF Health Services Contract will be no exception.

 

At Serco, not only is the nature of the work we do important, everyone has an important role to play, from caring for vulnerable people to managing complex public services.  We are a team of 50,000 people responsible for delivering essential public services around the world in areas including Defence, Transport, Justice, Immigration, Healthcare and Citizen Services.  We are innovators, committed to redesigning and improving public services for the benefit of everyone.  To learn more please visit www.serco.com/ahsc.

 

Join Us

If you are inspired to make a positive difference and would like to be considered for this opportunity, please submit your cover letter and resume by clicking the 'Apply Now' button.

 

Serco values of Trust, Care, Innovation and Pride underpin everything we do.  We are curious, creative and collaborative. Our people help in ways that matter.

 

We are committed to diversity and we encourage people from different backgrounds including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, culturally and linguistically diverse and people with disabilities to apply.



Profile description:

Join the ADF and contribute to positive health outcomes in a unique environment

job_title: Dental Nurse/Assistant Part Time (Maternity Leave position
job_summary: Part time (Mon-Thur) on a casual base, 6 month maternity leave position.
job_ad_details:

We are a family dental practice that offer a broad range of services including orthodontics and dental implants with the latest in technology.

 

About the role

Seeked profile:

A solution leadership role with the responsibility for ensuring a robust and fit for purpose IM solution architecture that meets current and future needs of our business.

job_title: Senior Project Officer - My Health Record (Coffs Harbour)
job_summary: Senior Project Officer - My Health Record (Coffs Harbour)
job_ad_details:
North Coast Primary Health Network (NCPHN) seeks an energetic and goal-focused person for the position of Senior Project Officer – My Health Record to be based in Coffs Harbour.   

This position leads the local awareness, education and support to healthcare providers for the national implementation of the My Health Record expansion on behalf of North Coast Primary Health Network (NCPHN). The position is also responsible for delivering local provider engagement activities, including conducting awareness-raising and training events.  

My Health Record is a secure online summary of your health information. You control what goes into it, and who is allowed to access it. You can choose to share your health information with your doctors, hospitals and other healthcare providers.

The Australian Digital Health Agency (ADHA) is a Commonwealth Agency and is the system operator of the My Health Record.  NCPHN is a key delivery partner for the implementation of the My Health Record. 

The Australian Government has committed to creating a My Health Record for every Australian by the end of 2018, unless they choose not to have one. This is an important initiative and will require communications efforts at a local, regional and national level to ensure all consumers are informed about the expansion.  Read more about My Health Record here:   [link removed]https://www.healthygc.com.au/Resources/Digital-Health-My-Health-Record.aspx 

Key responsibilities include developing and implementing an effective local engagement plan for healthcare providers.  To achieve this, the Senior Project Officer must establish relationships with healthcare providers and influence decision makers within healthcare organisations to improve the uptake and meaningful use of My Health Record.

This position is full time (38 hours per week) for a maximum term up to 28 June 2019.  
Part time (32 hours per week) may be considered.

Key Responsibilities and Selection Criteria (which must be addressed in your application) are outlined in the Position Description which you will find on the Careers page of our website here: www.ncphn.org.au 
BEFORE YOU APPLY PLEASE ENSURE THAT YOU HAVE:
1. Downloaded the NCPHN employment application form NCPHN Employment Application Form
2. Completed this application form in full, demonstrating how your experience meets each of the selection criteria in detail.  For assistance, download the Fact sheet – Addressing Selection Criteria
3. Included your CV/resume as a separate document.

You will find the selection criteria in the position description. You then need to click the ‘APPLY FOR JOB’ button below which will take you to the Seek website where you can upload your completed application form and CV.

PLEASE NOTE:  If your application does not include a completed NCPHN application form and does not demonstrate how your experience meets each of the selection criteria, it will be incomplete and will not be forwarded to the selection committee.

This position is classified as Support Services Level 6 under the Health Professionals and Support Services Award, with a commencing salary range of $34.00 to $35.72 per hour (above Award rate) depending on skills and experience.

As a non-profit organisation, NCPHN can offer generous salary packaging opportunities to eligible employees, who are entitled to salary package up to $611.50 per fortnight ($15,899 p.a.) before tax.  For more information please visit www.salary.com.au

Applications close:  8am, Friday 8 December 2017  

Interviews for short-listed applicants are scheduled for the week commencing Monday 11 December 2017 in Coffs Harbour.

Enquiries to Deborah McPherson, Director – Primary Healthcare Support on (02) 6618 5400. HPSS Award, SS Level 6 (paid above Award rate)

job_summary: Join our marketing leading team of Transport and Infrastructure economists in our Sydney office.
job_ad_details:
Associate Director – Transport and Infrastructure Economists

  • Join a market leading team of transport and infrastructure economists
  • Collaborate with sector and technical experts to grow your knowledge and network
  • Choose the way you want to work by embracing our flexible work arrangements

KPMG Australia is part of a global network providing extensive services across a wide range of industries and sectors. Our people collaborate, share their expertise and create innovation as we partner with clients to solve complex challenges, empower change, drive disruption and growth. We look for talented people with the potential to make an extraordinary difference for our clients, our firm and our communities.

Due to rapid growth, we are looking for a talented Associate Director in the transport and infrastructure economics sector to join our Sydney based team and who shares our purpose of inspiring confidence and empowering change for our clients, our people and our communities.

Our National Transport and Infrastructure team provide advice to government and private sector clients on the whole infrastructure lifecycle from policy development, investment decision to delivery. A select number of our services include:

  • Investment prioritisation – We develop capital investment programs including cost-benefit analysis, demand forecasting and economic and strategic prioritisation frameworks, funding strategies and investment appraisal
  • Policy and strategy development – We work with governments to advise on cities and regional development and economic strategies, transport policy and demand analysis, integrated land use planning and infrastructure planning
  • Project development – We help develop major transport and infrastructure projects, from project development through feasibility studies and support the development of a Business Case
  • Governance – We provide advice on governance for major initiatives, projects and agencies according to best practice, and evaluate performance and effectiveness

Your role

In your new role you will be engaged in leading nationally significant policies and projects across Australia. You will work on demanding but intellectually stimulating and challenging work leveraging your existing skills across economics, policy development, analytics and/or business case development. Your role will see you:

  • Immerse yourself in our inclusive, diverse and supportive culture
  • Make a real difference in your community through our social and environmental programs
  • Choose the way you want to work by embracing our flexible work arrangements
  • Lead multiple and concurrent engagements with our transport and infrastructure clients, ensuring we provide high quality services and outcomes
  • Expand and foster your existing relationships with clients and stakeholders
  • Work with teams and staff across different areas of KPMG to share your insights and expertise and collaborate to deliver high quality solutions to our clients
  • Apply innovative and creative techniques to solve complex problems on client engagements
  • Manage and develop our people, in line with KPMG's mission to continually improve and maintain a high performing workplace

How are you Extraordinary?

At KPMG, we believe diversity of thought, background and unique experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities.

To be considered for this opportunity, your qualifications, skills & experience could include: 

A focus on personal growth through professional studies such as a degree in economics/econometrics, public policy, urban/transport planning, engineering, mathematics, computer science, commerce/business
Experience across economic appraisal, analytics, business case development, land use and transport planning and policy development,
You will have developed rewarding and trusted business relationships and networks
Your ability to relate to people and understand motivations and drivers will have been key to your success in leading and/or influencing at a senior executive or partner level
A deep expertise and passion for facilitating and presenting to diverse groups, preferably gained in a professional services firm and/or public sector organisation.

The KPMG Difference

Our people are focused on creating a diverse and dynamic environment that embraces and values differences. We value the variety of unique experiences, qualities and characteristics our people possess and we share and learn from each other.

We are proud to be consistently recognised as an employer of choice for women, and for our achievements in LGBT+ workplace inclusion.

Our commitment to ‘Flexibility’ allows our people to manage the changing demands of work, personal or family life. Explore the links below to hear our people share their experience @ KPMG:

Flexibility empowers wellbeing [link removed]

Flexibility enables contribution to the community [link removed]

Flexibility inspires technology [link removed] & innovation

Flexibility [link removed] supports family


Make KPMG the clear choice for your career and be Extraordinary!

Please apply for this position by submitting your confidential application online.

job_summary: Fantastic opportunity for an IT Professional to join the Systems Integration team and work closely with customers to deliver tailored solutions
job_ad_details:
We have an exciting opportunity for a customer focused and collaborative IT professional.  This newly created role will be responsible for the successful implementation of Systems Integration (SI) solutions as well as providing end user training and support.   

Reporting to the Project and Support Team Leader, this role will be based in either Sydney or Melbourne office but will involve both interstate and some international travel.

Working as part of the SI Solutions Delivery Team you will work closely with our customers to roll out ENDOALPHA solutions and in particular Endobase implementations.  You will build positive and collaborative relationships with our customers to offer tailored solutions that add value to their business.  This role will also work closely with the SI Project Managers to ensure that projects are adequately documented, progressing to plan and delivered to contractual obligations.

To be successful in this role, you will need qualifications in IT, Information Systems or Computer Engineering.  You will also have an ability to consult with customers and provide end-user training.  You will be adept at installing and supporting desktop PC's and servers as well as having a basic understanding of networking, backup and recovery methodologies and storage technologies.  Experience working in an IT or Systems Integration role within the Healthcare sector would be highly regarded.  SQL scripting capabilities, project management and training experience will be advantageous. 

You will have strong communication skills and a can do attitude.  You will also have a flexible approach which will enable you to deal with shifting or changing priorities.  Your self-motivation, high level planning and strong attention to detail will see you hit the ground running.

job_summary: Join one of the top Competition practices in the country in either Brisbane or Melbourne. Work on major national and international deals and advices
job_ad_details:
Competition Associate or SA
4-6+ PQE
Melbourne or Brisbane
Top tier client
 
 
 
Overview:
Our Clients competition practice is a leader in the Australian market, with an enviable and expanding stable of loyal clients, roles in pre-eminent matters across all major Australian commercial centres, top rated partners, and a deep, and externally-recognised pool of first-class associates. 
Their increasing involvement in high profile cross-border matters is boosted by the broader office network.  The outstanding nature of our global practice was recently acknowledged by the Global Competition Review as one of the top 20 "Global Elite" competition practices. 

Recent work:

Recent matters include:
  • Advising a client in securing ACCC clearance of its acquisition of a life insurance businesses in Australia.
  • Advising a Consortium on the successful acquisition of 50.4% of New South Wales state-owned electricity network assets and the transfer of other assets through a 99 year lease including advising on and managing the interaction between the FIRB and ACCC merger clearance processes.
  • Advising an international client on securing merger clearance for the sale of its 32.4% interest in a coal mine to a compeetitor.
  • Advising a major international business regarding an ongoing cartel investigation by the ACCC.
  • Advising a mining client in cartel proceedings brought by the ACCC regarding collusive bidding for coal mining exploration rights.
  • Acting for an international bank in relation to a confidential investigation by an antitrust authority in the PRC.
  • Advising a client on its proposal for third party railway access under the Western Australian Railways Access Regime to operate trains on a competitors network.
  • Successfully defending an ASX20 client in responding to an ACCC investigation and prosecution in relation to its dealings with suppliers.
  • Advising on a Natural Gas Project joint venture in successfully obtaining ACCC authorisation to coordinate its maintenance and shutdown schedule with two major competing LNG producers.
  • Advising a Fintec Payments client in responding to an ACCC investigation into the terms of their contracts with small business merchants (resolved through a court-enforceable undertaking).
  • Representing two major Australian gas producers in the ACCC's market inquiry into competition in the east coast gas sector.
Representative clients:
Key clients include:
  • ASX 20 retailers
  • Global Payments companies
  • Global Mining companies
  • The Commonwealth Government
  • Global Electronics company
  • NBNco
  • Construction companies
  • Big 4 banks
  • Investment banks
  • FMCG's
  • Pharma businesses
 
Job overview:
 
The Competition team is looking for a lawyer with 4+ years' experience in Competition law, who is able to work as part of a team.  The role can be based in either Brisbane or Melbourne.
You will work for a diverse client base across a range of industries including, finance, infrastructure, technology, FMCG, energy & resources, and pharmaceuticals. The team is involved in the full range of Competition matters including, investigations and legal proceedings concerning unilateral conduct or cartels; merger clearances and transaction structuring, authorisations; infrastructure access issues and market inquiries.

Main tasks:
  • Advising clients;
  • Preparing merger submissions;
  • Preparing court documents, including pleadings and witness statements;
  • Compliance training;
  • Business development and networking activities

Description of Lawyer / SA Role:
  • You will already have acquired around 4 to 6+ years Competition experience.
  • You will take day to day responsibility for more straightforward matters and actively progress complex matters with partner, counsel and senior associate support.
  • You will be able to demonstrate well developed drafting skills.
  • You will be confident and effective in negotiations with counterparts.
  • You will be effective in communicating with clients in order to understand their needs and how best to meet them.
  • You will be effective in forming relationships with clients.
  • You will have excellent attention to detail.
Essential skills and experience:
  • At least 4 years Competition experience gained within private practice,
  • excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
  • superior drafting ability
  • a commercial approach
  • strong attention to detail with well-developed analytical skills
  • a willingness and an ability to work across a national Competition team on a wide variety of matters, and occasionally internationally
  • an interest in developing antitrust jurisdictions around Asia, particularly, and
  • a proactive, positive and energetic approach with a commitment to providing excellent service and, a desire to interact with the market and build client relationships

job_summary: LOGISTICS COST AND COMPLIANCE SPECIALIST
job_ad_details:
LOGISTICS COST AND COMPLIANCE SPECIALIST

Your New Company
Exciting opportunity exists for an experienced, strategic and business minded logistics professional to step in and manage the logistics team of a large West Australian company. With a strong focus to safety and customer service, this company is committed to strive for continuous improvement and growth while reducing operating and customer costs.

Your New Role
Based in their offices in South Perth, you will be responsible for providing statistical cost and compliance analysis to the Logistics Team, contributing to the company’s commercial viability by identifying process improvements and cost efficiencies. Where required, you will liaise with and provide commentary to the Finance Business Partner regarding the Logistics Team’s financial outcomes. You will be accountable for managing the cost and compliance for all logistics aspects including safety policies, inventory accuracy, inventory cycle, internal and external auditing and managing damaged stock processes. You will provide expert advice and analysis to contribute to the materials budgetary process and be involved in the creation and negotiation of the 3PL key contract aspects. You will drive continuous improvement by identifying and implementing improvement processes across the entire supply chain while mentoring colleagues to understand cost models, compliance requirements and the budget process. With a strong focus to optimal service you will harness strong relationships with internal colleagues and the company’s 3PL provider.

What You’ll Need to Succeed
The successful candidate must possess a Tertiary qualification in Procurement & Supply Chain/Logistics Management or solid training from APICS or similar inventory management bodies with extensive demonstrated experience in a logistical compliance role. You will have proven strategic process improvement and problem solving abilities, experience developing supply chain processes and cost models and a good knowledge of financial statements, budgets and accounting practises. Knowledge of an ERP system and experience using data management programs is also essential. Desirable criteria include Tertiary qualification in Finance, Commerce or similar, advanced Microsoft Access and Excel skills, knowledge of Australian Accounting Practises.

What You’ll Get in Return
Excellent salary with career progression potential for the right candidate. You will enjoy working for a company that values and encourages strong working relationships between internal and external colleagues.

What You Need to do Now
To apply for this role click ‘Apply Now’. Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

job_summary: 30 hours per week. Driver license required. Good verbal and written English and Russian required.
job_ad_details:
Do you love children and want a fulfilling career working with them? A Takapuna based employer is looking for a nanny for their three children (1, 3 and 5 years old). Verbal and written English and Russian is required to assist with home work (children attend NZ and Russian schools). 30 hours per week 5 days (Monday- Friday) from 8am- 12pm then 3pm- 5pm.

Oldest 2 sons attend school and kindergarden, nanny will be required to drop them off and pick them up. Youngest child is at home primarily, grandmother will help over lunch time.

Nanny is required to drive however we can provide a car.

The successful candidates will have experience working with infants; have a full drivers licence and be able to pass pre-employment drug and police checks. So if you enjoy working with children and want to develop your skills, apply now!

$60k - $65k + super

job_summary: Looking for a strong technical ETL consultant who has worked in a large enterprise Data warehousing environment
job_ad_details:
• This is a long term contract opportunity with a large Loyalty business working within a large Teradata warehouse.
  • You will be responsible for maintaining all DBA functions (development, test, production) in operation 24×7.
  • Performance tuning, including collecting statistics, analyzing explains & determining which tables needed statistics.
  • Multiload, BTEQ, created & modified databases, performed capacity planning, allocated space, granted rights for all objects within databases, et
  • Moved databases between machines.
  • Installed patch sets and upgraded Teradata.
  • Automated data warehousing and datamart refreshes using Transportable table space option.
  • Worked on creating and managing the partitions.
  • Performed database health checks and tuned the databases using Teradata Manager.
  • Used Teradata Administrator and Teradata Manager Tools for monitoring and control the system.
  • Creating and modifying MULTI LOADS and Loading data into IDW.
  • Loading data from various data sources and legacy systems 
  • With the in-depth expertise in the Teradata cost based query optimizer, identified potential bottlenecks with queries from the aspects of query writing, skewed redistributions, join order, optimizer statistics, physical design considerations (PI and USI and NUSI and JI etc) etc. In-depth knowledge of Teradata Explain and Visual Explain to analyze and improve query performance.
Currently there are quite a lot of large analytics projects on the go as well where the Teradata team is responsible for data being available for various AWS/Data Science plaforms so there is a scope to gain skills with Big Data and data analytics as well

job_summary: A growing mining organisation in Brisbane CBD is seeking a Payroll Officer with Pronto experience for 3 months to help during implementation.
job_ad_details:
A well known Coal Mining business in Brisbane is implementing Pronto as their ERP and are seeking an experienced Payroller with experience in Pronto implementation or in using Pronto for a period of 3 months. 

This role requires an experienced, forward-thinking Payroll Officer to help set up a new entity in their payroll system and be solely responsible for the end to end payroll process for this entity during the transition. 

Key duties will include:
  • Liaising with Pronto consultants
  • Testing the new ERP - Pronto
  • Transferring data from their current system to Pronto
  • Setting up the payroll for a new entity
  • End to end payroll process during transition stage
  • Documenting processes
  • Improving processes 
This is a fast-paced, changing but rewarding environment. And this role suits someone hungry, energetic and with a genuine passion for payroll and driving change. To be successful, you must have experience with using Pronto for payroll! 

For more information, please contact  Tiffany Way on 07 3854 3802. Or to apply, hit the "apply" button.

job_summary: Specsavers as a business is constantly expanding, both in Australia and abroad and the opportunities to expand your knowledge base and develop a c...
job_ad_details:
Specsavers as a business is constantly expanding, both in Australia and abroad and the opportunities to expand your knowledge base and develop a career have never looked better. We pride ourselves on providing the foundation for exciting, long-term careers – a home where your previous retail and customer service expertise will be truly valued and you’ll be given the opportunity to thrive.

To secure this role you will need previous experience as either an optical assistant or have a strong background in a retail environment. You will have fantastic organisation and communication skills, able to work effectively in a team, and thrive on working at a fast pace.

What's in it for you? Well not only will you be working for a multi award winning retailer but you will also be offered the following benefits:

  • Your chance to study a professional qualification and grow and develop your technical skill-set within Optical 
  • Have the chance to work with fantastic, well known brands with more than 1,000 frame styles and colours
  • A comprehensive Induction program
  • A supportive culture that can be felt throughout our organisation, wherever you are

How to apply:


If you want a meaningful role in which you can make a long term impact, this could be the opportunity you have been waiting for. 

Please note due to the high volume of applications only successful candidates will be contacted. We thank you in advanced for your interest in Specsavers.

job_title: Commercial/Property Lawyer (3-5 yrs PAE) in Brisbane
job_summary: Commercial/Property Lawyer (3-5 yrs PAE) in Brisbane
job_ad_details:
NB Lawyers are the lawyers for employers who believe in providing specialised legal advice creating peace of mind, preventive measures and developing risk mitigation strategies. Located in Brisbane with an office in Sydney, Adelaide and Cairns we service clients across Australia and are a rapidly growing firm. Our culture revolves around a vibrant, dynamic, solution driven and client orientated atmosphere. We partner with our clients to provide the best outcomes possible and proactive strategies for the future.

Due to continual growth, there is an exciting opportunity to welcome a new Commercial and Property Lawyer (3-5 years PAE) into our Brisbane office. This position will suit a Lawyer who has built a solid skill set in the Property and Commercial area and who wants to now play an active role in continuing to grow the firm and build relationships with clients.

Working on a variety of commercial and property matters you will be providing high quality legal advice. Working closely with clients, you will form the role of trusted advisor and be able to manage clients expectations and deliver the best results. You will also be expected to assist in the continual building of the business and development of your own portfolio of clients.

The successful candidate will have:

  • 3 to 5 years post admission experience (either in a law firm or through in house practice)
  • Solid knowledge and proven experience of commercial and property law
  • High level of verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong analytical and technical skills
  • Bachelor of Laws with a current Queensland practicing certificate
  • An ability to reach standard budgets and targets in a law firm environment; managing deadlines, dealing with unexpected tasks and prioritising work accordingly
  • Good practice of business ethics
  • The ability to work in a team environment and also independently
  • Ideally (but not essential) a client base that will follow you to this new role (bonuses will be available for work brought into the firm upon commencement)
  • Knowledge of other areas of law will be an advantage though not mandatory

A candidate who wishes to work Part Time would also be considered.

In return we offer a highly competitive salary package (depending on experience) PLUS bonuses. Other benefits can be negotiated for the right candidate. We have a well-equipped office on Park Road at Milton and a positive, energetic work environment. In this role you will be provided with support and assistance from various members of the firm, including specialist Marketing, HR, IT and Administration support.

If you are a motivated and passionate Commercial and Property Lawyer looking to get out from behind your desk and help grow our practice as well as provide the highest level of service to our clients then we want you on our team.

Please submit your application to service@nb-lawyers.com.au

Apply now!

To express your interest and be considered for other similar positions, click the 'APPLY' button now and send in your attached resume!

If you receive a call from us within four (4) weeks, you are considered to be shortlisted for the job. Otherwise, please regard that your application was unsuccessful.

Job2Go appreciates all individuals that take the time to apply.

Job2Go is a local recruitment company based in Queensland and Sydney, and has been providing staffing solutions and human resource services to small to large sized companies throughout Australia.

www.job2go.org

job_summary: We have multiple positions available including Sous, Pizzaiolo and Dough Stretchers - casual and full time.
job_ad_details:
The Venue |The Newport

 Set on the stunning shores of Pittwater, The Newport is a vibrant gathering place for all ages. Nestled amongst idyllic gardens, and incorporating various outdoor dining spaces and bars, the sprawling grounds include areas perfect for whiling the day and night away
We've had a blast since opening in March and now we're set for our first summer. To celebrate, we're thrilled to announce our jam-packed calendar of daily experiences, activities and live music events.

The Executive Chefs

Executive Chef - Vincenzo Biondini 
A very talented and has a great knowledge and love of Italian cuisine. His chefs love to work with him for his fun nature and passion for food. He uses produce like vine-ripened San Marzano tomatoes grown in the plains of Mount Vesuvius in Naples and prepares the ingredients using a variety of techniques -  prawns are sautéed in chilli, paprika and white wine, eggplant chargrilled with thyme, capsicum cooked with garlic and bay leaves.

Executive Chef - Sebastien Lutaud 
An impressive career starting in 1996. He has worked at the famous 2 Michelin Starred Pyramid Restaurant for 3 years before assisting Brett Graham to open The Ledbury Hotel which achieved its first Michelin star within nine months of its opening. He completed a two year stint as Sous Chef at Abbey De La Busserie which achieved 1 Michelin star and became Relais Chateau within one year. Just to name a few.

The Role and the Checklist
We have multiple positions available including Sous, Pizzaiolo and Dough Stretchers on both a casual and full time basis. This is a great opportunity to be trained by our industry leading Chefs and enhance your career. 

To be a casual chef at The Newport you will need to:
  • Be ready to work in a fast paced kitchen
  • Able to provide consistent quality 
  • Experience using a wood fired pizza oven at 450c
  • Have a great attitude and excellent work ethic
  • Open to learning
  • Experience working in a high volume venue
  • Be flexible and reliable with availability to work a rotating roster.
  • But - If you don't have experience, that's fine too - we can teach you.
 
Who are we?
Originally a fashion house, Merivale, owned by the Hemmes family, has been established in Australia for 60 years. The Hemmes family are developing and operating pioneers within the hospitality industry - owning a growing portfolio of more than 60 vibrant restaurants, bars, pubs, hotels and event spaces across Sydney. Merivale is built on our people and proudly employs over 3000 of the industry's most exceptional talent.
   
Merivale offers fantastic employee benefits and career development opportunities, along with some extremely generous staff incentives. In particular, there are fantastic leadership development programs within the business that successful applicants will have an opportunity to access. Work alongside industry leading chefs. Amazing pizza all made from scratch! Be part of the opening team - set to open this week!

job_summary: Exciting opportunity for Solution Architects to work on projects for a leading mobile service provider! ***Multiple roles [Network/SDN/OSS]!***
job_ad_details:

    • Service Provider IP/MPLS and Data Center Networking
    • Cloud & Digital Services (IaaS, PaaS and SaaS, IPTV, OTT Video, VoLTE, RCS/VoIP, M2M/IoT, VAS, Mobile & Social)
    • Broadband Access (LTE-A, LTE, Carrier Wi-Fi, FTTX, (N)GPON)
    • IP Transport & Core Network (MPLS, IPv6,CDN, EPC, BNG, DPI, Policy/PCRF, xWDM, OTN, Carrier Ethernet, MPLS-TP, SDH, PBB, L2/L3 VPNs and Analytics)

ROLES:

1x Network Solution Architect - 15+ yrs exp - Drive the network transformation initiative
  • E2E Telecom Network/Solution Architecture
  • Stakeholder management at senior/C-level executive level
  • Work multiple vendor partners for creating deployable solutions

  • E2E Solution Architecture for SDN controllers/applications
  • Provisioning, deployment, and management
  • Stakeholder management at senior/C-level executive level
  • Work multiple vendor partners for creating deployable solutions
  • Experience in Open Day Light (ODL), Juniper Contrail, NSP, Nuage controllers required!

1x OSS Solution Architect - 10+ yrs exp - Drive the OSS solutions for the network transformation project

  • Management of physical network and virtual network inventory solution
  • Real Time OS for the network

  • Product Development & Lifecycle Management
  • Stakeholder management at senior/C-level executive level
  • Work multiple vendor partners for creating deployable solutions
  • Experience of database migration for inventory solution required!

For more information on this role and to find out about other similar positions, please contact David Pace-Feraud on 02-9431-6549, and state the job title.

job_summary: Opportunity for an Accounts Receivable Officer with strong bank reconciliation skills to minimise the risk of bed debts and process allocation
job_ad_details:
Part Time - 30 hours/5 days per week

18 months Max Term contract

Possible additional hours

The Role

We are looking for someone with strong Bank reconciliation skills in which there are a high volume of transactions and a need to liaise with multiple sites daily. Based in our Adelaide Head Office, this role will report into our Finance Manager and have a strong working relationship with the Accounts Receivable Manager.

As a full function Accounts Receivable Officer, you will be responsible for minimizing overdue accounts, debt collections, accurately process allocation of daily EFT payments & cheques, maintaining and reconciling debtor accounts, answering internal/external customer queries, monthly reporting and processing journals such as Refunds, Rebates, Debt Collection Expenses, Bad Debt Recovered and Legal Costs.

Ideal Candidate

  • Strong Bank Reconciliation skills
  • Previous full function Accounts Receivable experience
  • Advanced Excel skills
  • Strong time management skills and the ability to proactively prioritise tasks with little supervision
  • Strong communication skills – both written and verbal
  • High attention to detail
  • High level of problem solving and analytical skills
  • Experience in using a major ERP tool preferably Pronto but not essential
  • Ability to work autonomously as well as part of a team

The Organisation

Oticon Australia is part of a global organisation headed by a parent company based in Denmark, specialising in hearing health. As one of the world's most innovative hearing aid manufacturers, with more than 100 years of experience, Oticon has spearheaded a number of technological breakthroughs which have made a significant difference for people with hearing loss.

We are proud to say that our culture is shaped by a shared belief, that the restoration of good hearing will change lives! We see ourselves as courageous, flexible, genuine and caring individuals who strive for excellence. 

If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you.

job_title: Client-facing Management Accountant - Global Property Business!

Next steps

Initial conversations/meetings will take place early week commencing 4th September, with client interviews to take place later the same week for successful shortlisted candidates.

Ideal role for Management Accountants within high-growth global business Longer term career progression within a business of accomplished professionals Directly client-facing opportunity up to 100k package including super Up to $100,000 package, including super

job_summary: Fox Sports is currently seeking an experienced Service Owner – Business Applications to join our Enterprise IT team.

At Fox Sports, we strive to make every sporting contest better by taking our viewers closer to the game. We are the game changers of sports entertainment because we challenge the conventions of our industry. 

To help us along our journey, we are currently seeking an experienced Service Owner – Business Applications to join our Technology team. 

How will you help change the game?

Reporting to the Head of Enterprise IT, you will be responsible for supporting internal customer applications to enable effective service delivery to external customers. You will provide relationship and service management for both on premise and service-based applications, vendors and corresponding business units.

Job tasks and responsibilities

  • Acting as the Subject Matter Expert for Fox Sports on premise and cloud hosted Business Applications
  • Managing the relationships between the Fox Sports Enterprise IT Team, supported business units and application specific vendors
  • Ensuring maintenance of existing Business Applications is regularly carried out
  • Managing any application version upgrades, ensuring appropriate testing is carried out by applicable business units and vendors
  • Reporting on application performance, up-time and capacity utilisation
  • Providing analysis and recommendations for future Business Application requirements
  • Project management of new application implementations, including management of handover from development teams, vendors and user acceptance
  • Maintaining a customer obsessed approach to application service management
  • Ensuring the integrity of the Change Management process in the context of Business Applications
  • Ensuring that IT Support resources receive adequate knowledge transfer for the provision of Business Application support
  • Acting as a key escalation point for Business Application incidents
  • Ensuring adequate Disaster Recovery and Business Continuity measures, plans, capacity and processes are in place and documented as per the applicable Fox Sports policies

Skills and experience

  • You hold relevant tertiary qualifications and IT service management certification
  • You have worked with various cloud environments such as Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) and Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) solutions
  • You have experience with Agile and DevOps environments
  • You work effectively with internal and external service providers and across culturally diverse teams
  • You have collaborative consulting skills and a sound business acumen

Who are you?

  • You are customer-obsessed in your approach to IT Service
  • You are innovative and a creative problem solver
  • You are a strategic planner
  • You self-manage your time and have a high attention to detail
  • You work well under high-pressured situations in a calm manner
  • You possess excellent communication skills across all levels of the organisation (both verbal and written)
  • You enjoy building and managing strong relationships 

Job benefits and perks

  • A chance to work for an industry-leading company
  • State-of-the-art new purpose-built facility 
  • Competitive salary package

job_summary: Passion for your community? Genuine love of keeping people informed about the important, exciting, happy and sad news?
job_ad_details:
Passion for your community?  Genuine love of keeping people informed about the important, exciting, happy and sad news?

The Weekend Sun needs an assistant editor, your community needs you.

Sun Media Ltd, the Bay of Plenty's vibrant independent news and publishing company is seeking an Assistant Editor for Tauranga’s only community newspaper. The company is looking for an energetic, flexible and knowledgeable journalist who can apply their skills to keep our print publications ahead of the game.

The successful person will be able to work to deadlines, be flexible to get the job done when required, identify news opportunities and produce interesting and engaging content across all audiences. Journalism should be your life, not your 9 to 5.

To be successful in this role you will:

  • Have a Degree or equivalent in Journalism.
  • In depth knowledge of InDesign and publishing experience
  • Preferably have at least two years’ experience working in a newsroom
  • Local knowledge is highly preferred. 
  • Exceptional organisational skills and efficiency are a must.
  • Efficient, conscientious, yet commanding abilities to deal with the public, emergency services, journalists, columnists and photographers.
  • Flexibility and enthusiasm, working to key performance indicators.
  • Excellent computer skills
  • Able to lead your team from the front, as you will be head of the department
  • No political or group bias, recognition that everyone might have a story to tell.

Sun Media dominates the Bay of Plenty news with live news websites, including the award winning SunLive.co.nz, which continually tops the ratings.

Sun Media is the home of many of the Bay of Plenty's leading news, rural and lifestyle publications. A locally-owned company based in Tauranga it produces the very popular Weekend Sun with circulation of 66,000 residential homes; Coast & Country rural lifestyle news, Waterline water-sports magazine, New Farm Dairies.

If you are looking for a challenging role, in a positive and friendly environment, plus the benefits of working with a locally-owned company from one of Tauranga's most beautiful historic buildings located at No. 1 The Strand, apply today.

job_summary: An opportunity exists for an experienced Bid Manager/Senior Estimator to take ownership and assume responsibility for all tender bid submissions.
job_ad_details:
About the business

 

Established in 2005, and based on the Central Coast NSW, Red Eye Constructions specialises in New Construction & Interior Fitout projects in the Central Coast, Hunter, Sydney and Wollongong regions. With an annual turnover of approx. $50Mill we have completed projects ranging in value to $20m in the Health, Commercial and Education market sectors.

 

About the role

 

As Bid Manager / Senior Estimator, you are accountable for all tender bids and will lead the estimating team to ensure effective delivery of tender bid submissions. You will work closely with the client and other stakeholders. In doing so representing the company in a professional and proactive manner. To be successful in the role you shall:

  • Work - Be hands on
  • Have good judgement – Understand the client and their needs
  • With a Client-focused approach - Utilise your building knowledge and experience to deliver optimum tender solutions for Red Eye and the client.

 

Benefits and perks

 

  • Excellent long term career opportunities and career progression
  • Great team culture with onus on support and realistic expectations
  • Supportive and open management

 

Skills and experience

 

Key responsibilities include:

  • Overall management of all tender bid submissions
  • Managing the tender & estimating process autonomously, Scope of Works, BOQ, take offs, estimating, tender negotiation and tender presentation.
  • Prepare, review & submit Tender pricing & Bill of Quantities (BoQ) - Ensure transparency & integrity of Tender pricing information.
  • To forsee / predict the project risks, and to ensure risks are adequately considered and documented to enable successful tender bid delivery.
  • Provide client satisfaction in tender bid delivery to provide best possible opportunity to win work.
  • Developing and building strong rapport with client, tender team, internal and external stakeholders
  • Directing team to deliver quality tender bid submissions

 

To be considered for the role you will require:

  • Bachelor Degree of Building, or Construction Management or commercial building industry experience of 10 years minimum.
  • 3+ years bid management / 7+ years estimating experience in commercial construction or 10 + years Project Management experience.
  • Commercial acumen to ensure customer requirements are understood and considered in tender bid submission.
  • Detailed understanding of project estimating in building construction industry
  • Detailed technical working knowledge of all major building trades, in particular structural and civil engineering design principles including building design process
  • Detailed understanding of contract and commercial including tender decision making processes and procedures
  • Detailed understanding of Program schedule including projects objectives
  • Demonstrated ability to effectively manage the preparation of accurate tenders & proposals on-time
  • Demonstrated Good verbal and written communication
  • Demonstrated ability to adhere to and advise improvements to systems and processes
  • Demonstrated technical experience in Buildsoft (Cubit), Bluebeam, MS Project, and tender software (Cordell, Estimate One, Bid Contender or similar)

For more details see our Website: www.redeyeconstructions.com.au

To Apply:

Email your Resume to: admin@redeyeconstructions.com.au

Please note: shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

job_summary: Small principal lead office seeks internal broker to work with all existing customers and new client leads. Diploma of Finance essential.
job_ad_details:
We are a small, principal lead office, operating in Shenton Park and part of a National franchise group, having won the MFAA Excellence Award in 2014.

We are seeking an internal broker to work with all existing customers and new client leads as generated by our Principal Mortgage Advisor.

Typically this will consist of a broad range of requirements from new purchases, refinance, debt consolidation, multiple property scenarios and review of various customer income and asset positions, providing interest and diversity.

Experience as a senior loans assessor or commercial lending manager within the banking system should have provided you with the range and depth of lending experience to fulfill this role.

Alternatively, 3+ years lending experience within a brokerage and the desire to now focus on providing  all in house, backend broking support for assessing, documenting and submitting loan applications is desired. Your experience will support you to work directly with clients both by phone and in interview.

This role does not require you to generate leads but will rely on your driven ability to actively assess a wide variety of client needs and scenarios, backed up by your strong numeric abilities and practical understanding of financial scenarios and by your ability to read, understand and interpret financial reports and tax returns for the purpose of loan assessment.

Responsibilities will include:

  • To accept and qualify loan applications with a high degree of accuracy and meeting compliance requirements of industry and the company.

  • Demonstrate sound knowledge of a range of finance products for which accreditation training will be provided where necessary.

  • Essential to display a high level of customer service, including a willingness to interview outside of normal hours and at client premises when necessary.

  • Accuracy and attention to detail are essential with both the collection and electronic entry of all required data.

  • Essential qualifications:  Diploma of Finance

    Remuneration:

    Salary package $60,000 - $70,000, commensurate with experience and qualifications. There may be an opportunity for the role to be part time (4 days), in which case the salary would be pro rata in line with days worked.

    After 12months proven effectiveness in the role, the opportunity for increasing income will be via negotiable growth targets and defined rewards.

    Applications: Preferred candidates will ensure their resume clearly demonstrates all aspects of the job brief and will include a highly relevant career summary to be considered. 

Salary Package $60000 - $70000

job_title: Legal Assistant – Dispute Resolution Legal Support
job_summary: AGS Dispute Resolution is seeking expressions of interest from Legal Assistants.
job_ad_details:
• Permanent role
  • APS 4
  • Sydney based

AGS Dispute Resolution is seeking expressions of interest from Legal Assistants.

About us
Australian Government Solicitor (AGS) is the Australian Government’s central legal service. We are part of the Attorney-General’s Department and operate independently and competitively. AGS helps Commonwealth clients to manage legal issues, navigate new challenges and find solutions which deliver the best outcomes for Australia.

AGS is unique. AGS is dedicated to the national interest and is a trusted advisor to Government. We help our clients shape and interpret the law in a way no other legal practice can.

AGS is innovative. We work in collaboration with our clients to provide insight into current and developing legal issues. Our lawyers draw on an exceptional depth of experience, knowledge and talent to partner with our clients to deliver creative solutions to complex legal issues of national importance.

AGS is diverse. We have a team of 650 staff including 370 lawyers who provide specialist advice on more than 40 different areas of law related to government.

About the role
Our Legal Assistants are expected to take an active role in assisting our lawyers to deliver a high standard of legal services to AGS's clients. Tasks will include assisting with preparation of court and tribunal documents and other correspondence, maintaining legal files, assisting with client enquiries, managing lawyers’ diaries and travel, and ensuring administrative procedures such as client billing and reporting comply with relevant AGS requirements.

For further information about the requirements of the role, please refer to the role description available on our recruitment portal. 

About you 

  • at least 2 years’ legal assistant experience
  • a genuine commitment to client service
  • professional judgement
  • accurate touch typing skills and a good understanding of Microsoft applications, in particular Word and Outlook
  • the flexibility to undertake a variety of tasks and work across DR teams
  • a willingness to take responsibility for tasks
  • well-developed written and oral communication skills
  • an interest in undertaking training and development to learn new skills.

Working at AGS

AGS is unique. AGS is a community of professionals dedicated to the public interest. We work collaboratively in an inclusive environment where everyone’s contribution is valued, and success is rewarded. We offer our lawyers commercially competitive remuneration packages, plus 15.4% superannuation and performance-based bonuses.

AGS is innovative. AGS is a centre of excellence for managing complex legal issues for the Commonwealth. We provide open door access to some of Australia’s most respected lawyers, and while our practice is constantly evolving to meet the needs of our clients, our commitment to independence and integrity has remained the same since Federation.

AGS is diverse. AGS is a supportive organisation which embraces diversity in all forms. We understand that work is part of your life and we provide access to a range of flexible working options, generous leave entitlements and wellbeing benefits to support the diverse needs of our staff throughout their career.

To apply
To apply you must be an Australian Citizen and be willing obtain and maintain a security clearance at the appropriate level. To apply for this role, please click 'Apply'.  Applications close on 11 February 2020.

Further enquiries
Further information can be obtained by contacting Steven Minter, Human Resources Business Partner on 02 9581 7783.
