job_summary: Make an impact in our high-performing Sales & Marketing business as a trusted advisor and partner to our corporate stakeholders.
job_ad_details:
About the Role

BP has a rarely-available opportunity for an experienced HR Business Partner to make an impact in our high-performing Sales & Marketing business as a trusted advisor and partner to our corporate stakeholders. The Sales & Marketing portfolio is unusually broad and includes diverse functions such as Asset Management and HSSE. This role is part of a respected and collaborative HR team whereby you’ll be accountable for actively supporting BP’s strategic business agenda through people and cultural initiatives, including a focus on coaching managers with their teams.

Your relationships within our corporate head office will run deep and carry a mixed focus across projects, transformation and execution. You’ll have scope to originate and own a range of projects and initiatives focused on BP’s objectives. Your role will be that of a true business partner; enabling and executing our people strategy and plan, enabling the management of a diverse workforce, workplace investigations, and supporting leadership teams by providing strategic HR interventions, insights & advice. You will also support succession planning, organisational change, reward and performance management, leadership development and various change management projects.

This is an exciting time for BP as we continue to deliver our strategy in a growth market so come and join a team that is focused on partnership, works safely and likes to have fun.

About You

You are a seasoned HR professional, ideally with exposure to fast-moving customer-centric environment such as Retail, FMCG, or a wide variety of service environments. You’ll be searching for a broad, hands-on HR Business Partner role where you can utilise your, critical thinking and business partnering skills to add real value. You have an innate ability to think on your feet, a thirst for imparting advice on best practice, demonstrated commercial acumen and an ability to prioritise in dynamic environments. Most importantly, you will have strong people skills that enable you to work with a diverse team and get the best out of others.


About BP

Our business is the exploration, production, refining, trading and distribution of energy. This is what we do, and we do it on a truly global scale. BP operates with business activities and customers in more than 80 countries across six continents. Every day, we serve millions of customers around the world. We are continually looking for talented, committed and ambitious people to help us shape the face of energy for the future. As a leading energy force in Australia since 1920 and New Zealand since 1946, BP is driven by the upstream exploration, refining of crude oil and natural gas and the downstream marketing supply of petroleum products. Our scope includes Sales, Marketing, Refining, Dealer, Distributor, Convenience Retail, Supply and Logistics. Around 7,000 people across Australia and New Zealand choose to work with us and help us grow. If you share our passion and values of making a difference every day, then bring your talent and experience and join our diverse BP team.

job_summary: We are seeking a talented Project Controller & Administrator to support the HATS Program
job_ad_details:
Boeing Defence Australia (BDA) is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages women and people of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Island descent to be part of an organisation that promotes a diverse and safe workplace environment. Flexible working options are available.

At Boeing Defence Australia you can watch your ideas come to life.

We are helping to shape the future of aerospace and delivering some of the nation's most complex sustainment and development program for the Australian Defence Force.

So from day one - your contribution will make a difference.

Boeing Defence Australia's Helicopter Aircrew Training System (HATS) Program is responsible for the development and support of the Australian Navy and Army Joint Helicopter School, featuring brand new aircraft and a suite of synthetic training devices.

We are seeking a talented Project Controller & Administrator to support the HATS Program.

Based on the NSW South Coast, this role is located in Nowra. Located on the banks of the Shoalhaven River, Nowra is a major centre of the Shoalhaven region known unique character with a spectacular natural environment, growing population and bustling economy. On the doorstep of the pristine waters of Jervis Bay the Shoalhaven's beautiful natural environment plays a central role in the quality of life of the local community.

You will support successful project execution through gathering, analysing and reporting data relevant to HATS Program, whilst also providing administrative support to the wider HATS team.

Responsibilities will include:

  • Development and delivery of key Project Management Office Deliverables in support of the Program Coordinator
  • Development and coordination of Project Management Office key meetings and reviews
  • General administration tasks and travel coordination in direct support of the HATS program and Leadership Team
  • Co-ordinate executive and customer visits, including agendas, logistics, computing and presentation functionality
  • Perform the duties of the Assistant Security Officer (ASO)

To be successful you will have:

  • Experience in collecting, analyzing, and documenting business metrics to aid consolidated reporting
  • Knowledge of, or ability to acquire knowledge of, business software and measurement system tools, processes and methodologies
  • At least 2 years' experience implementing Program Management Best Practices using PMBOK principles and tools

 

Applicants must be Australian Citizens to meet defence security requirements. 

If you would like to see your career take off click Apply now.

 BDA is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages women and people of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Island descent to be part of an organisation that promotes a diverse and safe workplace environment.

job_summary: Procurement Specialist (R-RB113)
job_ad_details:
Do you want to be the person who exceeds your potential?

If you have a desire to succeed and drive your own career, Dimension Data offers you the opportunity to make that happen.

We’re positioned to lead the change in the biggest transformation that the IT industry has seen in decades — and we need your talent, skill, and ambitious ideas. As a Global Top Employer to over 28,000 great people in more than 58 countries, you’ll be working with teams across the world. You’ll be doing great things for our clients and helping them achieve their business ambitions.


At this point in time, we are searching for a Procurement Specialist to help our clients realise their business goals.

As a Procurement Specialist at Dimension Data, you will work closely with our solutions and services architects and take responsibility for bringing product knowledge to the crafting of technical solutions, contributing to the success of our clients' business.

What we will expect you to do:

  •  You will proactively map the client's business requirements to a product solution.
  • We will rely on you to use your excellent interpersonal skills to engage with Engineers, Consultants, Technical Architects and Solution Architects to ensure the technical working and viability of a solution.
  • You will assist with the development and delivery of product training to client facing staff ensuring that they have accurate knowledge about the product, maximizing product sales.
  • And much more...
  • But most of all, we need you to know and understand the market trends associated with the product, which will require working closely with the particular product vendor, enabling business success and meeting client requirements.

Here's what we are looking for in candidates for this job:

Key requirements:

  • Experience as a Procurment Specialist in an IT environment.
  • A relevant diploma or degree.
  • Good English language skills. 

 Key abilities required:

  • Able to effectively communicate with clients, team members and management alike.
  • Able to map the client's business requirements to product solution.
  • Able to promote and position the particular product in the market.
  • Able to obtain vendor certification for your particular product portfolio. 
     
Non-negotiable for us:
  • We need you to have a broad understanding of IT and business practice and processes.
  • We need you to collaborate with product vendors to ensure understanding of the market trends associated with the product.
  • Finally, we care about our clients, our colleagues and the environment and we want you to do the same.

If you think we are missing a trick and you are always brimming with new ideas, we should talk. Contact us today!

job_summary: Join a leading wealth risk team and hold overall responsibility for developing and coordinating the implementation of risk management.
job_ad_details:
Join a leading wealth management businesss. As a member of the Wealth Risk team, you will hold overall responsibility for developing and coordinating the implementation of risk management strategies, programs and projects to identify and minimise all forms of risk, and set wealth’s ultimate risk limits for the wealth Finance function.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Assist and provide AML SME support to the Wealth Businesses, line 1 Partners and stakeholders across the Business lines to meet their AML/CTF/Fraud/AB&C obligations
  • Develop the risk management strategies and tactics for consideration by the board; to enhance the organisations capacity to cost effectively identify, manage and minimise all forms of unacceptable risk
  • Develop the risk management policies, practices and standards for application, and educate and advise on their implementation
  • Lead projects to develop and implement systems for the identification, recording, management and reporting of risk and monitor the efficiency of the systems and their application
  • Provide a consultancy and education service to all divisions/units in risk management to enable them to identify risk and successfully implement programs to manage unacceptable risk
  • Monitor, review and report to the board on risk management performance and practice throughout the organisation to identify and tackle areas for improvement

Key Requirements:

  • Tertiary qualified in Accounting (with a postgraduate qualification in Accounting or Audit preferred), you are a highly experienced senior Finance Risk professional, with demonstrated experience influencing operational risk and compliance, via your detailed knowledge and understanding of the operational risk and compliance management framework, methodologies and controls to business activities.
  • You possess experience within the Wealth Management industry, coupled with outstanding consulting, senior stakeholder management and coaching expertise. You are an expert in the analysis of existing risk and compliance frameworks, and can identify enhancements, methodologies and controls.

To apply please click apply or call Jordan Jessup on +61 2 82893107 for a confidential discussion.

Pan Pacific Hotels Group has over 40 Hotels, Resorts and Serviced Suites worldwide. Our guests and our associates are at the heart of everything we do.  In Australia, Pan Pacific Hotels Group owns and operates five hotels including Pan Pacific Perth which is the 2018 Winner/Finalist of the 2018 Hotel of the Year Awards.

Pan Pacific Perth is currently seeking recruiting a full time Stewarding Supervisor and a casual steward to undertake a variety of responsibility in our Stewarding department. You will be working  across several F&B outlets and Back of House cleaning.

Our stewarding team are responsible for Pot Wash and Dishwashing across multiple service areas, plus assisting with set up and cleaning after service periods, restocking of supplies and equipment and cleaning of work areas in the Preparation and Stores areas.

Job tasks and responsibilities:

As a Stewarding Supervisor, you are responsible for supervising the Kitchen Stewards and supporting the Back of House team to deliver on cleanliness and sanitation whilst supporting our F&B team to provide excellent an Guest Experience.  You will coordinate tasks and team members to deliver on stewarding services whilst maintaining safety, quality and efficiency.  This is a hands on role.

Skills and experience:

  • Experience in a supervisory role in a commercial kitchen or similar working environment.
  • Good communication skills.
  • Ability to work under pressure to deliver on standards efficiently
  • Experience with MS office – spreadsheets, email and preferably experience with Time/Attendance systems.
  • Be a team player with a positive attitude
  • Available to work rotating roster shifts including, days, nights, weekends and public holidays

Job tasks and responsibilities:

Stewards provide back of house support to the Kitchen department. This involves cleaning the Kitchens, sorting and storing of Kitchen equipment as well as maintaining the silverware.

Skills and experience:

  • Good communication skills.
  • Ability to work under pressure to deliver on standards efficiently
  • Current working knowledge of the hospitality / hotel industry.

  • Have basic food preparation skills
  • Be a team player with a positive attitude

job_summary: Pricing and Inventory Analyst
job_ad_details:
Fairfax Media is one of Australia's largest and most diversified media business. Australian Publishing Media (APM) consolidates business units formerly known as Metro Media, Financial Review Group, Fairfax Regional Media, Agricultural Media and FCN NSW. APM has four publishing units (News Media, Business Media, Life Media and Australian Community Media) responsible for content generation and product management for all wholly-owned digital and print mastheads in Australia.

This role will entail provision of operational support to the Pricing & Yield Management group in actively managing the yield and inventory available for monetization and in specifying and delivering changes to pricing frameworks, systems and processes as required. This role has administrative, analytical and strategic focus & support to the business.

Main responsibilities:

  • Conduct daily pricing approvals and pre-approvals in support to sales team.
  • Pricing and Packaging including Dynamic Pricing of products.
  • Collect and analyse data to evaluate current pricing and business rules.
  • Run and establish inventory/yield reports and KPIs for the business.
  • Provide recommendations on tactical and strategic yield & inventory opportunities.
  • Monitor YoY performance and highlight differences and trends.
  • Provide rigorous analysis, articulation and project support for the pricing and inventory team strategies.
  • Maintain effective internal relationships with all staff and synergy with the sales department.

The ideal candidate will have:

  • The Fairfax Media employee qualities in the way you work: show initiative and passion; take risks, but manage the risks; be prepared to think outside the square; and conduct professionally with people internal and external to the business.
  • Ability to analyse, present and make recommendations from data.
  • Confidence in making decisions autonomously to rationalise and justify recommendations.
  • Strong negotiation, verbal, written communication, and interpersonal skills.
  • Exceptional attention to detail, commitment to accuracy & quality assurance essential.
  • Outstanding computer skills including intermediate to advanced knowledge of MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint .
  • Ability to plan and coordinate multiple tasks and prioritise workloads.
  • Ideally, a digital publisher background, an understanding of online advertising landscape, databases and CRM/data mining tools,  tableau experience and relevant role experience.

If you take pride in your work, have a great work ethic and are ready for your next exciting career move, we want to hear from you!

Disclaimer:

Fairfax Media does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Fairfax Media is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

ARE YOU LOOKING TO KICKSTART YOUR CAREER IN HORTICULTURE? AN ENTRY LEVEL OPPORTUNITY IS NOW AVAILABLE FOR YOU!

Eligibility Requirements

job_summary: Start 2020 by joining this vibrant boutique commercial and corporate practice, and take a fresh approach to the law.
job_ad_details:
About the business

 

Edwards + Co Legal is a modern legal practice working primarily with clients in media, digital and technology businesses.  The firm was established 7 years ago to provide a high-quality, value-led alternative to "large law", with a healthy work/life balance and a contemporary approach to legal life.

We have a range of clients, from big names in media through to SMEs, digital start ups and inventors. Our work primarily comprises commercial and corporate transactional work, day-to-day advisory and complex contracting and specialised advice on IP and digital.  We are a progressive and innovative law firm that avidly adopts technologies, such as Trello and Slack, to communicate and collaborate, and help deliver better legal solutions. 

The firm regularly publishes articles on media, IP, data and corporate law topics and has a growing social media presence.  As innovators ourselves, we have developed an interactive tool for businesses called LAWFITⓇ.

 

About the role

 

The commercial lawyer role is a key member of the team, and works closely with the principal, as well as the senior lawyer and paralegals. Working on commercial and corporate legal matters, you will:

  • Provide advice on general commercial and business matters, including stimulating matters for clients in disruptive businesses.  
  • Work on corporate projects, including managing and executing corporate transactions, with particular focus on private equity investments and shareholder arrangements.
  • Draft, negotiate and advise on media, technology, digital and general commercial contracts.
  • Conduct research and provide specialised advice on intellectual property, media, corporate, privacy and data related matters.
  • Publish articles on emerging legal topics and be involved with the marketing of the firm, including through our newsletter (The Disruptive Law Report), social media and the firm's interactive LAWFITⓇ product for businesses.

The successful candidate will be a key part of a dedicated team, that is small in size but powerful in output and impact.

 

Benefits and perks

 

We are not your ordinary law firm. Our boutique office environment is modern and collaborative, with large wireless screens and other connected devices to facilitate working together on legal solutions. 

The office interior has been designed working with one of our design agency clients, and the space is flooded with light and includes a relaxation room and other break out spaces.

We are headquartered in Paddington (5 minutes from the CBD) which is an increasing hub for digital, finance and professional services businesses, and has great cafes, restaurants, bars and shops.

Whilst we work hard on delivering quality work and being leaders in our space, unlike some law firms we are not ruled by the time-sheet.  In this role your contribution is measured broadly, and with a dedicated chill-out space/meditation room in the office, the vibe is strong on work-life balance. 

The role is market salary plus performance bonus.

The successful candidate has an almost limitless opportunity to develop professionally, as the firm continues on its recent growth trajectory.  

 

Skills and experience

 

Candidates should have extensive experience working in a commercial and/or corporate environment in a well regarded private practice or in-house environment. 

It is important to have very well developed skills in contract drafting and providing written advices on commercial and/or corporate legal matters. A large part of the job is producing and collaborating with colleagues and clients on complex agreements, spreadsheets and other documents.

You should have an eye for detail and a strong work ethic, and be comfortable working in a small, dedicated team.

We are a tech-savvy firm. You must be adept at working on documents through Microsoft Word and Excel, and using Dropbox and other communication applications and technologies, or willing to learn quickly. 

You should have demonstrable experience in corporate and/or commercial transactions, such as joint ventures and equity sales. Deep experience in media, IP and technology legal matters is not essential though would be an advantage.  

Those seeking a staid and static office environment need not apply! This is an environment to be interested in, and inspired by, innovation and disruptive changes to the law engendered by digital trends.

We are strong on work-life balance and open collaboration and communication to achieve a healthy workplace culture.

Through our Retail Academy, Vita’s goal is to provide training and support to turn salespeople into top performers and Business Managers into the next Area Managers. We want you to be inspired to grow and develop your career.

You Get What You Work For

For more information on us, please view our careers page at http://www.vitagroup.com.au/content/careers to learn further about our business and dynamic culture.

job_summary: Payroll and Creditors administrator in very modern secondary school environment.
job_ad_details:
A key member of the administration team and the main payroll administrator for a staff of approximately 60.  Responsible for the accurate processing of creditors for both the Primary and Secondary schools.  This role will work in closely with the Business Manager to ensure payroll and creditor transactions are processed in a timely manner to fit in with the financial reporting and payroll cycles.  The location of this position is in a very modern school environment in a busy and friendly open plan office.

Reporting to the Business Manager and the schools Principals this person needs to take control of running all aspects of a secondary school payroll system.  Therefore, a knowledge of payroll is necessary and experience with school payroll and the Novopay system would be a distinct advantage.  

The second part of this position is processing our monthly creditor payments.  Some experience in an accounting position and budget procedures  would be required for this aspect of the role.  Managing the fixed asset register is also part of  what this position involves.

We are looking for someone with great attention to detail and following good systems and processes.  We would love someone who can fit in well with our fun loving team but at the same time have the flexibility and growth mindset to work with initiative and make this job their own.  We run 2 schools, Primary and Secondary,in a rapidly growing area of north-west Auckland.  This position may grow and expand over time as our schools grow.

The hours are 37.5 hours per week - 42 weeks per (ie school term time plus 2 weeks) plus annual leave and public holidays.  We will be paying an hourly rate of between $22 - $24 per hour.

Applications close 4th September 2017

job_summary: To lead the Learning and Teaching Team in coordinating the ongoing review, evaluation and implementation of curriculum programs and delivery of the...
job_ad_details:
Location Profile


Montmorency Secondary College (MSC) is a Year 7 to 12 College situated on seven hectares of parklands on the banks of the Plenty River.  MSC has a current enrolment of approximately 1000 students and 90 teaching and school support staff.

Selection Criteria


Demonstrated exemplary teaching that facilitates excellent levels of student progress and promotes the growth of quality teaching and learning throughout the school.   An excellent understanding of curriculum issues, trends and development, including a clear appreciation of DET policies.   Proven high level skills in educational leadership including a demonstrated ability to initiate plan and manage significant change in response to new educational directions.   Excellent interpersonal and communication skills including high level skills in team building and an ability to work with all members of the school community including staff, parents and students.   Excellent organisational and time management skills.   Demonstrated strong ongoing professional growth and provision of high level professional assistance to other staff.

Please include the following information:

  • A cover sheet providing your name, home address and telephone contact details;
  • A specific response to the selection criteria with regard to the position advertised (no more than one page per criteria);
  • A summary of experience and qualifications (curriculum vitae);
  • Names, contact details, nature of relationship to you, mobile number and email addresses of three referees who can provide information regarding your application in relation to the key selection criteria.  Please note that referees other than those nominated, may also be contacted.

Role


  • To provide significant leadership in the review, development and implementation of curriculum policy processes and programs within the context of the Annual Implementation Plans and the four year Strategic Plan 2019 – 2022.

Responsibilities


  • To lead the Learning and Teaching Team in coordinating the ongoing review, evaluation and implementation of curriculum programs and delivery of the implementation of National Curriculum guidelines.  Also in consultation with the Principal Team leading and managing Victoria as a Learning Community documents and policy directions and FISO initiatives.
     
  • Collaboratively monitor, with the Principal Team the implementation of the four year Strategic Plan, the process of an annual review of the Strategic Plan and to enable modification and refinement of the Annual Implementation plan to achieve the goals.
     
  • To convene and facilitate the Education Subcommittee of College Council, the Learning and Teaching Team, School Improvement Team (SiT).
     
  • To initiate and respond to proposals for curriculum change, policy development, student assessment and decision-making processes, ensuring that decisions are reached, ratified, documented, and implemented, working with the appropriate Key Learning Area Teams (KLA).
     
  • Leading and managing the implementation of whole College improvement initiatives related to the Strategic Plan and College priorities.
     
  • To oversee the Reporting Program, including policy and process documentation, to ensure its compliance with DET mandates.
     
  • To organise curriculum-related pupil free days in consultation with the Strategic Planning Team, determining programs and activities to be presented.
     
  • To be familiar with the Learning and Teaching implications from the monitoring of student outcomes.
     
  • Lead and support innovation in learning through effective use of Learning Technologies.
     
  • To work as a member of the Strategic Planning Team contributing to the overall leadership and management of the College.
     
  • To oversee the effective operation of the School Improvement Team (SiT) to effectively analyse, manage and track data testing and evaluation of the results.
     
  • Leading and managing staff performance and development (review of staff).

Who May Apply


Teachers currently registered or eligible for registration with the Victorian Institute of Teaching and qualified to teach and/or have demonstrated experience in the curriculum area(s) specified for the position.

EEO AND OHS Commitment


The Department values diversity and is committed to workforce diversity and equal opportunity in schools and all education workplaces. The Department recognises that the provision of family friendly, supportive, safe and harassment free workplaces is essential to high performance and promotes flexible work, diversity and safety across all schools and Department workplaces.

Child Safe Standards


Victorian government schools are child safe environments. Our schools actively promote the safety and wellbeing of all students, and all school staff are committed to protecting students from abuse or harm in the school environment, in accordance with their legal obligations including child safe standards. All schools have a Child Safety Code of Conduct consistent with the Department’s exemplar available at http://www.education.vic.gov.au/about/programs/health/protect/Pages/childsafestandards.aspx

DET Values


The Department’s employees commit to upholding DET’s Values: Responsiveness, Integrity, Impartiality, Accountability, Respect, Leadership and Human Rights. DET’s Values complement each school’s own values and underpin the behaviours the community expects of Victorian public sector employees, including those who work in Victorian Government Schools. Information on the DET values is available at http://www.education.vic.gov.au/hrweb/workm/Pages/Public-Sector-Values.aspx

Other Information


Thank you for your interest in this position at Montmorency Secondary College.  If you are experiencing difficulty with Recruitment On Line, please contact Recruitment On Line on 1800 641 943 or Contact Brigitte Hone at the College on 9422 1500.

For further information about Montmorency Secondary College refer to our website: www.montysc.vic.edu.au

job_summary: This position manages and oversees the design, structure and successful delivery of competition and recreation services that support our vision.
job_ad_details:
Major Accountabilities:

Manage the wider programs and competitions team in the coordination and delivery of safe and financially sustainable programs and competitions, including but not limited to:

  • Social Sports (both adult and junior leagues)
  • Intercollege
  • Interfaculty
  • School holiday sports and camp programs
  • UWA Staff Sports Fun Day
  • Programs for external clients and groups such as CELT, Taylors College and more.

Increase participation by giving more customers more access to services. 

Provide the Sport Competitions and Programs team with the management direction and support needed to meet the business unit output goals.  

Provide upward management and support to the Deputy General Manager, with a view to maximising total outcomes and efficiencies. 

Consistent portfolio wide use of organisation wide business systems and tools, guidelines, procedures and policies. 

Form clear operating systems and policies that align to UWA.

Provide accurate and high quality performance reporting.

Achieve successful customer and stakeholder feedback on the quality and appropriateness of program operations.

Be a valued member of the UWA Sport Team.

Meet occupational safety and health and other compliance requirements. 

Key Responsibilities

Combined Management of Business Unit – 40%

Maintain a positive business unit wide approach to:

  • Use of technology and available platforms
  • Business efficiencies and systems
  • Development and implementation of guidelines, procedures and systems. Including the portfolio wide approach to risk management and mitigation
  • Business metric tracking, review and management
  • Revenue generation, reporting and forecasting 
  • Staffing
  • Customer experience, engagement and service
  • Focus on the delivery of core business
  • Collaboration with the Marketing, Communications and Events team to advertise and promote all competitions and programs.
  • Collaboration with other business units and stakeholders of UWA Sport to increase services, program offerings and achievement of organisation wide goals. 
  • Deliver weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual reporting on matters related to service delivery, finance, statistics and quality of service.
  • Delivery of progress and annual reporting related to the use of Student Services and Amenities Fee (SSAF) within the portfolio.

Program Delivery – 40%

Manage the outcomes and deliverables of sporting programs including but not limited to the following:

  • Program structure and offerings, including detailed schedules/fixtures
  • Registration goals and targets
  • Program specific project plans that support efficient and scalable delivery
  • Program delivery standards
  • Equipment maintenance and replacement strategy
  • Additional revenue streams
  • Staffing levels and performance

Research, create and launch new product offerings that increase student and customer engagement and deliver positive business outcomes.

Other Association – 15% 

To be an integral part of the UWA Sport team.

To assist in the delivery of key events.

Other duties as required by the General Manager of UWA Sport.

Occupational Health and Safety - 5%

To comply with the University's, UWA Sport and other regulatory bodies' policies and procedures.

To take reasonable care to ensure personal health and safety in the workplace.

Specific Work Capabilities (Selection Criteria)

Qualifications

Relevant degree, diploma or extensive experience in relevant/associated field.

Experience

Relevant sporting league, event and program delivery and leadership experience, including a working knowledge of league schedules, fixtures, results and other competition management areas.  

Recreation program management and delivery experience, including kids/junior age programs such as school holiday activities. 

Demonstrated experience in stakeholder and customer relationship management.

Experience in the supervision of casual staff and volunteers.

Demonstrated event management and coordination from concept to delivery.

Well-developed communication, negotiation and inter-personal skills.

Experience delivering outcomes within resource allocation and budget.

Competent in the use of computers and a good understanding of their application in the sport and recreation industry. 

Ability to demonstrate initiative and flexibility.

Knowledge

Good knowledge of the Sport and Recreation industry.

Understanding of occupational safety and health issues.

Sound knowledge of the university and/or university sports sector.

Demonstrated capacity to utilise software required for the proper operation of the business unit.

Other

National Police Clearance.

Working with Children Check.

A Class C Licence First Aid Certificate (Desirable)

 


 

$67,114 - $74,624

job_title: Casual Childcare Educators - Metro South Australia
job_summary: Nido Early School is seeking experienced and qualified Educators to join the nest in our services located in the Metro Area of SA on a casual basis.
job_ad_details:
The Nido collection of early schools for children first opened in 2014 to provide families with a new standard of Early Years Education and Care. The word ‘Nido’ is Italian for ‘nest’ (pronounced neeh-doh) and was inspired by the Italian principles of 'Reggio Emilia' the philosophy in which are services are founded on. 

We are seeking Educators to join us at our Metro Area services in south Australia on a casual basis and work flexible hours. As a casual with Nido, you will be allocated your ‘home service’ but will also have the opportunity and be able to work across our other services if you choose including those located in Noarlunga Downs, Aldinga Beach, Kensington Park and Huntfields Heights.

Key Responsibilities

  • Previous experience within a childcare role and delivering high quality early education and care (long day care setting preferable)
  • Flexibility to work at short notice and across different shifts
  • A passion for the Reggio Emilia Philosophy
  • Childcare values that align with the Nido brand
  • Ability to demonstrate innovative and creative thinking
  • A Valid working with Children Check
  • Current First Aid Certificate
Start your journey by applying today with a resume and cover letter outlining your suitability for the position and why you want to join Nido.
  
For further information, visit www.nidoearlyschool.com.au or contact
careers@nidoearlyschool.com.au

job_summary: Currently seeking a Procurement Analyst to join the team in Sydney that will support the procurement function with focus on analysis and reporting.
job_ad_details:
PwC is a firm committed to collaboration and strong relationships that help our clients and our people realise their ambitions. Well known for our technical excellence, we are a firm brimming with energetic and inspirational people who want to build a diverse and enduring career in a progressive, global organisation.


Our National procurement group is responsible for the provision of strategic third party agreements and the management of commercial relationships across our firm. We are currently seeking a Procurement Analyst to join the team in Sydney.


Main purpose of job:

  • Provide support to the Procurement function with a focus on analysis, reporting and measurement to ensure business and team targets are achieved.
  • Provide advice to the Procurement function on leading Procurement practices in relation to internal and external data analysis

Key Tasks:
  • Manage the development, continued improvement and distribution of internal reporting including spend, savings, and management reporting
  • Analysis of spend data for the use of the Procurement function
  • Manage monthly updates of spend and savings dashboards using Microsoft PowerBI.
  • Develop and distribute the quarterly spend reporting on behalf of the Procurement function.
  • Develop and distribute the Procurement teams management reporting to Senior Management
  • Develop and distribute category specific reports as required.
  • Conduct monthly meetings with the relevant procurement managers to collate and verify the accurate calculation of all savings initiatives.
  • Manage the reporting of saving for the Procurement function and provide status updates on a monthly basis.
  • Develop and maintain sourcing evaluation templates for the use of the Procurement function
  • Manage the evaluation process for the Strategic Sourcing Managers, including providing recommendations based on both the qualitative and quantitative results
  • Where required provide training to internal stakeholders on the completion of an evaluation exercise and data analysis.

Key Skills Required:
  • Graduate level or tertiary qualified with a minimum of 2-3 years generalist/analyst experience with demonstrated skills as above
  • An understanding of the end-to-end procurement process
  • Advanced Excel skills, strong data analysis including an understanding of data models and tools such as; PowerPivot, Power Query and Data Visualisation.
  • Good organisation, time management and coordination skills
  • Flexible and approachable
  • Ability to translate data and make recommendations to senior management
  • Sound project management and a strong attention to detail
  • Ability to prioritise and manage own time while being a team player


The offer at PwC:
PwC is one of Australia's leading professional services firms, bringing the power of our global network of firms in 157 countries to help Australian businesses, not-for-profit organisations and governments assess their performance and improve the way they work.


The PwC Australia experience will offer you the opportunity to work with the best people and technology, flexible working arrangements and activity based working, a diverse work place and embedded cultural values in everything we do. We offer reward and recognition for your efforts so you can realise your potential through coaching and career development.


Next step:
Ready for the opportunity of a lifetime? Apply now.

Be part of an inspirational team that values the strength of diversity Develop highly valuable skills in the procurement field Located at our new Barangaroo offices with state of the art facilities

job_summary: Panoramic is looking for a fixed plant fitter that can weld MIG & TIG in most positions on plate and pipe
job_ad_details:
The Company

Panoramic Resources is an ASX listed company established in 2001. Our Savannah underground nickel sulphide mine and processing plant is located in the East Kimberley. The Savannah Nickel Project is a significant Australian sulphide orebody with a +8 year mine life with an exciting future ahead. Our site is undergoing a period of growth and business transformation. The company’s vision is to broaden its exploration and production base, with the aim of being a major diversified mining company in the S&P / ASX 100 Index.

At Panoramic we are high performing, diverse Team who are talented, supportive and inclusive. We are looking for go-getters who are motivated to build a high performing culture.

 

The Opportunity

This is an exciting and unique opportunity to join the surface maintenance crew through an exciting period of growth. If you are a pro-active, forward thinking Mechanical Fitter or Fitter / Boilermaker dual trader, with strong welding skills, this may be the role for you.

This permanent role is offered on a FIFO (Perth, Broome or Darwin) or DIDO (Kununurra, Halls Creek) 15 Days on 13 Days off roster. 

Reporting to the Maintenance Supervisor to provide a high standard of service and maintenance, which will ensure the processing plant and equipment is regularly maintained and operating effectively. 

To be successful in this role it is essential that you have:

  • Relevant Trade Qualification as a Boilermaker or Mechanical Fitter 
  • Previous experience in similar role in a nickel (or relevant) mining environment
  • Able to Arc, MIG & TIG weld in 2,3 & 4G positions and 5G pipe welding
  • Able to read and understand schematics hydraulic/electrical
  • Fault finding and diagnostics experience on fixed plant
  • Computer literate
  • Team Player
  • Current National Police Clearance (within 6 months)
  • Be Able To Pass a Pre-Employment Medical
  • Have Full Rights To Work In Australia - no visa sponsorship can be offered.

 

Experience maintaining and repairing the following equipment would be advantageous:

  • Jaw Crushers
  • SAG Mills
  • Slurry Pumps
  • Flotation tanks & Agitators
  • Filter Press’
  • Paste Plant experience (desired)

 

Where to from here?

If you have a strong commitment to Health & Safety and confidence in your skills and experience as a fixed plant mechanical fitter, we would like to hear from you.

Our values drive our culture and business performance. Panoramic is an equal opportunity employer.  We celebrate and respect people’s differences and commit to being inclusive at all times. We are committed to achieving a diverse and inclusive workforce, and strongly encourage applications from female, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander candidates.

 

NOTE: We will not accept unsolicited CV’S from recruitment agencies/third parties or be liable/responsible for any fees or costs associated with unsolicited CV’s sent directly to line managers.

Branch Sales Support role. 

The Branch Sales Support person will report to the Branch Sales person. This roles requires someone who is able to support the sales person in all of the above duties and carry out a selection of the Sales Person's duties in their absence.

Duties and responsibilities:-

Both roles require strong sales and organisational skills. Good computer skill are a essential and MYOB experience is preferred but not essential.

job_summary: PCA are looking for candidates who are not afraid of a challenge and have exceptional payroll and bookkeeping skills to join our hardworking team.

PCA Ground Engineering is an innovative Company offering design and construction piling and anchoring services throughout Australia.   • Moderate skills in Microsoft Office Products
  • Knowledge of the Building & Construction Award
  • Understanding of Bookkeeping
  • Knowledge of Quickbooks / Reckon

job_summary: You will be an integral part of the legal team demonstrating effective leadership as well as managing and supporting the development of junior lawyers
job_ad_details:
About the role:
Victoria Police' Mission is to provide a safe, secure and orderly society by serving the community and the law. Victoria Police achieves this by:

Preserving the peace;
Protecting life and property;
Preventing offences;
Detecting and apprehending offenders;
Helping those in need of assistance.

The delivery of frontline (operational) policing services is supported by a range of organisational Departments and Commands. The Legal Services Department provides expertise across a range of diverse, often complex, legal issues for and on behalf of the Chief Commissioner of Victoria Police.

The Victoria Police, Legal Practice Division sits within the Legal Services Department and is comprised of various units including the Discipline Inquiry Office, Specialist Crime Lawyers and Chief Examiner's Legal Office.

As the successful applicant, you will be an integral part of the legal team demonstrating effective leadership and self-management of performance and workload, as well as managing and supporting the development of junior lawyers (VPSG2 - VPSG5). This role will also include portfolio management responsibilities, this position reports to the Director, Legal Practice Division.

The role is a full time position; however Victoria Police supports flexible work arrangements, where appropriate, through negotiation.

Your duties will include:

  • The delivery of the highest standards of advocacy on behalf of Victoria Police;
  • Building and promoting the integrity of Victoria Police and Legal Services Department;
  • Provide expert and authoritative legal advice, both written and oral, on a variety of complex and sensitive matters;
  • Provide support to other streams of work undertaken by the Legal Practice Division as needs arise;
  • Self-management of case load and service delivery requirements;
  • Building and maintaining sound relationships with stakeholders and partners;
  • Manage complex, contentious or sensitive information with due regard;
  • Managing a team of lawyers (if applicable); and
  • Mentoring, coaching and supporting the professional development of junior lawyers.


As the successful applicant, you will have:

  • The ability to independently review, manage and conduct complex and sensitive proceedings in state courts and tribunals, including a sound knowledge of relevant court practice and procedures;
  • Extensive knowledge of relevant legislation and experience in the prosecution of complex and sensitive court cases;
  • Significant experience in providing highly specialised expert and authoritative oral and/or written advice and a clear understanding of the implications and effects of decisions made on the basis of that advice;
  • Demonstrated ability to work on a number of complex files simultaneously;
  • Experience in performing legal research with the ability to identify and deal with critical legal issues;
  • Sound leadership and decision making skills;
  • Experience in managing a team;
  • Strong people skills - including high levels of emotional intelligence, self-awareness and Resilience; and
  • A current Unrestricted Practicing Certificate or be eligible to obtain one.
  • Demonstrated experience in Government Legal Practice Administrative Law and/or Criminal Law would be highly desirable.


Requirements and relevant information:

  • The successful applicant will be required to undergo National Security Vetting, achieve and maintain a security classification as determined by the Department Head.  To achieve this, applicants must be an Australian Citizen.
  • This position is located at Victoria Police Centre - 637 Flinders Street, Docklands VIC 3008, however given occasional legal service demand issues; you may be required at times to undertake varied work within other areas of the Department.  This supports the Departments commitment to a flexible and deployable legal workforce and professional development opportunities in a range of legal domains.

Your application must include:

  • Resume
  • Completed application form - attached to the job advertisement.


Applications close midnight, Monday, 10 June 2019 - No applications will be accepted via email.


For further information on this role please contact: Director Sascha Gelfand on (03) 9247 5285 or via email sascha.gelfand@police.vic.gov.au.

If you have a disability/medical condition and require a copy of this advertisement and attached documentation in an accessible format or would like to discuss an access requirements/reasonable adjustment for the recruitment process, please contact VPS Recruitment via email VPSRECRUITMENT@police.vic.gov.au.

About Us:
Victoria Police is a large organisation employing police, public servants and protective services officers. Victoria Police provides support to the community 24 hours a day, 365 days of the year. 

At Victoria Police our goal is for our workforce to reflect the diverse community we serve. We continually seek to attract and retain a diverse workforce which includes people of all genders, ages, religions, disability, sexual orientation, family and caring responsibilities and cultures including people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander heritage. 

Find out what it is like working as a Victorian Public Servant for Victoria Police: http://www.policecareer.vic.gov.au

job_title: Deputy Secretary, Policy and Intergovernmental Relations
job_summary: Reporting directly to Secretary, Department of Premier and Cabinet, this position contributes as a member of the senior executive.
job_ad_details:
The Department of Premier and Cabinet (DPAC) is a central agency of the Tasmanian State Government. DPAC provides a broad range of services to Cabinet, other members of Parliament, government agencies and the community.

Reporting directly to Secretary, Department of Premier and Cabinet, this position contributes as a member of the senior executive, providing strategic leadership and direction on a diverse range of whole-of-government issues, while overseeing designated work units within the Department and negotiating complex intergovernmental agreements.

Leading a multi-disciplinary team and working in collaboration across all portfolios in government, you will:

  • lead high level collaboration and connectedness across agencies with other Deputy Secretaries in relevant portfolios;
  • manage whole-of-government strategic relationships with other tiers of Government, non-government organisations and private sector enterprises, including negotiating complex intergovernmental agreements;
  • oversee the development and implementation of the State Government’s policy framework for Local Government;
  • oversee the strategic leadership and direction in the development of Tasmania’s position on natural disaster relief, recovery arrangements, counter terrorism and other emergency management situation;
  • undertake role of State Recovery Advisor as delegated by Secretary DPAC in line with the Emergency Management Act 2006, and
  • manage the development of complex legislation and support its passage through the Parliament.

Application Process

Please submit all applications directly to info@redgiant.com.au

For a confidential discussion or to obtain a Position Description and application information, contact Joanne Inches directly on 0408 331 311 or email joanne@redgiant.com.au

Applications close at 10am on Monday 27th May 2019

job_summary: Archer supplies labour to many of Australia's premier security companies. Applications are now open to join the team at Archer. Register now!
job_ad_details:
The Opportunity
  
  
  • Expression of interest are being called for qualified Security Officers that would like to pre-register for potential casual employment with Archer in the future.
  • Central to the role is providing professional patrol security services on behalf of various prominent nationwide security companies.
  • Successful candidates will be considered valuable team members of Archers clients team, working in a culture where safety always comes first.
  
  
The Role
  
  
  • Security patrol work. The role of a patrol officer can include the following:
    • General security patrol duties;
    • Alarm response services;
    • Property check services;
    • Patrol guarding duties;
    • Control room duties;
    • Handling queries via phone calls;
    • Report preparation;
    • Fire warden duties; and
    • Other duties as directed.
  • Constant casual work available, up to 38 hours a week.
  • Work primarily consist of evenings and weekends, however some day shifts are available.
  • Work independently but as a part of a larger team.
  • $27.74 per hour + Superannuation.
  
  
Essential Selection Criteria


  
  • Security Officer Licence – must be current and valid.
  • Drivers Licence – must be unconditional (not provisional or international), current and valid.
  • Good Driving History – a copy of your driving/traffic history will be requested prior to employment.
  • Australian Citizenship or the right to work in Australia.
  • Passionate about security, protecting others and their assets.
  • Proven customer service and written / verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to work independently and solve problems autonomously.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Reliable transport to your work location.
  • Physically fit to perform the role.
  
  
Important Notice
  

  • As Archer acts in conjunction with clients, Archer asks that you kindly refrain from contacting Archer offices seeking status updates regarding your application, as Archer will make contact with you as soon as Archer has some meaningful information about your application to provide you with.
  • Please note - this is NOT a job advertisement for an active role that needs to be currently filled, rather a notice that Archer is accepting expressions of interest for candidates that would like to have their application registered for potential future employment with Archer.
  • If in the future a client of Archer has a requirement for personnel/a position to be filled, only Archer pre-registered and pre-screened candidates will be notified to ascertain their availability, with short-listed candidates put forward to Archers client for review.
  
   

Registration Instructions
  

  • Genuine applications of interest must apply by clicking the 'Apply' button within this webpage.
  • You are NOT required to also email or phone Archer about your application. Applications that are emailed to Archer will NOT be considered as Archer manages the recruitment selection process from within software.
  • You are encouraged to complete and screening questions if they are available to you.
  • Further, it is very important that you meet the essential selection criteria, as incomplete applications will not be considered and you will not be notified.
   

Equal Employment Opportunity
  

  • Archer is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.
  • Archer does not discriminate against applicants on the basis of gender, race, sexual orientation, religion, colour, age, national origin, disability or any other status or condition protected by applicable law.
  • As such, Archer encourages people of all experiences, talents and cultures to apply/register for this role.
  

Contact
  

  • Please do not phone Archers office regarding this advertisement or about any positions/recruitment opportunities.
  • If necessary, Archers recruitment team can be contacted via jobs@archersolutions.com.au, however all applications for registration must be made online by following the ‘Apply’ button within this webpage.
  • Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
  

Archer Security Licence Credentials

In accordance with the Security Industry Act 1997 and the Security Industry Regulation 2016, Archer Solutions Pty Ltd (ABN 31 163 872 204) security accreditations are as follows:
  
ACT – Security Industry Master Licence 17502295  |  NSW – Master Licence # 000101251  |  NT – Security Firm Licence SFL1019  |  VIC – Private Security Business Licence # 881 125 30S  |  QLD – Security Firm Licence (Class 1) # 3729205  |  SA – Agents Licence ISL 267751  |  WA – Security Agent's Licence SA48469

job_title: Internal Communications Senior Manager - 12 month contract
job_summary: Do you have proven internal communications experience in financial or professional services?
job_ad_details:
About the role

We are seeking a Senior Manager in Internal Communications to design and deliver an engaging global internal communications program supporting Macquarie's HR and Workplace programs. The role is responsible for both change communications (i.e. campaigns associated with a new initiative, building or rollout) and also for streamlining and facilitating 'business as usual' People and Workplace communications.

Key responsibilities will include:

  • advising on, delivering and developing leadership communications
  • attending HR and Workplace leadership team meetings and advising on communications issues and objectives
  • partnering with HR and Workplace clients across the business to understand their objectives and associated messaging needs - and deliver projects and programs to achieve those objectives
  • working closely with the change management team to develop effective HR and Workplace change communications programs to complement HR and Workplace change management plans
  • driving innovation and consistency in the content and channels for those programs
  • working closely with the central communications team to ensure HR and Workplace communications are aligned with (and appropriately reinforce) Macquarie's Employee Value Proposition and Principles
  • coaching and developing junior members of the team.

About you

To be successful in this role you will be tertiary qualified and have considerable internal communications experience, preferably within financial or professional services. You will also have:

  • prior experience in a change-based internal communications role, ideally cross-border
  • exceptional communication skills including writing and strategic communications planning
  • an interest in HR and a good understanding of 'inside out' brand theory.
  • strong delivery skills across a range of channels, including film and online channels alongside the ability to work creatively with technical material
  • excellent attention to detail and project management skills
  • a track record as a strong team player with a proven ability to build deep working relationships with colleagues and clients of all levels
  • demonstrated flexibility and agility to meet changing priorities.

If you have a hands-on, creative and flexible approach, apply now.

About us

The Corporate Operations Group (COG) brings together specialist support services including workplace, human resources, market operations and technology. COG's purpose is to drive operational excellence through business-aligned services with a focus on quality, cost and risk. COG comprises the following divisions: Business Improvement and Strategy, Business Services, Human Resources, Market Operations, and Technology.

Find out more about Macquarie careers at www.macquarie.com/careers

Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

Do you have a flexible approach? Work with senior stakeholders to advise, develop and deliver leadership comms

job_summary: Compliance Manager - Legal Governance - Financial Services Industry - Circa $130k+ plus super
job_ad_details:
Compliance Manager - Legal Governance - Financial Services Industry - Circa $130k plus super

Your new company
This global entity are looking to appoint an Australian based Compliance Manager within their existing legal and compliance team to focus specifically on best practice legal compliance and governance within the financial services industry.


Your new role

Reporting to a Legal & Compliance Manager your role will involve a great deal of autonomy to introduce new ideas, procedures and practices to existing compliance frameworks. You will create and organise appropriate legal frameworks and introduce and monitor them throughout the business taking a lead on their roll out, this will be applied across various areas of the business both internally and externally, Yours will be a significant role within the business and you will be held accountable and work as a key contact for external agencies looking to audit internal practices and ideally you will have have previous legal compliance audit experience and be used to working in close consultation with the legal and operational stakeholders involved.

What you'll need to succeed
To be successful you will already have similar experience from working in a legal compliance role within the financial services industry, You will be an expert in compliance frameworks in accordance with legal demands on the industry and you will be confident communicator, capable of leading others and be skilled at delivering hands on training sessions to internal staff. Ideally you will hold a legal qualification.

What you'll get in return
In return you will get the opportunity to work with other leading compliance professionals in your industry and have an opportunity to be mentored by one of the best in industry, as well as receive an attractive salary and other reward benefits for your efforts.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

job_summary: This is an exciting opportunity to accelerate your sales and marketing career in a fast paced technology services organisation, immediate start!
job_ad_details:
Role Overview

This exciting, combined sales and marketing role provides the successful applicant the ability to work in an agile manner, managing multiple concurrent responsibilities in an environment that fosters ongoing growth and development. You will have an understanding and passion for Artis technology verticals (including Microsoft Dynamics, SharePoint, SQL, Power BI, Flow and SAP). The role will be predominantly South Australia sales support focussed, with a potential requirement for interstate assistance and travel for marketing support.

We are looking for a up and coming sales and marketing professional to support our sales team, oversee end to end marketing activities aligned with sales activities and marketing campaigns. You will lead the vision for Artis Group’s Digital Marketing, including SEO, SEM, social media and web presence.

If you have experience supporting a successful sales team, enjoy proactively hunting for new business and have experience developing and implementing successful marketing campaigns, we would like to hear from you.

The successful candidate will:

Sales:

  • Support the South Australia Sales Executives by developing new business, maintaining client relationships and accounts.
  • Undertake activities to prospect, qualify, and develop profitable account relationships.
  • Identify sales opportunities by exploring client business needs.
  • Respond to Requests for Proposals (RFPs / RFQs / RFIs), write proposals and statements of work (SOW).
  • Build and maintain positive relationships with external and internal key stakeholders.
  • Demonstrate a full understanding of client business issues and requirements.
  • Support post sales project delivery to maximise potential future sales opportunities.

Marketing:

  • Create digital content, including copyrighting, creative, brochures, flyers, and video.
  • Develop and formalise document templates for use throughout the services sales and delivery lifecycle.
  • Develop internal/external marketing related communications, including but not limited to digital and direct mail.
  • Experience in web content management (e.g. WordPress) advantageous.
  • Experience working with records and document management systems.

We are looking for a sales and marketing professional  with:

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills, with strong attention to detail

Your team.

job_summary: Looking for a role which will fit into school hours? We're looking for an energetic Customer Adviser / Teller to provide superior customer service ...
job_ad_details:
• Become part of Australia’s most respected bank
  • Have a genuine interest in supporting our customers to achieve their finance goals
  • Educate customers on new technologies that will enhance their banking experience
  • Part time; 15 hours per week across 3 days

We're in the business of building confidence, of meeting people wherever they are and guiding them to where they want to go. If you enjoy working in vibrant and energetic teams and are inspired by helping customers achieve the right outcomes, then this is a fabulous opportunity for you.

About NAB

NAB Retail is the largest business within NAB’s Consumer Banking division. With over 5,400 people, our network of over 600 branches means our people are the face of NAB.

In fact, over the past financial year over 2.6 million Retail customers have visited one of our branches seeking our support and guidance.

About the role

The role of Customer Adviser is the foundation opportunity to a start a long term banking career. Our Advisers educate and engage our customers on smarter ways of banking which helps make banking with NAB an awesome experience.

In this entry level Adviser role you will be processing general transactions and completing activities for deposits, insurance and unsecured lending solutions, while being active on the branch floor. This includes answering questions and helping educate customers to provide them with a better understanding of our full range of products and services that may best fit their needs, referring to Specialists and business partners when needed.

As a branch team you will work collaboratively to deliver NAB’s signature customer experience, all while seeing your own learning objectives met and preparing you to advance in your own career. In return for which you will be supported by your leaders to become the best Banker you can be for our customers.

About you

Our retail roles are fast paced and require resilient, self-driven, customer centric people who enjoy being able to create a great experience for all our customers. While banking experience is a nice-to- have occasionally, it’s not essential thanks to our excellent onboarding and supportive training programs.

If this opportunity sounds like you and you wish to do more for our customers and see your career at NAB grow, you will be an Australian citizen or hold current permanent residency status to apply.  

We embrace diversity of thought, style and working arrangements to ensure our workforce is representative of the community that we serve.

We're in the business of building confidence, of meeting people wherever they are and guiding them to where they want to go. If you enjoy working in vibrant and energetic teams and are inspired by helping customers achieve the right outcomes, then this is a fabulous opportunity for you.

NAB Retail is the largest business within NAB’s Consumer Banking division. With over 5,400 people, our network of over 600 branches means our people are the face of NAB.

In this entry level Adviser role you will be processing general transactions and completing activities for deposits, insurance and unsecured lending solutions, while being active on the branch floor. This includes answering questions and helping educate customers to provide them with a better understanding of our full range of products and services that may best fit their needs, referring to Specialists and business partners when needed.

As a branch team you will work collaboratively to deliver NAB’s signature customer experience, all while seeing your own learning objectives met and preparing you to advance in your own career. Providing great opportunity to travel, as a Relief role, this provides relief to Geraldton, Dongara, Northampton - and even Kalbarri and Three Springs. From time to time you may even have the opportunity to travel to Broome, Karratha and Port Hedland.

job_summary: Apply your portfolio, programme or project management expertise in a pragmatic way by leading a team that enables and supports investment decisions.
job_ad_details:
• Permanent, full-time
  • Wellington

Help shape the future of education

At the Ministry of Education, we work together to shape an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes. Our organisation is made up of more than 3,000 talented and committed people around New Zealand, from a wide range of backgrounds and cultures.

While we work in different groups and on different things, we all strive every day to make the biggest difference we can for every child, young person and adult student in our education system.

About our group

The Strategy, Planning and Governance (SPG) group works across the Ministry providing strategic governance, accountability and transparency, communications, stakeholder, legal, risk and assurance, planning and monitoring expertise to ensure the Ministry's work is robust, properly considered and well represented to its stakeholders.

The Corporate Strategy and Performance group works with Senior Leaders to provide quality advice to support the Ministry realise benefits for all learners.

About this role

The Director, Project and Investment Advice (PIA) leads a team that builds the Ministry's capability in portfolio, programme and project management (P3M) and investment advice, including advising Senior Leaders on investment options and decisions. The Director is also responsible for connecting across an aggregated portfolio of change, providing ad vice on prioritisation options and how well it will deliver to Ministry of Education and system-wide objectives.

About you

To be successful in the role, you will be an exceptional relationship manager, adept at thinking strategically at an organisational level, have demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving ability, particularly when dealing with complex issues.

You will also:

  • be able to build a credible team that connects people and is sought after for advice
  • have designed and delivered projects and/or programmes from a 'customer' experience or operational perspective
  • understand and apply the principles of Te Tiriti o Waitangi and tangatawhenuatanga
  • have strong writing skills and be confident advising senior leaders
  • be able to apply technical theory in a pragmatic way to support the Ministry as it develops its capability in the area.

Are you ready to make a difference?

We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds, including Māori, Pacific and those with disabilities, who will enrich our understanding of the education system.

As a government agency, the Ministry is committed to keeping to the Treaty of Waitangi's guiding principles in our work for and with Māori students, their whānau, hapū and iwi.

There is more information in the position description attached, please take a look and if this opportunity sounds like you, please apply now using the 'apply online' button.

For further information, please contact Annie Holmes at annie.holmes@education.govt.nz

Click here to view the role description

Applications close at midnight on Monday, 20 January 2020.

job_summary: Electrical & Communications Design Drafting for the Land and Property Development industry, designing HV and LV power, lighting, NBN Co Communications
job_ad_details:
3E Consulting Engineers is a boutique Electrical Engineering firm in modern offices on St Georges Tce, Perth CBD.

Specific experience and expertise of the company is in electrical system master planning, underground power reticulation to residential, commercial and industrial land development projects, strata title and private reticulation projects to AS3000:Wiring Rules, NBN Co, Telstra and private communications systems, MATV, Security systems, CCTV, Wi-Fi, specialist lighting including street lighting to MRWA and Western Power standards, custom decorative lighting to public open spaces and streetscape enhancement projects, sports field flood lighting, power generation, solar and renewable power generation, energy management and construction phase project management.

The company is owned and managed exclusively by its executive Directors and currently employs a staff of twelve full-time engineering, technical, drafting and support personnel. We offer the full suite of electrical and communications services to any development project including in-house EPR, LFI and soil resistivity testing, specialist clearance studies from existing aerial equipment, specialist lighting design.

This position is particularly attractive for recent graduates and entry level candidates. Full training will be provided.

Your role at 3E would include:

  • Clean Civil CAD in preparation for drafting
  • See projects through from Concept Design to As Constructed Design
  • Use technical knowledge and follow standards to create compliant designs
  • Work closely with Engineers to ensure all designs are drafted in accordance with project expectations, authorities’ standards and safety in design requirements
  • Find creative solutions to problems unique to each project
  • Liaise with Administration to meet client expectations and deadlines

To be considered for the position of Electrical/Communications Draftsperson, you need have relevant technical or TAFE qualifications in the electrical disciplines and design drafting, and be able to demonstrate the following:

  • Previous experience and knowledge of Microstation Powerdraft (V8i) and AutoCAD (2000 or newer) is essential
  • Excellent  attention to detail and quality of work
  • Ability to manage multiple projects and to prioritise, work under pressure and meet project timeframes
  • Ability to work autonomously as well as in a team environment
  • Fast learner, ability to retain technical information with excellent problem solving skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

It would be highly regarded if you:

  • Have a current understanding of the drafting standards for Western Power and NBN Co compliant design work, as well as AS3000 Wiring Rules and other relevant Australian Standards
  • Have previous experience in the industry

This position is available immediately.

Please express your interest by email to admin@3ece.com.au

Call our Office Manager Renee Lance on 6314 9000 for any queries or further information.
