job_summary: We are looking for an enthusiastic and motivated Shepherd General to join our team on Centre Hill Station. Centre Hill is a 4400 ha effective...
job_ad_details:
This is your chance to join New Zealand’s largest farming organisation and help with our business transformation. We want customers to know they can trust the quality of our products and farming and Kiwis to be proud of what we do. Landcorp’s Pamu farms are about farming smart and with care.

The Opportunity

We are looking for an enthusiastic and motivated Shepherd General to join our team on Centre Hill Station. Centre Hill is a 4400 ha effective property located 10 minutes north of Mossburn and 40 minutes from Te Anau. The property is a mixture of both flat and rolling hill country, which runs 35,000 su including 20,000 Romney ewes and 950 in-calf cows and heifers.  It carries all calves through to yearlings and finishes half the lambs, with the balance transferred to other finishing properties. 

This is a great opportunity for a motivated and experienced individual to gain knowledge and to progressively take on responsibilities for the day to day management of stock.

You will bring:

  • Experience or a strong desire to learn about all things stock management
  • Excellent attention to detail and grazing management
  • Effective communication skills
  • A team of well-controlled working dogs
  • Commitment to high standards of quality and safety
  • Current and full NZ drivers licence

We offer an attractive salary with additional benefits, as well as ongoing training and personal development to help you reach your personal and career goals.

The position comes with singles quarters accommodation and fantastic access to recreational activities within the region.

For an informal chat about the role, please contact Robin Dean – Farm Manager on 027 223 8049.

Landcorp provides a safe workplace and the successful applicant will be required to pass a drug and alcohol test and a criminal background check.

You must have the legal right to work in New Zealand to be considered for this role. Apply below, including a brief covering letter and a current CV.

Applications close 5pm, Friday 2nd June 2017.

job_summary: Leverage off your veterinary background to join MPI's  Animal Trade team as an Adviser/Senior Adviser Animal Imports
job_ad_details:
We are currently looking for an Adviser/Senior Adviser to join our Animal Imports Team and help the Ministry for Primary Industries (MPI) seize import opportunities for our primary industries and improve sector productivity, while still adhering to our strict biosecurity rules.

The Ministry works across all aspects of primary production in New Zealand. The new Agriculture and Investment Services (AIS) business unit supports a thriving and sustainable future for farmers, growers, primary industries, and rural communities, and caring for the health and wellbeing of animals.

As a Senior Adviser in the Imports area of the Animal Imports team, you will help develop and maintain import health standards for the import of animals, germplasm and animal products that manage biosecurity risks; and facilitate trade through issuing import permits and providing interpretation and advice to importers and border staff.

To be successful in this role you will have:

  • A veterinary qualification, with relevant technical/professional experience
  • The ability to work effectively in a team environment
  • The ability to work under pressure and in conflict situations
  • An understanding of the principles of quality systems and auditing
  • Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills

If this sounds like you and you have the motivation and desire to be successful within a strong team of professionals, then we want to hear from you!

How to Apply:

To find out more about the Ministry and what we do please click here

To view the position description and/or apply for the role (submitting a cover letter and current curriculum vitae), please click "APPLY NOW" or visit the MPI Careers Site. For tracking and reporting purposes, all applications must be submitted through our online careers portal.

To apply for this role you must hold the right to work in New Zealand or be eligible to obtain it - click here to find out more about work visa eligibility and options.

In order to be considered for this role, applicants must be available to interview within New Zealand or via Skype.

If you have any questions about the role, you may contact Nick Goddard for a confidential discussion on 04 894 0908 or email nick.goddard@mpi.govt.nz

Applications close: Sunday 1 September 2019.

The Ministry for Primary Industries is committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values inclusion and diversity. In return you'll enjoy an inclusive and flexible working environment in a diverse team of people while you're growing your career here in NZ and internationally. job_summary: Seeking hardworking people who can sort, scan, load and unload freight efficiently, and also be able to assist with data entry and other admin work.
job_ad_details:
Over the last 70 years, TNT has built an unparalleled European road network. It was recently acquired by FedEx, one of the world’s largest air express networks. These two iconic companies with approximately 400,000 team members are committed to serving customers around the world.

Take this fantastic opportunity to become part of a $87 billion global company with an exciting future ahead of it. We are looking for proactive and hardworking people who can safely and efficiently sort, load and unload freight, with or without manual or powered equipment within the depot/warehouse. You should also be able to ensure the timely and accurate supply and input of information to enable on-time delivery in perfect condition, whilst providing exceptional customer satisfaction.

The available shifts are:

Part-time night shift: Mon 2.00am to 6.00am, Tue – Thu 2.30am to 5.30am, Fri 11.30pm to 7.00am = 20 hours

Specific Tasks:

  • Handle consignments in order to meet the on-time connectivity targets and processes
  • When handling hazardous material, verify the hazardous material product description, determine any discrepancies in the paperwork and verify proper placarding
  • Follow-up on consignment statuses as a result of internal customers’ queries or a reported discrepancy
  • Detect and report discrepancies
  • Sort and label consignments to the correct delivery area / unit
  • Manifest and prepare freight for lodgement into the linehaul network
  • Lodge freight at Airport or with third party providers within the specified timeframes
  • Operate forklift or electric hoist safely to assist in loading and moving freight
  • Assist with documentation re the manifest, flight folders, delivery orders for the lodgment and retrieval of freight

Attributes:

  • Ability to be innovative whilst maintaining a focus on being Fast, Flexible & Reliable
  • High degree of self motivation and determination
  • Ability to work in a small team
  • Accurate attention to detail
  • Excellent punctuality

If you have prior experience in the freight industry and have a full drivers licence and current fork hoist licence, we would love to hear from you. Good computer experience with sound geographical knowledge would be an added advantage.

To apply please submit a letter outlining your motivation for applying and what qualities make you the best person for the job, together with your CV.

Applications Close: 9-February-2018

job_summary: Champion the Adobe Analytics platform to deliver on the vision of Unbeatable Customer Experience
job_ad_details:
The opportunity:
To deliver the best customer experience possible, first, you need to begin by understanding the customer. A multitude of touchpoints exists between the financial organisation and a customer, each of which is an opportunity to better understand those customers. This aggregation of information, it's analysis and examination lead to true insight into how to better serve and unlocked an experience that feels natural. The central hub of this is Adobe Analytics, it's utilisation has been recognised as pivotal to the success of achieving a seamless customer experience. You understand that a truly amazing customer experience comes from so much more than everything just working. The opportunities here are immeasurable, to make simple this critical product, from end-to-end, is the challenge that awaits you here.

Company profile:
Utilising a customer-centric approach to financial services by embracing modern technology, they have created a brand that resonates with kiwis. They understood early on that there was an opportunity to address the inherent disconnect between a financial institution and its customers.  To go beyond what was understood to be commonplace, it took all of their learning, their best thinking, to realise something so simple and clear - that an unbeatable customer experience was what was needed.They see a financial organisation as so much more than how it simply works. It's the whole experience, from all points of interaction.This is why it feels so unique to interact with them. It is remarkably simple to see how the embrace of analytics and technology can lead to such breathtaking results.

Role snapshot:
As part of the Digital Insights Team, your scope will be across the entire organisation, with the sole focus on delivering better customer experience. Technical fine tuning of existing systems and data in combination with exploring new areas in order to connect the dots will be your day-to-day mission. You will deal with the full range of stakeholders the organisation has to offer in a collaborative effort to be better. Your strong understanding of data, from flow to show will be looked to on a regular basis from those around you. You will be precise nature will ensure the timeliness and accuracy of the reporting function.    

Is this you?

  • You have implemented and developed a mastery of Adobe Analytics

  • Notable achievements utilising digital analytics in a commercial environment

This is a fantastic opportunity for the right person. If you're looking to join a world-class organisation with great progression opportunities, send me through your CV as soon as you can

An unbeatable team committed to delivering a better service through analytics Strive to be better - ambition is key to delivering on what is possible Be the SME of the Adobe Analytics platform

job_summary: The Senior Behaviour Support Practitioner will deliver excellent service to clients and drive growth of a new department.
job_ad_details:
Are you looking for an opportunity to combine your clinical expertise with business development? ISSA are looking for an experienced Behaviour Support Practitioner to lead our newly established 'Behaviour Support SA' department. You will have extensive experience in positive behaviour supports and an interest in building and growing an excellent clinical program.

ISSA is a small team that prides itself on delivering quality inclusion outcomes for the people of South Australia. You will be a vibrant and easy going person that can work alone and in a small team. We are ideally looking for someone who has a desire to change the world and leave their mark on our communities and organisation.

 

Position Purpose

The Senior Behaviour Support Practitioner will drive the newly established 'Behaviour Support SA' program by using best practice principles to support children and adults living with disability to successfully participate in the world around them. The role will require you to drive key business KPI's, lead other practitioners and oversee clinical excellence. You will manage your own diary and travel throughout metropolitan Adelaide (and possibly intrastate) to provide behaviour support to individuals and their families or carers. This type of behaviour support will require a creative approach to teaching. Guided by best practice principles to develop behaviour support plans, and working in collaboration with family members and support staff, you will provide individual therapeutic intervention to address and meet goals.

 

Qualifications and Experience

  • Tertiary degree in allied health (Occupational Therapist, Speech Pathologist, Developmental Education, Social Work or equivalent)
  • Extensive experience in positive behaviour support
  • Registered with the NDIA as a Behaviour Support Practitioner
  • Registered with the appropriate National Body
  • Strong understanding of the NDIS and disability sector
  • Previous leadership experience with clinical teams
  • Capable of working to a billable hour KPI and be able to work autonomously or within a team

 

Job Competencies Required

  • Understand the importance of being included in community.
  • Have knowledge of best practice principles and support strategies for people with intellectual disability, significant behaviour issues and autism spectrum disorder.
  • Have experience writing and delivering Positive Behaviour Support Plans.
  • Be creative in their approach to therapy
  • Have sound knowledge of the NDIS and the advantages and challenges faced by individuals and families.
  • Experience in providing informative and interactive behavioural intervention workshops in a variety of settings including in schools and kindergartens, as well as to families and therapists.
  • Knowledge of legislation and policy settings and how they impact people living with a disability.
  • Familiarity with using IT and databases to support outcomes.
  • Well-developed networks within a relevant Sector.

 

For a confidential discussion about the role, please contact the Inclusive Sport SA CEO, John Cranwell on 0413 324 484.

Applications close 5:00pm on Friday 29th November 2019.

To apply for the role, please forward your resume and an application letter covering your experience in behaviour support and business development. Applications can be forwarded to therapy@inclusivesportsa.com.au .

job_summary: We are seeking an experienced Business Analyst CRM on a full time fixed term 12 months contract to support the delivery of our new CRM platform.
job_ad_details:
• Do you have practical experience and knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics 365 suite?
  • Are you seeking a challenging role that engages across different pillars working as part of an innovative team?
  • Full time fixed term opportunity available

     

    Dementia Australia is a well-known and respected organisation transforming the experience of people impacted by dementia by elevating their voices and inspiring excellence in support and care free from discrimination.

     

    We are seeking an experienced Business Analyst on a full time fixed term 12 months contract to support the delivery of Dementia Australia’s new Customer Relationship Management (CRM) platform. Based in our North Ryde office, you will work with Project and Change Managers and provide business and process analysis for multiple work streams and help define and deliver CRM requirements, processes and technical activities to ensure a strong focus on customer and user-centred design is built into the new CRM platform.

     

    In addition, you will:

  • Document current and future state business processes including identification of pain points, risks and opportunities for improvement and key performance data.
  • Facilitate workshops, research and investigations to understand end user needs.
  • Perform ad-hoc business process reviews and facilitate user story mapping workshops.
  • Perform business impact analysis and support business readiness.
  • Work iteratively with project teams and facilitate end-user training.
  • Develop high quality project documentation and support ICT and end-user testing efforts.

 

You will suit this role if you are able to:

  • listen to and empathise with business users and help translate their needs into technical requirements and MS Dynamics 365 OOTB functionality – please note, we are not seeking solution designers or architects – rather candidates with strong business engagement and analysis skills
  • build effective relationships at management and operational level and work as a member of a collaborative cross-functional team – this is a hands on role so you will take full responsibility for the end-to-end delivery of a wide-range of tasks
  • find opportunities for continuous improvement during all stages of project delivery – we actively seek to improve our work and embrace new and efficient ways to get the job done
  • lead workshops and analysis to ensure maximum collaboration across the organisation – above all, you need to be a good communicator with strong English language skills who works well in a diverse and dispersed team environment.

 

Key Selection Criteria:

  1. Minimum of 5 years’ experience as a business analyst working on IT, business transformation and improvement programmes.
  2. Practical work experience with and deep knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics 365 suite (e.g. Customer Engagement, Marketing, Field Services, Business Central etc.).
  3. Experience using proven methodologies to de-construct complex issues and business processes, conduct analysis, apply critical thinking and support desired outcomes.
  4. Strong stakeholder management skills with a consultative and collaborative approach and able to work effectively across functional and organisational boundaries.
  5. Excellent spoken and written English, superior documentation and writing skills including presentations and reports.
  6. Strong communication skills with the ability articulate complex solutions clearly to team members and stakeholders.
  7. Well organised, with an ability to manage time effectively and influence others accordingly.
  8. Team player able to take direction.

 

In return we offer, a competitive salary and NFP salary package benefits, as well as a family friendly, flexible working environment with free on-site parking.

 

The position description can be found on our website here https://www.dementia.org.au/careers

 

For any enquiries, please contact Katharine Heather on 02 8875 4605.

 

  • We will only consider applications from candidates entitled to work in Australia.
     
  • We will only consider applications directly from candidates – no agencies please.
     
  • Applications will be considered as soon as received so we recommend you apply ASAP.

 

To apply, please email a resume accompanied by a cover letter outlining your response to the key selection criteria to Recruitment@dementia.org.au

 

Applications close – Friday, 04 October 2019 EOB.

job_summary: Retail Store Manager - Just Jeans
job_ad_details:
• Work in a supportive environment with structured training and induction to continue your career development
  • Join Australia's "Home of Denim" – Just Jeans – an Australian brand with over 40 years experience in denim. Just Jeans is part of The Just Group, where you can develop your career to the next level in an established and successful business
  • Be rewarded for performance and receive 50% off staff discounts on a great range of denim brands

ABOUT JUST JEANS

We're the Australian Denim Destination. Having opened our first store on Chapel Street, Prahran in Melbourne, Victoria in December 1970, we know a thing or two about finding the ultimate fit and style for our customers. Here at Just Jeans, we pride ourselves on the denim expertise we bring to wearing jeans. Alongside all of the quality Just Jeans denim, you'll also find some of the world's leading jeans brands. Our wardrobes are authentic, so we can always be the best versions of ourselves.

Including our extensive online store, Just Jeans now has over 246 stores around Australia and New Zealand, each determined to help our customer find the perfect denim fit for your every occasion. So join the team now, and be part of fulfilling all our customers denim desires – trust us, it's what we do.

ABOUT THE ROLE

We currently have a rare and exciting opportunity for an experienced fashion Retail store manager to join the Just Jeans family to lead and engage a team of 6 at our Chirnsidestore!

To succeed in this role you must be passionate about helping your customer find the perfect denim fit for your every occasion.

DUTIES

  • Provide exceptional customer service
  • Develop, train and succession plan a team of 6
  • Processing and management of stock to maximise sales
  • Daily management of stock and adherence to policies to minimise stock loss
  • Set up of instore promotions and visual merchandising
  • Manage rosters and wage targets
  • Improve performance and productivity of the store team
  • Store administration; including daily reports, banking and cash handling
  • Create a safe working environment for your team

SKILLS + EXPERIENCE

  • Proven experience as a retail store manager
  • Ability provide an exceptional and unique customer experience to maximise sales
  • Proven ability to achieve and inspire a team deliver sales, wages, KPI & stock loss targets
  • Strong visual merchandising skills working from a brief with a creative flair
  • Experience in developing, managing and training a team
  • Experience in succession planning your team
  • Proven ability to minimise stock loss through good disciplines and process
  • Extensive knowledge in health & safety

BENEFITS

  • An environment where great performance is recognised and rewarded
  • 50% staff discounts and bonuses, plus opportunities for product incentives
  • Coaching, training and development plans to set you up for a rewarding career
  • Work for a company where 60% of our Store Management positions are filled internally
  • Annual salary reviews
  • Amazing career opportunities across 7 brands and 1,000 retail outlets
  • The chance to win our "Store Manager of the year award" which has great prizes
  • The chance to attend and participate in conferences
  • The support to run the store like your own and to make decisions that impact your store's performance

COMPANY CULTURE

We attract, retain and motivate high calibre employees. Our outstanding leadership team have developed and nurtured a culture that supports our success. We value speed, integrity, energy, and results. We have a 'can do' culture where employees see the difference they make.

HOW TO APPLY

This is a once in a lifetime opportunity for a driven individual to take the next step in their career with Just Jeans – a place where we fulfil denim desires!Click the 'Apply for this job' button today!

Please note, you will be taken to the Just Group website to complete our application form. You will be asked to enter in your email before proceeding however you may be able to populate the majority of fields that follow or save your application for later without completing all required fields and can therefore apply on a mobile.

$44-50K + 50% store discounts + incentives

Ok where do we start when trying to describe this incredible opportunity? Well firstly the career opportunity is enormous! job_summary: Wesley Mums & Kids Matter • full time permanent position available • great career opportunity • serve those most in need • based in Liverpool
job_ad_details:
About us

Wesley Mission is a high profile, multi-faceted Christian organisation making a real difference in the community. We work with the most disadvantaged in our community by providing over 200 services ranging from aged care, homeless services, child and family care, counselling, employment, training and education, and health services.

Our Vision is "Do all the good you can, by all the means you can, in all the ways you can, in all the places you can, at all the times you can, to all the people you can, as long as ever you can."                                                   

 

About the program

Mums and Kids Matter is a ground breaking and exciting program at Wesley Mission that supports mothers living with mental illness.

The program is underpinned by a basic belief that retaining intact families, rather than having children placed in out of home care, is beneficial for the child, the mother, the immediate family and the wider community.

 

About the role

Mums and Kids Matter is currently looking for a qualified, skilled and experienced clinical psychologist who will lead the allied health team, manage the 24/7 roster, care for clients and develop staff.

The person we are looking for understands the value of a person centred recovery approach and is able to work as part of a successful multi-disciplinary team.

 

Essential criteria

  • clinical psychologist with demonstrated experience in a mental health setting
  • AHPRA registration and member of the Australian Psychological Society (APS)
  • demonstrated ability to work within a recovery oriented model, utilising a person/family centred approach
  • ability to engage and inspire a passionate team through the provision of a supportive and collaborative management style and clear decision making
  • excellent leadership qualities: demonstrated ability to develop and lead a team of professionals to deliver a high standard of client care and support
  • excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • excellent organisational skills with thorough attention to detail
  • current unrestricted NSW Driver's License

 

Remuneration

Total remuneration package: $115,000

Additional option to salary package up to $10,000+ gross up value

  • allocated fully maintained vehicle for personal and business use
  • motor vehicle allowance option available

 

Other benefits

  • career growth and training opportunities in a valuable sector
  • access to free personal and professional support program
  • discounted Bupa health and travel insurance

 

Closing date

Monday2 October 2017

 

Apply now

Please find a copy of the Position Description here: https://www.wesleymission.org.au/about-us/careers/career-opportunities/

 

Please submit a cover letter addressing all of the selection criteria with your resume and email to:

Contact Name: Penny Mayson

Phone: (02) 9608 9629

Email: penny.mayson@wesleymission.org.au

Please note: applications which do not contain a covering letter addressing the selection criteria will not be accepted.

 

Wesley Mission is a Christian organisation requiring all staff to affirm its values. We are committed to providing an environment in which children can feel safe and valued.           

The suitable applicant will be subject to the relevant pre-employment checks for appointment to positions within Wesley Mission (including provision of a valid Working with Children Check clearance number). Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

VMware Administrator

The VMware Administrator will provide technical administration to customers on server virtualisation products, systems and configuration.   1. Provide automation of current operational tasks utilising SysOps\DevOps skill sets

  3. Extend current IaaS offering through vRA/vRO

job_title: Contact Centre Supervisor - Travel between Tuggerah and Sydney
job_summary: Want to work for an award winning contact centre for a global bank? Want to wear jeans while you do it? Come join us!
job_ad_details:
Contact Centre Supervisor, Travel between Tuggerah and Sydney

 

At ING DIRECT we are united by our purpose to help our customers get ahead. We dream big,

making positive differences in the lives of our customers through innovative technology and simple banking. And the fact that we're Australia's Most Recommended Bank makes us smile a thousand smiles. It's a genuine honour and a privilege.

The Contact Centre has a vibrant and fun atmosphere where team work and innovation is key. As the Contact Centre Supervisor you will provide support to our Team Leaders and all the Customer Care Specialists to enable them to deliver exceptional sales through service and customer experience. 

 

Coaching

This role is the lynch pin of the Contact Centre as you will assist/support all the Contact Centre Specialists in the centre to achieve their goals and targets. You will have free rein to design and implement differing coaching styles to suit individuals as well as the group. As one of the Contact Centre Supervisors you will help manage the different skill and knowledge levels across Sydney and Tuggerah to ensure that the Contact Centre Specialists have a good understanding of our processes and procedures and are aware/confident with any changes taking place.

 

Sales

This is not your typical selling environment; we are looking for someone who has had experience with different types of methodologies in sales. You will guide the Contact Centre Specialists with different tactics and ideas around how they can improve their selling techniques. You will motivate and implement strategies to drive high performance with individuals and teams. Your vision will be to create opportunities to assist the business to maintain and increase their results.  

 

Stakeholder Management

At ING DIRECT our stakeholders are very important to us, this includes our customers but also our fellow employees and peers too. For this role we are looking for people who are good communicators, who have the ability to change their style depending on the stakeholder and their needs. As a part of this role you will analyse data to make recommendations in order to drive improvement within the team. You will be managing escalations as well as supporting the Team Leaders so the way you deal with people really matters.    

 

 

About us

ING DIRECT people are straightforward people. We welcome creative, switched-on minds, likewise those who understand the importance of working happily as part of a team. We have a casual dress code, hold annual ping pong competitions, and offer an array of staff discounts!

 

Before you apply

The application process may take up to five minutes, so please allow yourself enough time. And no recruiters for this one please.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Not worked in a call centre? No problem we need your coaching and sales skills! Make the position your own Casual dress code, vibrant and fun atmosphere

job_summary: Site Manager - Te Apiti (Manawatu)
job_ad_details:
Welcome, we're excited about the prospect of working with you as together we create a better energy future for our customers, our people and our communities.  We generate electricity from renewable resources and retail electricity to more than 270,000 customer connections including homes, businesses and farms in New Zealand.

This unique opportunity will suit driven individuals who are passionate about leadership, coaching, developing, and managing our wind turbine maintenance team members, as well as providing the day to day operational management of Meridian’s wind generating assets.

This position will see you leading and managing the Te Apiti wind farm Maintenance Team, ensuring all activity is undertaken safely, relevant legislation is complied with, and Meridian procedures are followed to the highest standard.  You’ll take responsibility for asset management, including turbines, electrical balance of plant, civil infrastructure, sub-stations, service facilities and any other fixed assets associated with the sites. 

You’ll manage the scheduled maintenance workloads and lead the team through a diverse range of maintenance activity.  You’ll also ensure that Meridian’s response to faults and emergencies avoids harm, minimises the impacts to our assets, and meets the expectations set by our Health & Safety and Emergency Management requirements. You will be accountable for the safe and efficient operation of your wind farm on a day to day basis.

What you'll need:

Other than the usual qualifications for a role like this, you will have to have outstanding organisational skills, attention to detail and an ability to follow through on site wide activities.  Wind Farm management experience would be desirable.  You will have a proven ability to help plan and drive the maintenance effort.  You’ll be a born leader and have the experience and ability to manage the team day to day with ease.

Meridian is serious about safety and you will be too.  You will bring a wealth of experience and genuine passion for managing site Health and Safety requirements and sustaining a healthy safety culture.  You’re known for your communication skills at all levels both interpersonal and written.

What you’ll get in return?

In addition to an attractive salary package, Meridian offers benefits that are about making life better and easier, for you and your family. You get a great working environment, opportunities for professional development, and an effective organisation to work for.

You can download the full JD and apply via our careers website. Any further information contact vivien.smith@meridianenergy.co.nz

 

Unique management opportunity working on one of our wind farms Supportive culture and environment Based at Te Apiti wind farm - Manawatu NZ Salary + Incentive + Benefits

job_title: Specialist Site Support Technician | O&I | Technology | Brisbane
job_summary: Specialist Site Operations undertakes maintenance and technical support across a diverse range of OT/IT at our Northern sites
job_ad_details:
At BHP Billiton we support our people to grow, learn, develop their skills and reach their potential.

With a global portfolio of businesses and commodities, we offer a diverse and inclusive environment with extraordinary career opportunities. Our strategy is to focus on creating a safe work environment where our employees are enabled to reach their full potential, where they feel strongly connected to our values and objectives, and where the skills and abilities of our people are a key differentiator of our success.

Come and be a part of this success.

About the role

BHP Billiton is looking for a Specialist Site Operations to work at our Mine sites in the Northern area. The role is responsible for undertaking preventative maintenance and providing technical field support for our operational OT and IT systems including but not limited to; Fleet Management, Wireless Telemetry and Control Systems, Network, Server, Infrastructure, Analogue and Digital Radio, Long-Term Evolution (LTE), along with Desktop, Video conference meeting room support and Security site access gates and camera systems.

In this role you will:

  • Ensure day to day Availability and Maintenance of the Fleet Management, Wireless Telemetry and Control Systems, Network, Rajant Breadcrumb, Long-Term Evolution (LTE), Server, Infrastructure, Digital Radio along with Desktop and Meeting Room support.
  • Provide Subject Matter Expertise (SME) to support teams to resolve priority issues
  • Assist the Technology Supervisor Site Operations in identifying and implementing initiatives that contribute to current and potential value to the business from a Site Operations perspective, ensuring compliance to the Change Management Procedure.
  • Execute work orders as per schedule and relevant work instructions associated with the work orders.
  • Provide input into root cause analysis and subsequent resolution of issues affecting equipment reliability.
  • Ensure adequate scoping of corrective work to facilitate the planning process.
  • Ensure returns of unused or reparable materials are processed accurately.
  • Validate quality of work performed prior to completion.
  • Review and request updates to Work Management and other Master Data as required
  • Execute the Maintenance work plan and elevate unplanned and non-routine activity or performance to the Supervisor.

About you

Supporting a diverse workforce

At BHP Billiton, we recognise that we are strengthened by diversity. We are committed to providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. We are an Equal Opportunity employer and we encourage applications from women and Indigenous people.

We know there are many aspects of our employees’ lives that are important, and work is only one of these, so we offer benefits to enable your work to fit with your life. These benefits include flexible working options; a generous paid parental leave policy; other extended leave entitlements and parent rooms.

job_summary: Are you ready to run the live operations of the new MTS control centre? Join the biggest public infrastructure project in Australia!
job_ad_details:
About us
The future of train travel, today. That’s what we intend to deliver. And it all starts with our people. Positive and upbeat with an ‘anything-is-possible’ approach, the MTS team is rewriting expectations. So, if you have a customer first attitude and are enthused by working in a challenging, future focused, vibrant, can-do environment, then let’s talk!

About you
As Chief Controller (Operational Readiness), you need to be a seasoned people-leader with a substantial rail background and hands-on experience managing all activities in a Network Control Centre. You have experience in incident management, co-ordination and implementation of recovery plans to 'normalise' business operations. You are a responsible mentor and thrive at the head of a diverse, high-performing team. You are able to support the development your team members and foster a collaborative team-work environment.

You are inspired to learn and grow and you’re not afraid to join an innovative greenfield environment where there will be lots of work to do developing plans, manuals and procedures in the lead-up to going Operational in Q2 of 2019.

About the opportunity
Joining the Operational Readiness team as Chief Controller, you will help build the foundations of a successful future for Australia's transport infrastructure by assisting the Operational Control Centre (OCC) in the delivery of key operational readiness milestones. Reporting to the Operations Control Centre Manager, as Chief Controller you will be responsible for:
  • Developing plans, manuals and procedures relating to customer service, train operations, incident and emergency management and service recovery
  • Operating Communications Based Train Control (CBTC) equipment
  • Supporting the delivery of the Train Control facility, including testing equipment performance
  • Participating in the recruitment and on-boarding campaigns for the OCC from day one operations, including leading and mentoring new OCC team members into the rail safety environment.
You will have a tertiary qualification in one of the following (or substantial professional experience deemed equivalent):
  • Rail Operations Management (train movements),
  • Transport and Logistics
  • Customer Service
  • Safety Management
  • Incident Management
Finger hovering on the button?
Aside from competitive remuneration, this role offers the chance to be at the forefront of a brand new industry in Australia whilst developing a skillset already in global demand. During the Operational Readiness phase you will be working standard office hours, however once operational you will be working shifts in the 24/7 Operations Centre at Rouse Hill.

Successful applicants will initially be offered a maximum-term contract until February 2020, and will be considered for potential permanent opportunities within MTS.

Now that we have your interest, we want to hear from you!

job_summary: If you are looking for a role with both scope and challenge in a growing National Company, then this is the career for you!
job_ad_details:
United Forklift and Access Solutions have been operating strongly since 1973.  We've united the world's best brands in lifting solutions - Cat Lift Tucks, Konecranes Lift Trucks & Container Handlers and Haulotte range of Access Equipment.

Exciting Opportunity for a Branch Manager to Build a new business!!!

United Forklift & Access Solutions are completing the final stages of our National network and are now looking for a Branch Manager to establish a new Green Fields branch for the Group in Adelaide.  This is a fantastic opportunity for someone to use their knowledge, skills and experience to build a branch from the ground up and be part of United's National Team.

Attractive package for the right candidate.

The Branch Manager will work closely with the Executive Management Team and be responsible for:

Initial Requirements:

  • Developing a detailed Business Plan covering the following:
  • Overview of Adelaide
  • Market & Competitor Analysis – Forklifts & Access
  • Customer Analysis – current National United customers and prospective customers – Forklift & Access
  • Rental Fleet analysis – existing LTR's to be transferred from Melbourne Branch and start-up casual fleet requirements.
  • Property options
  • Organisational Structure & staffing requirements
  • Marketing Plan
  • Budget to June 2018 and Four-Year Forecast 
  • Start-up plan and the five-year growth strategy.

 

  • Finding suitable premises in Adelaide that are compatible with the business plan and United's proven business model.

 

Next Step:

  • Executing the business plan.
  • Building a formidable team of employees in line with the business plan.
  • Creating a Safe work environment, safety is paramount to our business.
  • Growing a customer base and developing strong relationships with National customers that are already part of the United group.
  • Developing and operating a profitable Branch.
  • Instilling United's Vision and Core Values into the business.

 

United's Vision is to be a United National Innovative Business Today and Everyday Delivering what we promise.  Establishing a Branch in Adelaide is aligned with our vision in developing the United Business Nationally and ensuring we can deliver what we have promised to our Customers and key Suppliers.

Experience in the Material Handling and Access industry would be beneficial but not essential.  As this will be a greenfield branch initially, you will need to be a hands-on Manager working with the Team to grow a sustainable profitable Branch.  If you have a proven track record of strong business acumen, leadership skills and are results focused, we would like to hear from you.

job_summary: Lead a team delivering regional operations to cost effectively achieve high levels of operational availability of Council buildings and facilities.
job_ad_details:
Term: Up to 3 years
Tenure/Level: Full Time Contract
Location: Petrie Depot
Package: 
  • TRP up to $129,181 pa 
  • 5 weeks annual leave

Moreton Bay Regional Council is Australia's third largest local government, conveniently located between the Brisbane CBD and the Sunshine Coast.

The Moreton Bay Region is a diverse area, spanning more than 2000 square kilometres and boasting everything from rural townships to urban centres, coastal villages and thriving business precincts – We've Got It All.

Moreton Bay Regional Council employs more than 1700 staff dedicated to servicing the needs and enhancing the lifestyle of more than 425,000 residents. With your skills, join council's team and help make a difference to one of South-East Queensland's fastest growing urban areas.  

The role

Your responsibilities will include leading a team in the effective delivery of regional facilities operations to cost effectively achieve high levels of operational availability of buildings and facilities owned and maintained by Council.  You will provide specialist technical advice and guidance in relation to maintenance programs, facilities operations and minor capital works, ensuring all works are completed with due regard to Council’s procurement and other policies, Australian Standards, safety, environment and the economic use of materials and community expectations. 

Requirements

To be successful in this role you will hold substantial experience in managing diverse building projects and facility operations and have the demonstrated ability to effectively lead a work team in achieving operational objectives. You will hold a relevant tertiary qualification in a field such as facilities management or building and construction, and excellent analytical and interpersonal skills to prepare succinct technical reports and be a positive addition to our team. 

Benefits

This role with Council offers excellent working conditions, generous employer funded superannuation benefits (up to 12%) in addition to four weeks paid annual leave per year.  Council’s work locations have local parking.

Work Location

Please note that whilst the current work location for this position is specified above, staff may be required to transfer to any of council's work locations with notice. Council currently has depots located at Arana Hills, Bribie Island, Burpengary, Dayboro, Deception Bay, Caboolture, Margate, Petrie, Samford, Woodford and a range of other facilities located throughout the region.

How to Apply

Click on the 'Apply' button below to complete your online application. Please upload your current resume that demonstrates how you meet the requirements of this role. Applicants will need to attach the following documents:

  • A current resumé or curriculum vitæ
  • A covering letter or expression of interest (maximum 2 pages) which details your suitability for the role.

Applications close 5pm Monday 8 April

Role Description

 Click here for Role Description

Further Information

To obtain further details please contact council's Customer Service Team, telephone (07) 3205 0555.

Passionate about helping others change their lives and achieve their goals?

AS A PERSONAL TRAINER YOU WILL HAVE ACCESS TO THE:

  • BEST Training & Development
  • BEST Equipment & Facilities
  • BEST Personal Training Career Path

job_title: Medical Management Case Manager | Contract | Workers Compensation

job_ad_details:
• 12 month contract

You'll be joining a well-established team with responsibility for managing claims on behalf of a large National self-insured client. You will play a critical role in pro-actively and effectively managing Victorian workers compensation claims with a Medical Only portfolio.

The primary focus of this position is to enhance injury and claims management outcomes and the safe and sustainable return to work of injured workers. Reporting to a Team Leader, you'll be responsible for:

  • Managing a portfolio of work-related injury and illness claims
  • Collaborating with stakeholders (injured workers, employers and providers) to deliver personalised claims management strategies that support the achievement of high quality outcomes
  • Working in accordance with relevant legislative and regulatory requirements and internal policies and procedures
  • Providing a service experience that is tailored, effective and client focused.


Skills and Experience required

We're looking for people with a passion to make a positive difference and help people get their lives back.

To be successful in this role, you'll have proven skills and experience, including:

  • Previous Case Management experience
  • Allied health education and experience (ideal)
  • A strong understanding of workers compensation legislation and guidelines
  • Knowledge of the cost of claims impact
  • Strong customer service and interpersonal skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Conflict resolution skills
  • An ability to manage competing demands
  • Be outcome/results focused
  • Experience in determining initial liability
  • Stakeholder management experience


What we offer

At EML, we're passionate about helping people get their lives back after a workplace injury. We have over 1,200 personal injury specialists Australia wide, focused on achieving industry leading return to work outcomes and improving work health and safety for the benefit of workers, employers and the broader community.

We value our people and support them to do their best work by investing in their professional development. EML provides career opportunities and great employee benefits, including:

  • A vibrant, collaborative team culture
  • Great work/life balance
  • A corporate wellbeing program
  • A reward & recognition program
  • Comprehensive learning and development support
  • Fast-track career opportunities
  • Competitive salary packages
  • 17.5% annual leave loading.

How to apply

If you meet the above criteria and want to be part of our team, please apply below with your CV and a cover letter. If you would like further information about this role, please contact Erika Medina on (02) 8251 9046 for a confidential discussion.

Only people with the right to work in Australia may apply for this position. No agencies please

job_title: Executive Officer, NSW Director of Operations
job_summary: Executive Officer, NSW Director of Operations
job_ad_details:
The Organisation

Life Without Barriers is a national not-for-profit organisation working in more than 260 communities across Australia. We deliver services in the areas of disability, out-of-home care, aged care, mental health and support for refugee and asylum seekers.

Joining Life Without Barriers (LWB) will take you on a journey that enables you to build on your existing skills and learn new ones. Our staff take great pride in supporting the people in their community who are most in need.  Working with people brings challenges and joy which will enrich both your life and theirs. Everyday our staff see countless examples of how we really make a difference in the lives of our clients.

Key Accountabilitites of the Role

• Support the Executive in setting the strategic direction of the Executive's Division and Areas
• Develop Business Plans, as required, to facilitate the achievement of the Division/Area's agreed strategic direction. 
• Monitor the implementation of Strategic and Business Plans and report on the achievement of timelines, budgets, outcomes and variance analysis, as determined by the Executive;
• Lead key organisation projects as required on behalf of Executive manager, including the provision of project reporting;
• Develop appropriate briefing materials and preparation prior to key meetings;
• Develop presentations and agenda papers for the Executive and Board meetings, Senior Leadership or other priority meetings.
• Providing high level support to the Executive ensuring they are well prepared for all meetings and workshops by thinking and planning ahead and providing all requisite materials and logistics and sound lead time for the Executive to prepare;

Selection Criteria - Essential

• Experience and understanding what's required to operate at an executive level in a large, complex, geographically dispersed organisation;
• Strategic and critical thinking skills with good judgement and supported by a bias for autonomous, self-starting initiatives;
• High levels of influencing and communication skills including the ability to liaise effectively with internal stakeholders at all levels, to achieve mandated outcomes by the Executive, without the ability to exercise management directive.
• Demonstrated ability to identify priorities, work under pressure and meet deadlines in a fast paced, ever changing Operations type environment.

Desirable

• Experience working in a Human Services or State Government environment.
• Degree qualified.

All successful candidates will be required to undergo probity checks including National Criminal History Record Check and Working with Children Check (where relevant to the position).

Culture

The people who work for our organisation make us unique. We would not have grown to where we are without the energy and dedication that is brought to work every day. We build relationships, are imaginative, respectful, responsive and courageous.
  
At Life Without Barriers we all share the responsibility for child safety.   

How to apply:

1.       Address each item in the selection criteria as a separate point
2.       Put your selection criteria and resume in ONE DOCUMENT
 3.       Click on the apply button below and follow the screen prompts

Applications that do not contain both the resume and selection criteria will not be considered.

For any confidential queries please contact Sameera Qayumi on 9508 4143 or email at Sameera Qayumi@lwb.org.au 

Applications closes at 5pm Friday 29th January 2016. 

Life Without Barriers works with clients from diverse cultural and social backgrounds and life-styles.  Our clients have varied and different life experiences, physical abilities and skills.  We seek to employ people who reflect the diversity of our clients to ensure we can support each client's individual needs and wants. We encourage people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background and people with disability to apply.

job_title: Project Scheduler and Cost Controller - Energy
job_summary: Setup and manage execution schedules and track budgets through the lifecycle of greenfield and brownfield projects.
job_ad_details:
About Us

EnergyAustralia is a highly regarded and progressive energy company. We provide smart, innovative energy solutions for over 1.7 million customers. We’re excited about the amazing things energy can do. And we’re determined to drive positive change. Our passion is to empower and energise Australians towards better energy use. Hence, we have the following 2-year opening available immediately. 

About the role

The Project Scheduler and Cost Controller will primarily work on 2 key projects: The Hallett Power Station OCGT Repower project, and the Mt Piper Energy Recovery (Waste to Energy) project. The successful incumbent will lead and coordinate the project schedules and cost activities - and provide overall execution assistance of the projects as required.

This project controls style role will be involved with setting up and managing execution schedules, and tracking budgets through the project lifecycle.

These new projects are both brownfield operational generation assets along with green field new energy assets. The scheduler and cost controller will also be required to assist with other generation or renewable type projects as required.

Key activities include

  • Provide schedule and cost activity support for projects during the Feasibility and execution to ensure projects are proposed and developed in accordance with EnergyAustralia objectives and specific project requirements.
  • Review contractor documentation including schedules, cash flow forecast, milestone payments and variation claims
  • Utilise experience and knowledge in the analysis of costs, benefits, risks and future business opportunities.
  • Liaise closely and collaborate with the project team to ensure effective business outcomes are implemented and risks managed across projects.
  • Provide schedule and cost support and advice for the development of business plans for projects including early execution advice to support the project approval process.

What we’re looking for

  • Proven experience in Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) with Project management qualifications.
  • In-depth experience in project execution and reporting in relation to power generation or energy infrastructure.
  • Knowledge of detailed design, procurement and construction activities, ideally within a heavy industry or oil & gas setting.
  • Ability to apply theoretical schedule and risk concepts to projects, and interpret and review contractor reports including cost and schedule.
  • Proven capability to develop fully integrated schedules in Primavera P6 and update through execution.
  • Ability to provide advice and direction in regard to contract variation claims and extension of time delays.

How to apply

If you share our passion for making customers a priority, doing the right thing, leading change and want to be part of an organisation focused on making a positive impact, click the 'Apply’ button to submit your application.

For a confidential discussion, please contact Adam DeCaria from EnergyAustralia Careers on 0439 210 281.

Please note: This role is for a 2-year max-term period.  Advertising closes on Monday the 2nd July.

job_title: Senior Inside Sales - Global Software Company - Sydney - New York Induction
job_summary: Software Sales | SaaS | Tech | Sydney | Career Progression | Culture | Global Company | NYC Induction | Work-Life Balance | CBD Location
job_ad_details:
We aspire to be the best place you’ll ever work. We love people. We particularly love people who get the right stuff done and are always striving to learn and improve.

Our culture will challenge you to quickly develop personally and professionally. We’ll equip you with all the training, tools, and ongoing support you need to be successful and give you the freedom and flexibility to excel at what you do.

  • Attractive base salary of up to $80k + Super + Commission.

Life as a Sales Development Representative
  
As a Sales Development Rep, you’ll be responsible for engaging warm leads created by our research team, with the aim of coming up with creative ways to grab their attention whether that’s from calling, networking or emailing. 
  
With market-leading software solutions, the strongest brand in our space, and well-respected thought leadership in your back pocket, you’ll research and tailor personalized approaches to some of our biggest clients. You’ll become intimately knowledgeable about their key business challenges, and tailor insights that challenge their status quo in line with increasing database development pressures.
  
  
What we are looking for
  • 1 + year sales experience in an SDR role 
  • Building relationships come naturally
  • A go-getter with motivation to move into an AE role within 12 months. 
  • Honesty, integrity and a great communicator

job_title: International Travel Consultant - Lower Hutt (Queensgate Mall)
job_summary: Deliver amazing customer & travel experiences and reap unbeatable company rewards + benefits along the way!
job_ad_details:
Did you know working with us you'll be part of NZ's largest travel retailer AND one of the most recognized best places to work? If you didn't know already, there's a chance there's a lot more you'll want to know!  

Why join us?

With around 140 retail stores in New Zealand, that's just the beginning. We're a worldwide network with over 22,000 employees and 30 different companies across more than 20 countries. We provide Our People with professional and personal development ranging from;

job_summary: 12 month maternity leave cover. True HR Generalist role including full responsbility for Australian Payroll and WH&S
job_ad_details:
Hexagon Mining, a successful and established world leader in the development of systems and software to increase mining productivity, is seeking a Human Resources Business Partner for 12 months on a fixed term contract with leave entitlements (Maternity Leave Cover).

The HR Business Partner is responsibile for the implementation of HR Processes and Payroll function for the Australian operations.  This role will also be required to manage Indonesia and South Africa. The incumbent will also support the Global HR Team and the HR Director in the delivery of effective HR practices which meet the requirements of the Global Business.

Major areas of responsibility:

  • Provide guidance and assistance to managers and supervisors on HR policies and procedures
  • Oversee / Manage payroll payments including management of end of period (month, quarter, year) payroll procedures and remittance of payroll related payments, e.g. Superannuation, PAYG tax, Payroll tax, Workers Compensation Premiums
  • Perform the roles of Safety Officer, Rehabilitation and Return to Work Coordinator, and maintain the legislated qualifications required to perform these roles
  • Ensure all safety policies and procedures are up to date and provide training to new hires and refresher training to existing staff to ensure all requirements are being met
  • Training and Development of Managers and Staff - Participate / design on-boarding orientation programs, develop training plans / conduct training needs analysis
  • Salary Benchmarking - Coach managers on managing compensation, prepare benchmark data
  • Maintenance of SAP HR system - new entries, terminations, reporting, position requirements, and organisation structure for the business
  • Performance Management - coach and train managers on managing performance, help leaders define performance goals as well as standards and metrics, monitoring deadlines and progress with staff appraisals
  • Assist with the full recruitment process
  • Provide guidance and management for direct report - HR Assistant
  • General HR Support tasks as required

To be successful in this role, you will have the following knowledge and experience:

  • Tertiary qualifications in HR Management, Business or related field
  • Minimum of 6 years experience in a similar role
  • Strong Safety Experience and understanding of legislated requirements
  • Previous Payroll experience and understanding of local legislated requirements
  • Strong working knowledge of electronic payroll systems (MicrOpay Meridian - highly regarded)
  • Knowledge of SAP HR (Desirable)
  • Strong attention to detail, good follow up procedures, and structured approach to work
  • Ability to work effectively under pressure with minimal direct supervision and in a fast paced team environment
  • Good working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel and Powerpoint)
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills

job_summary: Contribute to building our global commercial media strategy and driving new business that will grow our audiences and deepen engagement!
job_ad_details:
Here’s the deal…

We’re Cricket Australia. And you’re a dynamic and collaborative commercial whizz who has a proven track record in rights or media sales and negotiations. You are a team player who is passionate about developing meaningful and mutually beneficial commercial partnerships with high profile organisations. So let’s get together and you can contribute to building our global commercial media strategy and driving new business that will grow our audiences and deepen engagement. It’s an exciting opportunity to be part of a team whose whole reason for being is to keep delivering entertaining Cricket content to millions of fans around the world.

Culture is important to us, and so is being authentic. If that’s also important to you, this could be a good fit! Naturally, it also helps if you love Cricket!

We are…

We’re over 100 now - and still not out! And we’ve never been prouder of the role we play in bringing Aussie communities together. We are the face of cricket in Australia, and we’re hard at work to make cricket Australia’s favourite sport - one all Aussies can enjoy.

Our purpose is to unite and inspire communities through Cricket. We’re all for inclusion and raising the profile and appeal of each of the Teams (including players), changing mindsets around the inclusion of women and girls in cricket, and creating a fun, rewarding culture that increases attendance at matches.

You’ll be…

Responsible for working with our Head of Media Rights to plan, negotiate and deliver Cricket Australia’s major media rights agreements, manage and negotiate secondary media rights agreements and retain, grow and deepen meaningful and mutually beneficial relationships with all of our broadcast partners. You love connecting commercial opportunities in emotionally relevant ways through your passion for adding value to our partners and fans.

You’ll do this by:

  • Ensuring all our media rights agreements align with the global strategy;
  • Playing a significant role in all aspects of planning and preparation for major media rights agreements, including financial analysis, tactical planning, internal consultation, cross functional team analysis, preparation of reports and negotiation;
  • Proactively driving and supporting renewals, developing revenue ideas, working to capture more value from agreements, strengthening CA’s strategic position in new agreements, anticipating information needs and actively providing high quality and accurate information;
  • Supporting the Broadcasting team to implement new arrangements and deliver on contractual commitments and entitlements;
  • Establishing contacts and relationships with current and prospective partners;
  • Managing negotiation of all secondary level media rights agreements; and
  • Working to secure exposure in current black spot markets.
  • Sounds like lots of fun, right! It is also hard work. Sometimes the hours can be long and there will be requirements to work outside of business hours, including weekends and public holidays.

You will…

Be rock solid at stakeholder engagement and be an authentic values driven commercial negotiator who has a strong understanding of rights operation and licensing content into different global markets. You also have a proven track record in rights or media sales and a solid understanding of IP use and approval. You’re a problem solver who lives by a ‘customer first’ ethos.

You’ll love…

Making your mark by working on commercial agreements that provide value and inspire meaningful connections through the platform of cricket globally.

You’ll need…

Demonstrated experience in a similar role and proven commercial and negotiation expertise. You will also be tertiary qualified in either business/commerce, finance, media or law.

And ideally you will have:

  • Experience in the media/entertainment industry;
  • An understanding of the evolving digital landscape.

Sound like you? Let’s do this!

The work we do at Cricket Australia stretches across the sporting and entertainment industries - which means there are all kinds of opportunities for bright-minded, passionate and friendly people.

Cricket’s a sport for all Australians and Cricket Australia’s a workplace that reflects that. Your age, gender, sexual orientation, disability or religion won’t impact whether or not you’re part of the team. It’s your drive to do great work that’ll help you shine. At Cricket we are committed to providing a safe environment for everyone involved in our sport including children.

At Cricket Australia we work flexibly, offer a competitive salary package and extensive employee benefits including, salary packaging, gym access and discounts with our corporate partners. We also have 5 weeks annual leave!

Ready to see what you can do? Then apply now - we are looking forward to meeting you.

Applications close : Sunday 25 August 2019.

job_summary: Scope provides rewarding careers for Speech Pathologists. We want you to join one of our professional and supportive teams
job_ad_details:
Scope has an exciting opportunity for a highly motivated and experienced Grade 2 Speech Pathologist, with experience in disability including people with complex communication needs, to work for our Communication and Inclusion Resource Centre team, within both our Individual Services and Capacity Building teams. The position will be located at Hawthorn, with opportunities working across Victoria.

The position is available due to Scope’s position as a large, highly regarded provider of quality services who is experiencing large growth in demand for services under NDIS and fee for service.

About Us:

Scope is one of the largest, not-for-profit organisations within Victoria. We are a leading organisation that provides a range of therapy services to both adults and children with physical, intellectual and multiple disabilities to achieve their goals in life.  We deliver services directly to customers, service providers and the broader community network.

We are passionate about achieving our mission, which is:

To enable each person we support to live as an equal and empowered citizen!

 

The NDIS sees significant and wide ranging reforms to the disability sector and the people we support. It is highly recommended you familiarise yourself with the NDIS scheme – (click here)

You will:

  • Deliver speech pathology services to a range of customers
  • Support learning and skill development of others
  • Support and promote the inclusion of people with complex communication needs within their local communities
  • implement a range of CIRC projects and services including NECAS/KidsChat; therapy, communication access and/or accessible information

About you:

  • A recognised qualification in Speech Pathology
  • Practising membership of Speech Pathology Australia.
  • A least four years clinical experience with children or adults in a range of models of service provision, particularly with people with complex communication needs.
  • Demonstrated experience in the provision of therapy within the disability, human services or community sector
  • An understanding and sensitivity to the rights and dignity of people with disabilities in line with current legislation
  • Experience in working and/or supporting people with disabilities
  • A demonstrated ability to write concise reports targeted for specific purposes
  • A commitment to develop accessible and inclusive communities

Scope as an Employer:

Successful candidates will enjoy a range of staff benefits including:

  • flexibility to suit your work-life balance;
  • access to professional support and development opportunities;
  • up to 18K salary packaging which can significantly increase your take home pay;
  • generous Long Service Leave (26 weeks at full pay after 15 years);
  • an allocated professional development support allowance per annum;
  • annual leave loading of 17.5%;
  • 12 days of personal/carers leave per annum; and
  • up to 10 weeks of paid Maternity/Adoption Leave

Other information:

Position Description: Click Here

Questions: Naomi Rezzani – Manager Individual Service, Communication and Inclusion Resource Centre  – nrezzani@scopeaust.org.au

Additionally, you will serve as an integral link between the Nurse Unit Managers (NUM) and the Non-Clinical Ward Support Manager as you assist in resolving issues and finding solutions to problems.

You will demonstrate strong capability to develop a strong understanding of relevant processes and procedures and be confident to guide others to deliver services accordingly - As the main goal of the PSA /SSA Team is to deliver services productively and proactively to ensure client satisfaction, you will also be highly focused and results-driven.

Specifically, to a successful Patient Services Support Supervisor, you demonstrate the following:

• Hold a Certificate III in Health Support Services or Health Services Assistance
• An Understanding of Occupational Health & Safety principles
• A high level of customer service
• Working knowledge of MS Office suite
• Excellent organisational & communication skills

• Ability to organise workflows and ensure that employees understand their duties or delegated tasks

• Ability to receive complaints and resolve problems

job_title: Legal Recruitment Consultant - Join a Market Leader with a difference
job_summary: Use your recruitment skills in a blue-chip market.  Join a leading executive recruiter. Relaxed, sensible environment & market leading remuneration...
job_ad_details:
At Burgess Paluch we offer a relaxed, flexible and professional team environment and significant career opportunities. With an enjoyable work environment, reasonable hours, some travel, local and international clients, an entertainment budget and a market leading incentive program, we are the leading Melbourne based legal recruitment agency.

Our Sydney office has been up and running now for over 3 years and has garnered a wealth of clients and a strong pool of lawyers, covering law firms, in-house and government. While we are enjoying significant successes in Sydney, the time has come to add a switched-on and self motivated recruiter to our Sydney team.

Working as a legal recruiter offers the best of both worlds for the right lawyer. You will be encouraged to maintain links to the profession, be treated as a professional and afforded a level of autonomy (with support) that is rarely available. We don't believe in timesheets or budgets or even KPI's. At Burgess Paluch you'll be well rewarded financially and be encouraged to develop your own areas of interest and specialty. 

As a high-performing recruiter you will work fewer hours and be rewarded based on performance, rather than post-admission experience. In return, you will deliver prompt and active service to the expanding pool of Sydney lawyers who consider us their legal recruiter. You will provide strategic advice to lawyers and employers, and assist lawyers to advance their career. You will be guided and mentored by a senior, leading Sydney legal recruiter with a wealth of experience. 

Burgess Paluch and its sister company Kaleidoscope Legal Recruitment are firmly entrenched as leaders in the southern markets and we service an enviable client base. We would like you to help us achieve this in Sydney.

To be considered for this role you will be a switched on and outgoing lawyer with strong networks, the ability to make things happen, influence others and learn from us. 

Confidential enquiries are encouraged to contact Paul Burgess on 03 8676 0372 or via email to paul@bplr.com.au Lawyers with 2+ years of post-admission experience are likely to be of interest. Other successful legal recruiters are welcome to apply and to discuss our market leading incentive scheme openly.

job_title: Director - Programs (Health & Safety strategic program development)
job_summary: A pivotal role in engaging internal and external stakeholders to operationalise the Health & Safety strategic framework.
job_ad_details:
At WorkSafe our passion for the wellbeing of Victorian workers brings us together. Our people come from a wide range of professions and with no two days ever being the same, diverse thinking comes naturally to us. As we build the WorkSafe of the future we're committed to delivering industry best practice to our people, our customers and the community.

Founded on care and driven by collaboration, our Health and Safety Business Unit is committed to getting Victorians home safely every day. We're growing our team with people whose expertise, insight and passion will help us reach our goals for a safer Victoria.

WorkSafe is relocating its headquarters to Geelong by 2018. Prior to this date, this role will be based at 222 Exhibition Street, Melbourne.

About the role

As the Director of Programs you will be responsible for leading and facilitating the delivery of the strategic Health & Safety Improvement Programs; aimed at reducing injury, illness and fatalities in Victoria workplaces. Working collaboratively with key business partners, you will lead a team where the overall focus is aligned with Health & Safety strategy and a whole of business focus. In addition, you will be responsible for:

  • Providing valuable leadership by promoting collaboration, innovation and excellence to achieve objectives
  • Contributing to overall business unit - development of strategy, policy, reporting and evaluation frameworks
  • Lead and consistently drive strategic collaboration and engagement of key stakeholders
  • Managing multiple programs on time and to budget with measurable outcomes

Skills & experience

  • Proven experience in Senior Leadership with strategic program planning and management
  • Ability to provide leadership and motivation to team and stakeholders to deliver high quality results
  • Highly developed conceptual and analytical skillset - commercial and organisational acumen, as well as ability in development of government policy
  • Ideally knowledge/experience working in Occupational Health & Safety, with understanding of regulatory approaches
  • High-level interpersonal and communication skills, including negotiation and influence at a senior level

Benefits & culture

In return we offer a range of great benefits, including work variety, workplace flexibility and leave options, learning and development opportunities, study support, a leading health and wellbeing program, contribution to gym memberships and prescription eye wear and discounted corporate health insurance rates. WorkSafe prides itself on being a great place to work.

No applications from recruitment agencies will be accepted.

Only people with the right to work in Australia may apply for this position. You may be required to undergo a National Police Check as part of the recruitment process.

Applications close midnight Wednesday 31st May 2017. Click the link to apply, and join us in making a difference to Victorian lives.

WorkSafe are striving to build a diverse workforce that reflects the Victorian community we serve.

Key leadership position Be part of the strategic delivery of Health & Safety Improvement Programs Melbourne based until June 2018
