job_summary: This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a team where you can make a difference. This role is pivotal to the success of our business
job_ad_details:
About Our Business

Alliance Airlines is a mining services company providing charter aircraft operations to Australia's leading businesses. We operate from bases in Brisbane, Townsville, Cairns, Adelaide, Essendon, Perth as well as Auckland NZ with a focus on delivering operational excellence to all of our clients.

The Position

The Senior Base Flight Attendant has the responsibility is to ensure effective management of Flight Attendants and provide leadership, support and performance management to Flight Attendants in the Perth base. This is a management role will however will require some flying duties.

The Senior Base Flight Attendant is responsible for but not limited to:

  • To actively promote and positively support Company business initiatives

  • Ensuring competing demands are prioritised to achieve team and organisational goals and objectives

  • Ensuring standards / procedures are maintained to an optimum standard, including In-flight customer service standards

  • Working closely and liaising with other departments to clearly define their expectations of the Flight Attendant department

  • Planning, conducting and leading regular meetings with Flight Attendants within the base and report agenda outcomes to the Flight Attendant Manager

  • Completing delegated tasks as directed by the Flight Attendant Manager

  • Sharing expertise to actively nurture positive working relationships

  • Leading by example and maintaining a professional attitude and corporate appearance at all times

  • Ensuring the highest quality of cabin safety through the effective management of Flight Attendants with cabin related matters

To Be Successful

To be successful you must possess the relevant experience and meet the specific requirements together with personal qualities of enthusiasm, self-motivation and demonstrated commitment to exceptional quality and high standards of work output. 

Essential requirements:

  • Exceptional staff management skills

  • Demonstrated ability to lead a large team

  • Strong people skills displaying strong leadership qualities and the ability to mentor individuals

  • Knowledge of CASA safety regulations

  • Face to face customer service experience

  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills

  • Well-developed computing skills, particularly Microsoft office suite of programs

  • Experience in a similar position is highly desired

Due to the flying duties associated with this position you must also hold:

  • Current First Aid (min 6 month validity)

  • Current CPR (min 6 month validity)

  • RSA

  • Passport (with minimum 6 month validity)

  • Ability to pass a medical by an approved company DAME

  • Ability to obtain an ASIC

To submit your application in strict confidence, please apply now. 

**Previous Applicants need not apply**

job_summary: QUT - an award winning university for the real world, seeks a Chief Data Officer to lead he enterprise-wide data, information and requirements.
job_ad_details:
Chief Data Officer
QUT

  • Newly created role - Kelvin Grove Campus
  • Drive whole of business contemporary data strategies
  • Highly competitive salary package


The Company:
QUT - is an award winning university for the real world, with one of fastest growing research facilities in Australia and courses that are in high demand globally. With an increased focus on whole of business transformation, strategies and key performance indicators that deliver greater physical and virtual learning environments, greater research solutions and strengthening broader community partnerships - QUT is positioning itself to be one of the great universities of the world.


The Role:
Reporting to the Executive Directory, Finance & Resource Planning, the Chief Data Officer will lead the enterprise-wide data, information and reporting requirements, whilst ensuring data management as an asset is used as an effective strategic business tool. Primarily the role will drive strategic direction and effective management in the areas of data warehousing, analysis, reporting, business intelligence capabilities, as well as the ongoing development of centralised systems and infrastructure.


With a focus on change management, you will lead the university in the development and management of all data management requirements. The role is also responsible for the leadership of a highly skilled technical team, budget management and the development of robust governance and metadata management policies and practices. A major responsibility will be the ability to work collaboratively with internal and external business partners and engage stakeholders to drive the development a cohesive enterprise data warehouse asset including BI & Cloud strategies.


The successful applicant will demonstrate superior business insight and the use of data and information to drive business outcomes.


The Person/You:
To be considered for this position you will possess tertiary qualifications in a relevant business discipline (MBA or Masters of Information Technology will be highly regarded) and experience from within a multi layered complex services or corporate environment. Broad experience of managing data strategies and analytics, people and business leadership capabilities, and the ability to negotiate and influence outcomes are necessary skills to be successful in this role.

This opportunity suits an individual with a proven track record in building and maintaining collaborative professional relationships with a diverse range of stakeholders including executive management, employees and the broader business community. This is a rare and exciting opportunity in the Brisbane market, which will offers an outstanding and broad career!

For a confidential discussion about this excellent opportunity call Kim Ritchie on 07 3230 0025/0412 156 920 or email kim@edenritchie.com.au

job_summary: Can you provide technical advice and assistance across the architecture, design, development and implementation of corporate databases and services?
job_ad_details:
About the Job

Position located in Adelaide, South Australia

We have a great continuing opportunity for a Senior Database Administrator to join our team.

The University’s Research and Data Management Support team ensures the effective and efficient delivery of specific information technology solutions using a variety of technologies including: C#, NET, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Python, XML, XLST, Postgres, Microsoft SQL and Oracle.

The Research and Data Management Support team cross-skills over applications and database technologies to manage, develop and support the University’s Research Systems and Data Management Infrastructure to ensure business objectives are met.

This position will be responsible for designing, developing, implementing and supporting corporate and research data management environments using a variety of database technologies encompassing Oracle, SQL Server, Web Logic, PostgreSQL, MariaDB and corporate batch scheduling.

Skills and Experience

We are looking for an excellent communicator to provide technical advice and assistance across the architecture, design, development and implementation of corporate databases and services.

If you are able to demonstrate experience in implementing application, database and operating system security in a large and complex information technology environment. Please apply now.

Experience in the use of Unix and programming languages including SQL and database tools, support of Oracle Web Logic, MS SQL Server, Postgres, MariaDB and modern methods of data integration are essential in this role.

A University of Enterprise

The University of South Australia (UniSA) is an innovative, outward-looking institution known for its strong and engaged research and its experientially-based teaching and learning that is conducted in close collaboration with business, industry, government and the professions.

In recent years, we have maintained a strong upward trajectory across a number of key indicators and are ranked among the world’s top 50 young institutions. We are committed to international education activities and alumni, graduates who are equipped to meet the demands and expectations of the worldwide workforce, a culturally diverse staff and increasing student mobility.

Benefits on Offer

At UniSA, we seek to enrich people’s lives through the creation and application of knowledge. Our staff love to be a part of an organisational culture that promotes a strong commitment to educating professionals, sharing knowledge, and engaging with our communities.

We offer a competitive remuneration package that includes generous superannuation contributions of up to 17%, and we have a family friendly approach to ensure you enjoy a healthy work/life balance.

job_title: Data Entry Officer - 8 month fixed term contract
job_summary: Data Entry Officer - 8 month fixed term contract
job_ad_details:
HCF has a fantastic opportunity for an individual to join our Verifications team in a Data Entry role. This is a great position for someone who enjoys a process driven role in a supportive team environment.

  • Work for an established and leading Australian health insurer
  • Supportive culture founded on teamwork, integrity and social responsibility
  • CBD location
  • $55, 457 inclusive of 9.5% superannuation

About the role

HCF’s Verifications team is looking for a Data Entry Officer to join its faced paced team on a permanent basis. The Verifications team is responsible for the first step in the claims process for our members. In this role you will ensure accurate data entry of claims using HCF’s internal software. Responsibilities also include:

  • Support frontline staff in general enquiries relating to scanned claims
  • Data entry of claims using internal HCF software
  • Process as required, rejected, refused, suspended and adjusted claims, using our systems
  • Action reports and perform quality checking processes as required
  • Performance against quality and quantity control measures.
  • Assist the team on project work regarding improvements to the claims process and applications

About you

HCF’s Verifications team is fundamental to providing the member experience we strive for by ensuring accurate and prompt data entry of claims. This opportunity would suit candidates looking for a fast-paced and process-driven position.

You should also bring the following experience:

  • Excellent computer skills with sound knowledge of the Microsoft suites (especially Excel and word)
  • A strong customer service approach
  • Keyboard and accuracy of data input skills
  • Ability to adapt positively to changing work practises and needs
  • Good verbal and written communication skills
  • Polite and professional telephone manner
  • Desire and commitment to work in a team environment
  • Self-motivator, able to perform required tasks with minimal supervision
  • Good organisational skills

job_summary: The Head of Insurance and Actuarial leads a team providing specialist actuarial and insurance advice.
job_ad_details:
The Australian Prudential Regulation Authority (APRA) is the prudential supervisor of the Australian financial sector. APRA’s core mission is to establish and enforce prudential standards and practices designed to ensure that, under all reasonable circumstances, financial promises made by institutions we supervise are met within a stable, efficient and competitive financial system.

Based in our Sydney office we are looking for a professional and dedicated Head of Insurance and Actuarial to join the APRA team.

Reporting into the General Manager, Advice & Approvals the Head of Insurance and Actuarial leads a team providing specialist actuarial and insurance advice to support the prudential supervision and policy development processes of other Divisions and teams within APRA, and to achieve organisational objectives.

This role is responsible for:

  • Effectively planning the objectives and activities of the Insurance and Actuarial team to meet the needs of the organisation and contributing to the overall strategic and business planning of Advice and Approvals.
  • Overseeing high quality and timely advice provided by the team and contribute to Advice and Approvals processes for quality control.
  • Developing and implementing activities that contribute to sound supervision outcomes pursuant to the APRA mandate.
  • Engaging with internal stakeholders and external stakeholders to develop and deliver quality insurance and actuarial advice, representing APRA externally as needed.

To be successful in this role you will have highly developed technical expertise in insurance matters. You will have substantial organisational, self and priority management skills, including proven ability to lead teams and strategic initiatives. The role also requires you to demonstrate well-developed people management, communication, negotiation, conflict resolution and interpersonal skills. Your knowledge of current and emerging global supervisory and actuarial practices and domestic financial market trends will be highly regarded.

job_summary: Experienced fast gallop track work riders are required to assist with the daily educating, exercising and caring of the thoroughbred race horses.
job_ad_details:
GOOREE PARK STUD PTY LIMITED

PERMANENT POSITION
HORSE EDUCATOR / TRACK RIDER

Gooree Park Stud is one of Mudgee district’s most historic and picturesque properties. Within our iconic white fences and surrounding rolling hills the Stud Complex boasts two full size race tracks (grass & sand), two sets of pre-training stables, 40 speller stables & yards, staff & visitors housing accommodation, orchards within an area of 645ha.

Our Racing Pre-training team is looking for motivated individuals to assist with the daily educating, exercising and caring of the race horses. 

The horse educator / track rider position is available to experienced, capable horse rider who can manage young horse work from riding yearling back from breakers through to racehorses in full work and have skills that enables them to educate horses ready for racing.

Successful applicants will also be capable of identifying factors that affect racehorse performance, have excellent horsemanship and stable skills.

Applicants must have proven experience and be able to competently perform fast gallop track work, be physically fit and knowledge in racing matters will be preferable though not essential.

An above award salary package is being offered, on-farm accommodation is available and we are flexible with full time or casual packages. Working Visa holders are encouraged to apply.

This is a fantastic opportunity to get involved in the excitement of thoroughbred racing, and to be part of a small but dedicated team. Gooree Park Group strictly enforces a NIL tolerance to drug and alcohol in the workplace.


To apply email: hellenc@gooreepark.com.au or contact Hellen on 02 6378 1807.

job_title: Occupational Health, Safety and Environmental Officer
job_summary: Ability to travel out to communities and support remote teams ensuring we adhere to our responsibilities with OH&S & develop training programs.
job_ad_details:
Occupational Health, Safety and Environmental Officer

Pilbara Meta Maya Regional Aboriginal Corporation (PMMRAC) is an incorporated Indigenous organisation located in Port Hedland, WA. PMMRAC's main responsibilities are providing essential and community services to remote Indigenous communities within the Pilbara, Gascoyne and Murchison regions of Western Australia. PMMRAC also have privately owned entities which provide multiple services (property management, mechanical, occupational health and safety, laboratory, environmental and construction) within Western Australia. PMMRAC are currently recruiting a full time (fixed term – June 30th 2019) Occupational Health, Safety and Environmental Officer

Main duties of the role:

  • Compiling safe work method statements, standard operating procedures and various other reporting as required
  • Ensure inspections by regulatory agencies are co-ordinated and deficiencies minimised and corrected
  • Provide current, accurate and timely OH&S advice to operational management which is consistent with National and State OH&S
  • Identification of issues impacting health, safety and wellbeing and environmental at sites including the Aboriginal communities serviced
  • Investigation of any issues identified as a result of audits and day-to-day operational activities
  • Maintain all registers and documentation associated with equipment, permits and regulatory requirements
  • Maintain working relationships with Regulatory Agencies and chair or co-chair the Safety Committee
  • Maintaining, updating and managing emergency response plans and evacuation procedures
  • Manage team base risk assessments and the process and regularly conduct training needs analysis
  • Developing and delivering training programs will be an important part of this role as well as auditing, mentoring and influencing at all levels of the business
  • Operational tasks including incident investigations, risk assessments and delivering health and safety and environmental training programs
  • Provision of expert health, safety and wellbeing and environmental advice and technical support to line management
  • Review accidents and incidents which occur in the area of responsibility and conduct field audits, reporting and managing the corrective actions
  • Travel to site including to corporate and operational offices as required and perform any additional duties as required
  • Understanding and interpreting legislative compliance to OH&S and environmental principles
  • Co-ordinate management review meetings for ISO 4801 and 14001 certifications
  • Provide safety and environmental training

To be successful in this role, you will have:

  • Tertiary qualification in Training and Assessment (Certificate 4 – minimum)
  • Tertiary qualification in Work Health and Safety (Certificate 4 – minimum)
  • Workplace drug and alcohol testing certification
  • Minimum 5 years' experience in a similar role
  • An engaging personality and the ability to communicate with people on all levels
  • Demonstrated analytical and time management skills
  • Strong MS Office Suite
  • Demonstrated experience in conducting a thorough investigation for OH&S and environmental incidents
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, managing workload and prioritising tasks
  • Demonstrated knowledge of health and safety statutory requirements, regulations, codes of practice and guidelines, and the ability to translate and apply these to a work environment
  • Demonstrated knowledge of electrical, water and waste water practices and standards
  • Current open manual 'C' class drivers licence (essential)
  • Current National Police Clearance  (essential)
  • Willing to complete a pre-employment medical (essential)

Location:

This position is based in Wedgefield (South Hedland), Western Australia and requires an immediate start. Open to Australian residents only.

Remuneration

The successful candidate will be based on a salary applicable to qualifications and experience. PMMRAC offers all employees based in Wedgefield 4 weeks annual leave and salary sacrifice.

N.B: This position is based in Wedgefield (South, Western Australia. Relocation and/or housing subsidies are not available with this position.  

To Apply:

Please select the 'Apply for this job' button and provide a cover letter and resume, applications close 24 October 2018.

PMMRAC reserves the right to commence the recruitment process prior to the nominated closing date. Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

PMMRAC are an equal opportunity employer. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are strongly encouraged to apply.

Visit our website for further information www.metamaya.org.au.

job_summary: DPV Health GP Superclinic Broadmeadows seeks a skilled GP for our dedicated Family Planning Services.
job_ad_details:
GP Family Planning

Part Time Contract – Split Fee Arrangement

DPV Health GPSC – Broadmeadows

 

Your New Organisation

DPV Health is a leading healthcare services provider operating out of Melbourne’s northern growth corridor. Our professional staff deliver a wide variety of clinical, community health and wellbeing services.

DPV Health is an Equal Opportunity and Child Safe employer who supports inclusiveness and diversity. We are dedicated to attracting and retaining people from a diverse background, including but not limited to, those identifying as LGBTIQ, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, people from cultural and linguistically diverse (CALD) backgrounds, and people with a disability.

A little about the role

DPV Health GP Superclinic Broadmeadows seeks a skilled GP for our dedicated Family Planning Services.

The Family Planning Service has expanded quickly over 2 years, and is now a significant provider of unplanned pregnancy care in Melbourne’s northern metropolitan zone, population 1 million plus.

You will join our experienced GP, who has DRANZCOG Advanced.  When you are appointed to this important role in women’s health care, there are opportunities for you to expand your skills and gain extra qualifications.  This position is currently part time one day per week, but expected to increase.

Your will be offered a high percentage of your gross billings.

Responsibilities

  • Family Planning, contraception and sexual health training and experience
  • Experience (or willingness to upskill) in assessment and management of unplanned pregnancy.

Women self-refer, we perform ultrasound (a quality GE unit) at the clinic, and offer both Medication abortion and referral elsewhere for Surgical abortion

  • Registration to prescribe MS-2 Step, or you will agree to train and register as soon as possible
  • Skill in contraceptive implant and IUD insertion and removal
  • Current Vocational Registration (FRACGP or FACRRM) and AHPRA GP Specialist Registration

Work Place

  • GPs will be supported by skilled Nurses, a Medical Director, Practice Manager and Full Administrative Staff
  • We are transitioning to Best Practice Clinical Software
  • There is a Pathology collection and general Ultrasound on Site
  • We have a friendly and supportive culture, in our modern purpose-built clinic

About the perks

  • Work-Life Balance – we understand that work-life balance is important and accommodate flexibility for team members wherever possible.
  • Health and Wellbeing – we promote health and wellbeing for our people, just like we would for the communities we serve. We provide flu vaccinations on site and free, confidential counselling services are available just to name a few.
  • Professional Development – with access to modern, digital eLearning you’ll have flexibility of course timing with access to shorter, more customized content. Accompanied by face to face training, your continual professional development is always top of our priority list.
  • Successful candidates will be required to undergo a National Policy Check, hold a valid WWCC and Disability Worker Exclusion Scheme Check
  • You may be asked to either provide or register for a Medicare and MBS provider number and agree to donate the total amount from this work to DPV Health.

 

Applications close 02/11/2019

For further enquiries please contact Maria Peronace at marisa.peronace@dpvhealth.org.au

If this role sounds like you, we would love to hear from you. Click Apply now!

job_summary: Help us pack and load orders so we can deliver our goods to our customers on time! Join the supportive and friendly team at PlaceMakers Kerikeri!
job_ad_details:
Together, let’s build New Zealand! We have a diversity of customers who come through our branch and it’s up to us to make sure we deliver outstanding service to each and every one of them.

You will work within a hardworking and committed team to ensure prompt and efficient order processing and delivery. On a daily basis, you will be responsible for:
  • Recording and checking all deliveries/orders are picked
  • Safely and correctly pick, pack and load goods
  • Ensure loads are accurate and complete the relevant paperwork 
  • Operating a Forklift
  • Stock replenishment and general housekeeping

What we’re looking for:
  • Accuracy and attention to detail
  • Alert mind and the ability to think on your feet
  • Good communication and computer skills
  • With the role involving a fair amount of heavy lifting, you will need to be physically fit
  • Full Class 1 Driver’s Licence required
  • F-endorsement and Forklift driving experience are ideal
  • While previous industry or warehousing experience would be an advantage, what matters more is your positive attitude and willingness to learn
This is a permanent full time role - Mondays to Fridays, 7:30 am to 5 pm.


What’s in it for you?
This is your chance to grow your career where you will have the opportunity to develop your skills, while working in a role with heaps of variety and scope to advance your career. This is an exciting time to join our journey as we grow our people and business. We will train you and help you to learn all about our products and the industry which will equip you for a long-term stable career. Plus, you will have access to wide array of benefits from PlaceMakers and the wider Fletcher Building group.

Please note - A full clean NZ Drivers Licence and pre-employment medical/drug assessment are required. Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.


PlaceMakers is New Zealand's leading and largest supplier of building materials to New Zealand’s commercial and residential construction markets. Part of New Zealand’s largest listed company, Fletcher Building, we employ more than 2,100 people in over 60 locations across the country and stock more than 100,000 product lines from concrete to paint and plasterboard.

View other PlaceMakers jobs here [link removed] or visit www.placemakers.co.nz/jobs

job_summary: Join our Property & Development team to provide advice and servicing information to both internal and external customers.
job_ad_details:
• Dynamic customer centric business
  • Great team environment with a focus on Work Life balance
  • State of the art building close to public transport

 

The organisation

City West Water (CWW) is one of three Victorian Government owned retail water businesses in metropolitan Melbourne. We provide drinking water, trade waste, recycled water, stormwater harvesting and sewerage services to over 400,000 residential and non-residential customers in Melbourne’s central business district, inner and western suburbs.

CWW is embarking on a new strategy which articulates what is important for our customers and our organisation with a view out to 2030. Providing focus and aligning the many components of our business ensures we deliver a better service for our customers by putting them first. Our ambition and new focus will be enabled by our people who are agile, diverse and trusted.

Here is your opportunity to join this critical services organisation during an exciting time of change.

 

The opportunity

City West Water are looking for a Senior Property Development Officer to provide accurate advice and servicing information to a range of customers (both internal and external) across all stages of the build over easement/plumbing application process. The successful candidate will be required to attend to the resolution of requests in a prompt and professional manner which includes, but is not limited to:

  • Processing and managing complex plumbing and build over applications, and prepare connection conditions for customers within City West Water’s set target times, addressing CWW guidelines and customer’s needs.
  • Maintain systems, standards and procedures to ensure the work is carried within expected timeframes.
  • Provide support and advice to internal and external customers. (Inc. Councils, Plumbers, Hydraulic Consultants, Surveyors and General Public)
  • Support Property Development Team Leader to maintain a strong team, achievement and customer focused culture

 

The person

We are after an individual with exceptional customer service skills, and well-developed interpersonal and communication capabilities. You will have a working knowledge of policies, practices and procedures relating to Property Development, and of relevant industry legislation and regulations. It would also be beneficial to have an understanding in the aspects of property development and/or construction/design of CWW service connections. A Diploma in Civil Engineering or equivalent alternative qualification, or sufficient experience in dealing with Property Development will be highly regarded.

 

What we offer in return:

  • An attractive and competitive remuneration package
  • Flexible working options, including Work Life Balance and Leave Options
  • A focus on wellbeing (health insurance, flu vaccinations, skin checks)
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Salary Continuance and Life Insurance
  • Commuter Club-discounted Myki

 

City West Water is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We offer flexible working arrangements, talk to us to understand how this could work for you. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of the application to assist you through the recruitment process.

For a position description or to find out more about careers at City West Water and the opportunities we offer, please visit our careers page. You can watch our careers video to find out why City West Water is a great place to work.

Although applications for this role close at 11:59pm on Friday 23rd February 2018, you are encouraged to apply earlier as shortlisting will commence during the application process.

We exist for our customers and to benefit our community.

job_summary: Support the operations of our Mosman clinic, consulting with clients on their journey towards beautiful, healthy skin.
job_ad_details:
About Artisan Aesthetic Group

Artisan Aesthetic Clinics is a premium non-invasive cosmetic skin care brand with a difference. Part of leading ASX-listed retailer Vita Group, we go beyond simple appearance to enhance our clients’ lives. From cosmetic injectables and laser and light-based therapies to body contouring treatments, our highly qualified doctors, nurses and dermal therapists provide a truly tailored experience that empowers clients to look and feel beautiful – inside and out.

Our vision is to grow our state-of-the-art clinic portfolio to pay tribute to the buildings they inhabit and the communities they are a part of. Artisan Aesthetic Clinics is supported by our medical board, a representative team of clinicians who work together to lead our clinics in best practice and delivering highest levels of client care and safety.

Role

As a Client Service Associate, you will be the first point of contact for all our new and existing clients. Your first priority is to create a fantastic, personalised and memorable experience from the initial contact, during appointments and, throughout the client journey. This role is 30 hours per week. 

Responsibilities

  • Liaise with clients to schedule their treatments
  • Consult with clients on their treatments
  • Adhere to business development metrics
  • Follow-up post treatment
  • Maintain client records
  • Communicate client updates with the clinical team
  • Promote our services
  • Maintain the presentation of the clinic

About You

Our ideal candidate will align with our values, key of which is to provide the best possible care and experience for our clients. You will be organised and efficient, a brilliant communicator, eager to succeed, and someone who has an innate desire to help others.

  • Ability to work autonomously with competing priorities
  • Confident in meeting sales targets
  • Passionate about exceptional customer service
  • Engaging interpersonal communication skills
  • Action orientated 
  • Immaculate and professional presentation

Prior industry knowledge is advantageous. An interest in the skin rejuvenation industry is essential. We will provide all relevant training for the right candidate.

Benefits

  • Ongoing personal development
  • Discounts on services and treatments
  • Discounts from our parent company’s strategic partners
  • Salary packaging
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Incentive for referring new team members
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Annual Flu vaccination
  • Discounted health insurance

To learn more about your new team, visit our website at https://www.artisanclinics.com/ or click ‘Apply Now’ to submit your application.

job_summary: Our client, SA Health, is seeking someone who has recently or nearly completed a Bachelor of Business, Finance, Accounting for a Graduate role
job_ad_details:
Following the success of the 2016 Jobs4Youth SA program, Maxima has been appointed as the successful provider for the Jobs4Youth 2017 program. The program will support the establishment of up to 200 entry-level positions in the South Australian Public Sector, effectively training and recruiting the next generation of public sector employees. Eligibility criteria apply to candidates for Traineeship and Graduate vacancies, which are detailed on the Maxima website at https://maxima.com.au/jobs4youth2017-eligibility/.

Our client, SA Health, is seeking someone who has recently or nearly completed a Bachelor of Business, Finance, Accounting or similar to undertake a 12 month position with the Debt Management Services Department at Glenside Data Centre, with relocation to CitiCentre planned for October 2017.

The Graduate Revenue Officer is accountable to the Supervisor, Debt Management Services, and is responsible for the effective and efficient monitoring and following up, across the portfolio, outstanding debtors balances, processing of approved debt waivers and write-offs, assistance with compliance and efficiency reviews and other clerical duties.

The Graduate Revenue Officer will:

  • Be employed within a South Australian Public Sector agency; SA Health, full-time for 12 months
  • Receive practical work experience whilst studying a Public Sector Fundamentals skills set
  • Be required to satisfactorily complete a Background Screening and National Criminal History Record Check (NCHRC) prior to employment

Key duties will include but not be limited to:

  • Effective management of outstanding debts
  • Conduct of referred debt management matters which may include:
    • Preparation of evidence and debt follow up to be provided to the Debt management team.
    • Responding to telephone enquiries
    • Preparation of reports in readiness for management reviews
    • Preparation of debt waivers and write offs for processing.
  • Liaise with the Supervisor to ensure work flow and information is provided on a timely and consistent basis
  • Undertake and learn, assist and fill in for other Finance and Corporate Services positions as requested
  • Responsible for the provision of a general clerical support function to the Finance and Corporate Services division and assisting with general customer enquiries
  • Assist in areas designated and provide back-up and co-ordination as required
  • Assisting in project work and continuous improvement activities
  • Working collaboratively within the Division and across the Portfolio
  • Supporting other team members and undertaking other duties as necessary to meet team objectives
  • Participating in change management initiatives across SA Health
  • Contributing to a work ethos that focuses on the achievement of identified service outcomes
  • Contributing to the delivery of the broader functions of the Division by providing input into the development of business plans and operating frameworks
  • Participation in Counter Disaster activities including attendance, as required, at training programs and exercises to develop the necessary skills required to participate in responses in the event of a disaster and/or major incident
  • Adhering to the provisions of relevant legislative requirements

The successful applicant must possess strong interpersonal and communication skills (both written and verbal) and demonstrate the ability to:

  • Establish and maintain effective working relationships with customers and colleagues
  • Collect and analyse information and to develop effective solutions based upon such analysis
  • Demonstrate accurate and efficient data entry and computer skills
  • Prioritise workloads
  • Deploy professional integrity, maintain confidentiality and sustain credibility
  • Work with minimum supervision applying initiative and/or judgement to ensure timely completion of tasks and/or activities as directed
To apply online, please click on the appropriate link below.Please ensure you attach a copy of your university transcripts.Applications close Friday 21 July 2017.
